loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
El señor Jacinto vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Feliciano Kantuta de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz y trabaja con la venta de movilidades a medio uso, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para reparar algunas fallas del auto que compró ultimamente para venderlo en buenas condiciones y de esta manera mantener su negocio estable


Ya fue cliente de Impro y pagó muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Jacinto lives in his own home with his wife and children on Feliciano Kantuta Street in the Tacagua section of the city of La Paz. He sells used vehicles in order to support his family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to make minor repairs to an automobile that he will sell in good condition. This will keep his business operating. He was a previous client of IMPRO with a good payment history, and as a result, he is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a vehicle that he will resell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells drinks and bottled water. She also bakes snacks which she supplies to big schools. Victoria is also a party and event manager, supplying food and drinks at social gatherings. She has been in this business since 2000.

Victoria is forty-four years old and a widow, and has an aged parent and three children under her care. She said since she lost her husband that she has to work extra hard to meet the children’s expectations and their ever-increasing demands. Support is not forthcoming from anywhere.

She is requesting a loan of N160,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and bottled water to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase crates of drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe vive con su esposo el señor Juan Antonio, quien trabaja en una empresa muy importante de nuestra ciudad, con una antigüedad de 20 años cubriendo el área de almacenista; la señora María Guadalupe se dedica al comercio mediante la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos por catalogo; ella  se dedica a este negocio desde hace 3 años, ya que es un ingreso extra para el apoyo familiar. El motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito es para la compra de más mercancía por mayoreo, para invertir en su negocio para así obtener más ganancia.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives with her husband, Juan Antonio. He works for a very important business in our city, with a history of 20 years working in the warehouse. María Guadalupe sells natural products and cosmetics by catalog. She has been in this business for three years. It is an extra income to help the family. The reason she is asking for this loan is to buy more wholesale merchandise in order to invest in her business and get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale natural products to sell

loans.name: Kamuyusu Group

texts.en:
This is Issa T., Abu Bakarr B., Abdulai F., Abu K. and Kaday Y..  They are small scale businesspeople in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Kamuyusu, a Temne phrase meaning “Be Patient with us”. This is the first loan they are getting from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living.

Issa T. (left) is the leader of this group. Issa was born in Mayolo village, an outskirt of Magburaka town. He is thirty-five years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have two children – one in class three and the other in class two. Issa sells sneakers, tooth brush, tooth pastes, and medicines. Issa has been a businessman for over fifteen years now. He will invest this loan into his business by buying more of the goods he sells.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 31 years old, is currently the good mother caring for a lovely young child. She is married to Sophea, age 32, a local fisherman. Seng S. owns a small store where she cooks and sells some foods to people who need those foods to eat with wine or beer. She normally generates around of US$5 per day which she uses those incomes to better meet her family’s financial crisis. To help reduce the cost of hiring taxi, Seng S. has decided to request a loan to purchase a motorbike which she will use them to pick up her essential ingredients supply for her investment. With the remainder of the loan she will increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike which she will use them to pick up her essential ingredients supply for her investment

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in  Phnom Penh. Since 2007, she has been selling coffee to earn a living and is able to make about US$4.50 of profit per day, while her husband runs a moto-taxi business and is able to make around US$5 profit per day. Kim S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to rebuild her coffee shop and the rest will be used to complete her houS. construction.

loans.use: To rebuild her coffee shop and to complete construction of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Leaa

texts.en:
Leaa T. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Leaa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Leaa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leaa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leaa is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Leaa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Ma. Amor

texts.en:
Ma. Amor T. is from the city of Sta. Cruz Tangub City. She is 39 years old. Ma. Amor is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Amor owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating pedicab transport services. Ma. Amor has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Amor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Amor is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Amor from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair their existing vehicle to provide service

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely G. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 52 years old. Ely is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Ely owns & operates a general store. Ely earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 51-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Saleh has been selling wholesale fruits and vegetables since 1990. He is known for his competitive prices and his good and tasty merchandise. He also knows how to treat his clients who are his friends, neighbors, shopkeepers and others.

Saleh requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Saleh has requested a loan.

When he first started his business, Saleh had some financial issues which didn’t allow him to diversify his merchandise. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Diana Lissette

texts.es:
La sra. Diana F. R.  tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que asiste al colegio de la zona ellos viven en casa de su madre junto con sus hermanas en Acomayo – Ica. 
La sra se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 4 años en el mercado toledo su negocio es diario desde las 5.00 am hasta las 2.00 pm la sra esta separada del padre de su hijo ella cubre todas las necesidades del menor es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.
 Ella desea que le financiemos un credito para la compra de uva y mango por campaña ya que con eso obtendría un mejor ingreso que le permitira ahorrar para los gastos escolares del presente año su sueño de ella es darle la mejor educación a aus hijo para lograr que el sea profesional.
Se le ve una personas bien responsable que goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana F. R. has an 8 year old son who attends school in the area where they live. They live in her mother’s home along with her sisters in Acomayo-Ica. She has worked selling vegetables for the last 4 years in the Toledo Market daily from 5:00 am to 2:00 PM. Diana is separated from the child’s father and she takes care of all the necessities of the child. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She would like to receive a loan to buy grapes and mangoes in season since they will give her the most profit and allow her to save for this year’s school expenses. Her dream is to give her child the best education so that he becomes a professional. Her neighbors give her high marks as being a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn R., 26, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs.  She is a single mother with one child in elementary school. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time.

Katlyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries to replenish her product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she will be able send her child to school and finish a degree while enjoying good health and financial success.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries to replenish her product inventory

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj is 30 years old and lives with his father in Tosontsengel province in Mongolia. Three years ago he started his own carpenter business by himself. Since he never had his own building to work out of this year he started working in his brother in law's building. They now run the business together. Most of the woodcarving and furniture they make they send to the city to sell. In one month they do about 250,000- 350,000 (about $210-$290) tugrugs worth of business. They mostly do furniture for homes and with a loan Batdorj will by nice cedar and ebony wood to make better furniture with.
Batdorj lives with his dad who is retired and on a pension of less than $80 per month. His dad is old and his health is not very good, so along with his business Batdorj takes care of his dad. He is hardworking and dependable. His goal in life right now is to take good care of his dad and make these years good ones for him.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante. 

Así como ejemplo la señora Elva J. quien se dedica a la elaboración de productos de limpiezas, ella compra  todos los ingredientes y elabora los productos de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientes. La señora Elva visita a los clientes y levanta los anota los pedidos y de acuerdo a ello prepara sus productos para vender.

Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de ingredientes de los productos de limpieza que ella prepara para vender.
texts.en:
All members of the committee are mothers who work at various activities with the goal of strengthening their home economies and developing their businesses´ sustainability, with a view toward continuous growth. For example, Elva J. makes cleaning products. She buys all the ingredients and makes the products according to the orders she receives from her customers. Elva visits her customers and writes down their orders and based on that prepares her products to sell. She is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients for the cleaning products she prepares and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for cleaning products such as soap, sodium bicarbonate, perfumes and oils.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is 38 years old and is married to Philip Kurui, 40, who is an administrative police officer. She lives in Karpropita with her family of five children. 

Grace operates a retail shop in Kapropita which she started ten years ago. She makes a monthly profit of Kshs 15,000 from this business and other sources.

Grace was introduced to KADET by existing clients. This is her first source of funding and she has applied for a loan which she will use to rent and prepare land for farming. The amount will cover the rental, labor and purchase of seedlings required. She anticipates a boost in her business and she will use the extra profit to start a poultry farming project where she intends to keep both broilers and layers.

Her future dream is poultry farming which she wishes to start using the extra profit generated from her business as a result of the loan. Grace describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to rent land for tilling and to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
Madame Sokhna S. habite dans la localité de Ouakam. Elle a longtemps bénéficié du programme 
de  développement de l’enfant et de la famille. Elle est parent bénéficiaire a ce jour. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son mari est un polygame, retraité de la société air France. Par conséquent elle exerce une activité de commerce depuis 10ans pour soutenir sa famille et prendre en charge une partie des dépenses de la famille. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 3 prêts antérieurs. Madame S. s’active dans l’achat et la vente de pate d’arachide, d’huile de palme et de légumes. Elle a démarré ses activités  en allant au port autonome de Dakar pour acheter des produits saisonniers en provenance de la Casamance. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour augmenter son stock de pate d’arachide et d’huile de palme, mais aussi dans le but de diversifier ses produits vendus en y intégrant du poisson séché et fume, du citron et autres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhna S. lives in the village of Ouakam. She has benefited from the development program for children and the family for a long time, and she is to this day a parent and member of U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions). She is married and a mother. Her husband is polygamous and retired from Air France. Consequently she has been carrying out a business for the past ten years in order to support her family and cover part of the household expenses. She has already had three loans. Mrs. S. is active in purchasing and selling peanut butter, palm oil and vegetables. She began her business by going to the independent port of Dakar in order to buy seasonal products coming from Casamance. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs in order to increase her stock of peanut butter and palm oil, but also in order to diversify the range of products she sells by including dried and smoked fish, lemons and other products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Joomartbek's Group

texts.ru:
Жоомартбек, 20. Клиент холост, но живет с матерью, с братом который занимается реализацией цемента, с младшим братом который занимается сельским хозяйством, и с сестрой которая учится в 1-классе. Сам также работает со старшим братом. Кредит запрашивается для закупа цемента для дальнейшей реализации.

Анипахан, 32, замужем. Супруг занимается наемной работой, зарплата в месяц составляет около 40 долларов. У нее 5 детей: дочерям (12,9,7,1) лет, сыну 9 лет. Она занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение КРС. Клиентка имеет 2 беременых коровв, с июля месяца планирует реализовать молоко. На кредит она закупит минеральные удобрения на 5000 сом, и на 5000 сом распашет землю.

Гулкакы, 24, замужем. . Ее сын дошкольного возраста, за ним присматривает мать. Клиент занята оптовой реализацией древесины. Бизнесом занимается вместе с супругом. Древисину закупает у народа и реализует в разные районы по заказу. Кредит запрашивается для закупа древисины для увеличение товарооборота.

Гулсайрахон, 32, замужем. Супруг на заработках в РФ, занимается строительством. Она занимается полеводством, выращивание и реализация  сельхозпродукции. На земельном наделе (0,40 га), уже посеяли семена картофеля. Кредит нужен для закупа удобрений.

Мукарам, замужем. У нее 3 детей. Она вместе с супругом занимаются полеводством. В этои году посеяли хлопок. Кредит запрашивается для закупа минеральных удобрений. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Joomartbek is twenty. He is a bachelor and lives with his mother and brother who sells cement, as well as his younger brother who is in agriculture and sister who is in first grade of school. He also works with his older brother. He is asking for a loan to buy cement for future resale. Anipahan is 32, she is married. Her husband does work for hire and his monthly salary is $40 a month. She has five children: her daughters are twelve, nine, seven and one years old, and her son is nine. She does animal husbandry, feeds and breeds large cattle. She has two pregnant cows and plans to start selling milk starting in July. She will use the loan to buy mineral fertilizer with 5000 soms and will plow the land with another 5000 soms. Gulkaky is 24 years old, she is married. Her son is in preschool age, her mother looks after him. The client sells wood in wholesale. She is in this business together with her husband. They buy the wood from the people and sells to different regions. She is asking for a loan to buy wood and increase sales. Gulsayrahon is 32, she is married. Her husband is working in the Russian Federation in construction. She works in the fields, grows and sells crops. On her plot of land (0.40 hectares = about 1 acre) have already been sown potato seeds. She needs the loan to buy fertilizer. Mukaram is married. She has three children. She and her husband are in agriculture. This year they sowed cotton. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement

loans.name: Campanita I Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Campanita” describe que es una hada común que arregla teteras y ollas de manera servicial y sobre todo emprendedora. Describe la magia, la esperanza al solucionar problemas por medio de un sueño y, se identifican cada una de ellas por ser emprendedoras y soñadoras al mejorar la vida cotidiana de sus clientes.
Se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo. El grupo está conformado por 10.
María del Pilar O. O. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 10 años. Estudio la secundaria y es comerciante. Ella se dedica a vender antojitos mexicanos desde hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas y materia prima; así podrá ofrecer más variedad de antojitos a sus clientes y  darles un mejor servicio. La Sra. con ayuda de su madre y hermana llegan muy temprano a poner su puesto ofreciendo un desayuno rico y cordial en los portales del Centro. Se siente contenta de haber obtenido el crédito porque podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y darles a sus padres y su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 
Lucina H. A., integrante del grupo, de 48 años estudió la primaria, es casada y tiene dos hijos (una mujer y un hombre). Ella se dedica a la talabartería (vende accesorios y ropa para dama y caballero) inició su negocio hace 10 años y solicita su crédito para la compra de pantalones charros, sombreros, espuelas, accesorios de charrería en general. Sus clientes compran con gusto ya que son tratados con amabilidad y respeto, tiene precios accesibles, buena calidad y buen ambiente. Se encuentra ubicado en los portales a un costado de la Iglesia. Se nota ansiosa pues sabe que este préstamo será de utilidad para su desarrollo, quiere el crédito para mejorar la calidad de sus productos así como ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. Esta foto fue tomada en el local de la Sra. Victoria García D., integrante del grupo “Campanita”. Esta ubicado en la cabecera municipal de Villa de Tezontepec en Hidalgo. Se dedica a vender juguetes desde hace 27 años, ahora solicita el crédito para la compra de regalos, muñecos de peluche y cajitas musicales. Sus clientes son personas que desean adquirir un regalo a precio accesible, esta muy bien ubicado (en los portales del centro). Se siente feliz al solicitar su préstamo y cumplir su sueño de ampliar y surtir su negocio. Tiene 53 años, estudio la primaria, es casada pero sin dependientes, pues sus hijos ya todos trabajan.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
García D. Victoria	              Venta de juguetes y regalos 
O. O. María del Pilar	      Venta de comida
B. Juárez Bernardita Valentina   Venta de zapato por catalogo
F. Chávez Juana Noemí	      Reparación de celulares
V. V. Sara	              Venta de joyería (oro y plata)
H. A. Lucina	              Talabartería y venta de pantalón
B. A. Ana Maria	      Tienda de abarrotes
I. L. Ma. Del Pilar	      Venta de zapato por catalogo
T. V. Ma. Isabel	      Venta de artículos de piel
Ávila H. Suleyma	              Venta de dulces y comida
texts.en:
This group is named "Campanita", which is described as a common fairy who mends pots and kettles in a helpful manner and, above all, is entrepreneurial. She describes the magic, the hope is the solution to problems through a dream. Every one of them identifies with being entrepreneurial and dreaming of improving the daily life of their customers. They are located in the Hidalgo State. The group is made up of ten people. María del Pilar O. O. is the president of the group. She is 45 years old. She lives with her partner and has one child who is ten. She studied until high school and is a merchant. She has been dedicated to selling Mexican snacks for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to buy desks, chairs and basic materials. In this way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of snacks to her customers and give them better service. Maria, with the help of her mother and sister, arrives very early to attend better to her customers and give her parents and her child a better quality of life. Lucina H. A. is a member of the group. She is 48 years old and studied until elementary school. She is married and has two children (a girl and a boy). She is dedicated to saddlery (selling accessories and clothing for women and men). She began her business ten years ago and is requesting a loan to buy pants, hats, spurs and general charro (Mexican cowboy) accessories. Her customers buy with pleasure since they are treated with friendliness and respect. She has accessible prices, good quality and good ambience. She is located at the gates to the side of the church. She is anxious because she knows that this loan will be useful for her development. She wants to laon to improve the quality of her products, as well as offer a better quality of life to her children. This photo was taken at the place of Victoria G. D., a member of the Campanita group. She is located in the municipal head of Villa de Tezontepec in Hidalgo. She has been dedicated to selling toys for 27 years. Now she is requesting a loan to buy gifts, teddy bears and musical boxes. Her customers are people who wish to acquire a gift at an accessible price. She is very well located (in the gates of the center of town). She feels happy to request her loan and achieve her dream of expanding and stocking her business. She is 53 years old, studied up until elementary school, and is married but has no dependents since her children already work. The other members of the group are: García D. Victoria Sells toys and gifts O. O. María del Pilar Sells food B. Juárez Bernardita Valentina Sells catalog shoes F. Chávez Juana Noemí Repairs cell phones V. V. Sara Sells jewelry (gold and silver) H. A. Lucina Saddlery and sells pants B. A. Ana Maria Grocery store I. L. Ma. Del Pilar Sells catalog shoes T. V. Ma. Isabel Sells skincare Ávila H. Suleyma Sells sweets and food

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase desks, chairs, basic materials and riding accessories

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto H. A., tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos. Tienen 26,24, 22,20,19 y 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de frijoles. La idea es  preparar  el terreno para la siembra de frijoles y darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de frijol, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Carlos  tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, el está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto H. A. is 45 years old. He is married with 6 children, aged 26, 24, 22, 20, 19 and 12 years old. He has requested the loan to sow bean seeds. He plans to prepare the land, sow the seeds and eventually sell the resulting beans for a profit. This is the first time he has requested a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the conditions they offer. Don Carlos has been working in agriculture for several years, primarily in sowing bean seeds. He is sure his new project will go very well. Over time, he would like to offer his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also hopes he will continue to grow as both a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow seeds (beans)

loans.name: 040102-Hoằng Trường- Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Kỷ N. thị (40102025) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hoằng Hóa- Thanh hóa.  Kỷ is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa  (40102).

Kỷ is married and has 4 adult children.  To making a living, Kỷ operates a family member's business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Kỷ has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Kỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Kỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  This will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Kỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. thị Cài (36) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  T. thị Hường (23) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


3.  N. thị Huyền (21) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  N. thị Thủy (34) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her a fishing business.


5.  N. thị Yên (28) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


6.  Lê thị Liên (26) is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


7.  N. Thị Vì (27) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Kỷ N. thị (40102025) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa- Thanh hóa.  Kỷ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Hoằng Trường 2-Hoằng Hóa  (40102).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Kỷ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Kỷ kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2003, Kỷ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Kỷ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. thị Cài (36) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  T. thị Hường (23) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  N. thị Huyền (21) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  N. thị Thủy (34) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  N. thị Yên (28) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


6.  Lê thị Liên (26) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


7.  N. Thị Vì (27) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Mrs. Yeoun Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Sdau Kanlaeng village, located in Kandal province, there is a group of twenty-one people who make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Yeoun S., who was born in 1971, has been chosen village bank president by the other members.  The individuals in the group  will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yeoun S. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family while her husband, Mr. Savuth Koem, is a construction worker who is able to earn a low salary to support his family.  The couple has a problem because their motorbike is broken.  To improve their family living conditions, Mrs. Yeoun S. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike to replace this old one. She is a mother of three children; one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory,  the second is attending the local public school, and the third is too small to work or study. 

All the members are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Ica Camp Business Women. Group

texts.en:
Musu J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called ICA Camp Business Women.

She is 39 years old, married and has three children who range from five to 18 years old. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been selling body lotion, grease, crème, powder, biscuits, milk, sugar, candles, soap, bread, butter etc. in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 58,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more body lotion, grease, crème, powder, biscuits, milk, sugar, candle, soap, bread, butter etc.

She describes herself as committed and serviceable. Her dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Eline is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more body lotion, grease, crème, powder, biscuits, milk, sugar, candles, soap, bread, butter etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with four children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her sister. 

She owns a retail shop in Nabulagala, selling all types of merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, biscuits, dry cells, books and utensils. She buys merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala once a week and uses public transport to and from buying her goods. 

She sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap.  

Besides this retail shop business, she carries out tailoring as an additional source of livelihood. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living. 

Her major business challenge is the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her because she works in a muddy place.  

She aspires to see her business grow and to get enough profits to buy her own house. She decided to join MCDT because of good customer care.   

She resides in and rents a two-roomed house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for both her residence and business, and food.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años, comparte su vida en compañía de su hijo, juntos viven en casa de un familiar. El trabajo al que se dedica es la preparación de pasteles, los cuales son vendidos en su pequeña pastelería, además trabaja en una panadería en donde le da la facilidad de hornear los pasteles que ella misma prepara. Disfruta su trabajo cada día, ya que le encanta elaborar pasteles y considera que es un trabajo donde puede ejecutar todo su potencial y habilidad en la  decoración, además que le es rentable y gratificante. Espera para el futuro mejorar sus ventas. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de harina y bandejas para la elaboración de pasteles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and shares her life with her son and they live together in a family home. She makes cakes, which she sells from her small cake shop. She also works in a bakery, where she is able to bake her cakes. She enjoys her work each day because she likes making cakes and she considers this a job where she can use all of her potential and decorating ability. It is also profitable and gratifying. She hopes to be able to increase her sales in the future. This will be her fourth loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing, since she has always shown responsibility with her payments. She also likes being a part of a communal group, because the people there are very united and responsible. She is grateful to those who have managed this loan and it will be very useful toward the progress of her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in flour and trays so that she can bake cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour and trays

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar lives with her family in a two-room brick house in an area called 303 EB in Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. A very talented lady, Kousar operates a sewing business. She gets up early in the morning and finishes her household chores and starts sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She makes beautiful clothes and stitches with perfect measurement.  In seven years of working, she has never received any complaints from her customers.

Her family respects her a lot and takes care of her just as she does for them. In this way, she has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. With the loan he will buy groceries such as cooking oil, rice, soaps and lentils to sell in his shop.

Kousar is confident that by investing loan in her husband’s business, his business condition will be improved and her family will enjoy a better life.

loans.use: To stock her husband's grocery shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, D. 55 años, está casada y tiene una hija, Karina D. 20 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en el poblado D. Triboline, donD. tiene su propia casa. Cuando tenía 10 años, le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en cualquier tarea que se le encomendaba, además le gustaba el campo y se identificaba con ello; pero nunca se imaginó que iba seguir los pasos D. sus padres. Hoy se dedica a la producción y comercialización D. cacao, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien, ya que cuenta con cantidad D. clientes, quienes le compran al por mayor sus productos. Por otro lado también posee una panadería, que poco a poco se esta estableciendo, por ello procura siempre D. mantenerlo abastecido D. productos. Su mayor anhelo es adquirir más terrenos agrícolas, en la que su esposo pueda dedicarse a esta actividad, mientras que Nancy, desea implementar con nuevas maquinarias su panadería, para que pueda salir adelante con este negocio. Este es su decimotercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma D. pagos, además está convencida D. que llegará muy lejos con su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra D. insumos y abono, para que pueda aplicar a sus plantaciones D. cacao.
texts.en:
Nancy, 55 years old, is married and has one daughter, Karina, who is 20 years old. They live together in the beautiful Ayacuchana rainforest, located in the village of Triboline, where Nancy has her own home. When she was 10 years old, she liked to help her parents with whatever work they had; she also liked the countrysiD. and identified with it, but she never imagined that she would follow in her parents' footsteps. Now, she works in the production and sales of cacao, a business which is going very well for her. She has a number of customers who purchase her products from her wholesale. In addition to this, she also has a bakery, which she is establishing little by little by trying to always keep it stocked with products. Her greatest longing is to acquire more farm land, which her husband can work, while Nancy (also) wants to install new appliances in her bakery so she can progress in this business. This is her thirteenth loan through Kiva partner MFP, for which she has promised to continue paying on a regular basis. She is also convinced that she will get far with her communal bank. With this loan that she is soliciting, she is thinking of investing in the purchase of supplies and fertilizer for her cacao plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer to use on her farmland

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad D., age 64, is from the village of Pangalalan. She and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Natividad plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 46 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Natividad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. is a hard-working woman who lives in Phnom Penh City. Sam S. owns ponds in which she can grow lotus flowers. Three or four months after planting, she harvests them to sell to people who need them for ceremonies to bless the gods. Sam S. is a widow and has two children, one of whom is now married and has a new home. The other child is single. Sam S. has had great success growing lotus flowers, which is an annual process. She said that her house is getting old and it is not comfortable for her family. Sam S. will use her loan to mend her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Eridania

texts.es:
Eridania es una micro empresaria dedicada las ventas de ropas, zapatos y al cultivo de la fruta chinola. Su negocio se encuentra en la ciudad de Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba invertir en su negocio, comenzando a vender ropa usada con su primer prestamo, el cual tomo hace mas de 5 años. Vive con sus 3 hijos y compañero sentimental. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil ha sido conseguir dinero sanamente con el cual apoyar las necesidades de su familia. Su pasatiempo favorito es cuidar a sus hijos y educarlos

Eridania está muy emocionada de recibir su 12vo. préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de zapatos y fertilizantes para su cultivo de chinolas, la cual es una fruta tropical muy exótica, de un exquisito sabor, muy buena para jugos, helados y comer sola, actualmente solo le falta pocos meses para cultivarla y venderlas en el mercado local y a otros clientes. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y para construir un baño que le hace falta a su hogar. Su sueño es poder viajar por el mundo, conocer otras ciudades y culturas junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Eridania is a small businesswoman who sells clothing, shoes, and passion fruits. Her business is located in the city of Hato Mayor, an agricultural city in the northeast of the country. She starting working with Esperanza International because she needed to raise money to start her business. She started selling used used clothing with the money from her first loan, which she received more than five years ago. She lives with her three children and her partner. She tells us that her biggest challenge has been earning enough money to support her family's needs. Her favorite thing to do in her free time is to care for and teach her children.

Eridania is very excited to receive her 12th loan from Esperanza International after having completed her payments on her previous loan and seeing her business grow. She will use the new loan to purchase shoes and fertilizer for her passion fruit crop. Passion fruit is a tropical fruit with an exquisite flavor, which is good to make juices, ice cream, or eat alone. There are only a few months before she must plant her tress and sell her products in the local market and to other clients. She will use her profits to continue investing in her business and to build a bathroom, which her home does not have. Her dream is to be able to travel the world and learn about different cities and cultures alongside her family.

loans.use: For shoe and clothing selling

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Sra.  Rosa Maria M., es una persona casada, que vive solo con su esposo, quien trabaja de albañil, sus hijos ya se casaron y todos viven  en otros domicilios, es por esto que la sra. Rosa Maria inicio el negocio de abarrotes y trabaja en una maquiladora por la noche, porque dice que se desespera si no hace nada productivo, y ella  al enterarse de los  creditos que ofrecemos, se animo a tramitar su credito, porque es su interes agrandar la tienda de  abarrotes, pero tambien esta ampliando su casa, ya que tiene piso de tierra y ella no quiere que se le empolven los productos, porque despues dan mal aspecto, por eso le interesa mucho poner el piso lo mas pronto posible y dar una mejor imagen  a los vecinos cuando van a comprar  y que ademas, se les quedara como herencia a los hijos en un futuro y asi ella tendra en que ocuparse, porque dice que ya se siente grande.
texts.en: Mrs Rosa Maria M. is married and lives alone with her husband who works as a builder.  Her children are already married and they all live in their own homes.  This is why Rosa Maria started her grocery business.  She also works in a 'maquiladora' (an assembly plant located on the US-Mexico border) in the evenings.  She does this because she says that she hates not doing anything productive.  When she found out about the loans which we offer, she applied for one because she would like to expand her grocery store.  She is also extending her home because she has a dirt floor and she doesn't want her products to be covered in dust because it looks bad.  For this reason, she would like to put down a solid floor as soon as possible and thereby give her neighbors a better impression when they come to buy from her.  Also, her home is what her children will inherit in the future.

loans.use: To put down a solid floor in the premises where she has her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore Group A

texts.en:
N. Benon is the leader of 'Rwenshama Tukore' group in Rukungiri. He is 49 years old and married with 5 children, and he has a retail shop in Rwenshama that has been in existence for over 10 years. On average, he is able to make 360,000/= as weekly profits and his hard work has enabled him to succeed. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, drinks and foodstuffs for the shop so that he will be able to make more income. His dream is to improve his family's welfare and also expand his business.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, drinks and foodstuffs for his shop

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi, married with two daughters, lives in Novomokovsk and earns his living offering cargo transportation services in Ukraine. Vitalyi’s business has been impacted by developments in the farming industry. Rich harvests have been keeping him busy as he travels all around the country with a variety of freight. Vitalyi’s net profit amounts to 6,000 UAH a month.

Vitalyi owns two vans and is requesting a loan of 9,000 UAH to do some repair work on his vehicles. Properly operating vans will help him perform his work more efficiently, wasting less fuel and lubricants. Vitalyi is hoping to generate additional income to help his daughter pay for her college tuition.

loans.use: To repair his vehicles

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells jewelry at Abura by moving from one area to another. She is a widow taking care of eight dependents. Araba has been in this trade for two years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to expand her jewelry business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: expand her jewelry business

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
El señor Marlon C. actualmente labora en el Municipio de Masaya, Departamento de Masaya desde hace 3 años Es casado y es responsable de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

En estos momentos, está necesitando realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda y por esa razón se está acercando a las oficinas de CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la obra de reconstrucción de su vivienda.

Considera que con los cambios que se estaría realizando mejoraría su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marlon C. works as a plumber for the company ENACAL, in the town of Masaya, in Masaya department.  He has been in this job for 3 years.  Marlon is married and two people depend on him.

This gentleman currently needs to carry out some repairs on his home and, for this reason, he approached CEPRODEL's offices so that he can make the necessary improvements.  He considers that the work he is doing on his home will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf has a frozen meat and vegetables store in the village of Beit Fureik, near Nablus City. He prepares the frozen meat and vegetables by himself. He is the father of two daughters and one son, who are young school students. He has been running his store for three years. Ashraf is improving his business slowly by increasing the variety of goods he sells. 

Ashraf took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge to display his goods. Ashraf wants to increase his customers and secure his children's future.

loans.use: To purchase a frozen meat and vegetables fridge

loans.name: Juan Fidencio

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Fidencio Z., es empleado de una maquiladora , es padre de dos pequeños,  su casa la ha estado construyendo poco a poco, en este momento  lo  que  desean es  construir  una  recamara para  que  cuando sus   hijos crezcan tengan un poco mas  de  privacidad, es  por  ello que  al enterarse de esta institución y los apoyos que se otorgan para llevar a cabo el proyecto decidió junto con su esposa visitarnos y exponernos el proyecto de vivienda que el quiere terminar,  que en este caso solo le faltaba poner la losa de concreto en el techo y el quiere terminar antes de que inicie la época de lluvia , de  esta  manera  al  ampliar  su  domicilio sus  hijos  van a contar  con mayor  espacio para  moverse y así como también podrán comprar  muebles  que  necesitan y podrán  acomodarlos  dentro  de  su  domicilio ya  debido  al espacio  tan reducido no podía ser  esto  posible.
texts.en: Mr. Juan Fidencio Z. works at a factory and is the father of two young children.  He has been building his house little by little and currently wishes to build a bedroom so that when his children grow they will have a bit more privacy.  He and his wife decided to ask for a loan from this institution and explain their construction plan and his hopes for finishing.  The only thing he needs to do is to put a concrete slab on the roof and he wants to finish before the rainy season begins.  After adding on to the home his children will have more space to move around.  They will also be able to buy the furniture they need and they will be able to place the furniture inside their home, something they have not yet been able to do as they do not have much space.

loans.use: To build a room for concrete slabs

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Concepción, resiD. en Usulután, tiene 51 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su madre, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, este negocio lo desarrolla desD. hace 5 años, lo aprendió D. su madre, trabaja todos los días D. la semana D. 6:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha presentado problemas en el desarrollo D. sus actividades D. comerciante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ropa para vender, ayudando a fortalecer el negocio y ofreciendo a los clientes variedad D. prendas D. vestir y continuando con su actividad para proveer ingresos y tener más solvencia económica.
Las aspiraciones D. doña Concepción es volverse una gran comerciante, tener competente el negocio e ir ahorrando para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Concepcion lives in Usulutan and is 51 years old.  She lives with her mother and has worked in clothing sales for the last 5 years.  She learned the traD. from her mother and she works every day from 6 am to 4 pm.  To date, she has not had any problems in carrying out her work as a saleswoman.

She is seeking a loan to buy more clothes to sell; this will strengthen her business and offer her customers a greater variety of clothing which will help her to improve her income and be more economically solvent.

Concepcion aspires to become a great saleswoman, have a strong business, and save money to cover her expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es:
Luis, reside en Usulután, es agricultor en pequeño, cultiva maíz y hortalizas, vive en casa propia con su familia y sus dos hijos de 30 y 28 años de edad, tiene dos años de estar trabajando en los cultivos.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos y fertilizantes, estos son muy necesarios y no deben faltar en el proceso de la siembra, ya que son los que permiten el crecimiento sano y el desarrollo de la cosecha.
Su objetivo es recibir una buena cosecha, para comercializarla y generar para su familia ingresos que cubran las principales necesidades.
texts.en: Luis lives in Usulután.  He works farming corn and vegetables.  He lives in his own home with his family and his two children who are 30 and 28 years old.  He has worked as a farmer for two years.  He is asking for a loan ton buy fertilizers that are very necessary as he plants his crops as they allow for the healthy growth and development of his crops.  His objective is to raise a good crop to sell it and earn enough to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Cuenta conmigo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y artículos de paquetería que le solicitan sus clientes a pedido, además otorga facilidades de pago a sus clientes. Realiza éste negocio en su casa desde hace 14 años. Su negocio lo realiza entre los meses de marzo a diciembre.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por lo cual viaja una vez a la semana, para comprar novedosos productos entre estos; ropa interior, chaquetas, abrigos, blazer, joyas de plata y oro. Productos que generalmente son pedidos por sus clientes.
Además transforma todo lo que son joyas de oro y de plata, cuando estas se encuentran en mal estado. 
Con el préstamo comprará ropa y un closet para guardar su mercadería.
Sus metas en su negocio son establecerse e instalar una boutique en su misma casa, para concretar éste proyecto debe ampliar su casa y acceder a los permisos para el inicio de actividades. 
María sufrió un accidente laboral el año 1988, que la mantuvo en una difícil situación de salud, sin embargo logró recuperarse y emprender a pesar de ésta  situación.
Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor situación socioeconómica, además de costear los estudios superiores de sus ellos.
María está muy contenta y agradecida de participar de Fondo Esperanza, ya que con la ayuda del crédito, ha podido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que es lo mejor que le pudo pasar a la dueña de casa y emprendedores, ya que ella ha podido independizarse económicamente.
Respecto a las reuniones se siente muy bien, ya que estas son amenas y el grupo de socias del Banco comunal es solidario. Los cursos impartidos de ventas y contabilidad, le ha permitido aprender e integrar estos conocimientos a su negocio para distribuir sus gastos e ingresos. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Biobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Cuenta Conmigo” (Count on Me) Communal Bank, pertaining to the city of Coronel. She sells clothing and elegant wear ordered by her customers, and she offers them time payments. For 14 years, she has conducted business between March and December from her home.

Maria buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, traveling there once a week to purchase new products, including underwear, jackets, coats, blazers, and silver and gold jewelry – all products generally requested by her customers. Maria also upgrades gold and silver jewelry when it is in bad condition. With this loan she will buy clothing and a closet to secure her merchandise. Maria's business goals are to establish and install a boutique in her home. To do this, she needs to expand her home and obtain the permits required to initiate activities.

Maria suffered a work accident in 1988 that left her with a difficult health situation. But she managed to recover and to get ahead despite this situation. She lives with her husband and their 2 children.

Maria's dreams are to continue working in order to offer her children a better socioeconomic situation, and to be able to pay for their higher education. Maria is very content and grateful to participate in Fondo Esperanza. With the help of loans, it has been possible to invest in her business. She comments that the best is that she has been able to become a homeowner and an entrepreneur, and economically independent. Maria also feels very good about the Bank meetings because she finds these quite agreeable and the bank's members show solidarity. The courses imparted concerning sales and accounting have permitted her to learn and integrate this knowledge of how to distribute its costs and income into her business.

Coronel is a community located in the south of Chile, near the city of Concepcion, in the Biobio region. It possesses an economy based on  services, forestry, and agriculture. It used to count on traditional coal mining, an activity that is no longer carried out, but the “Chiflon Puchoco” mine remains, now converted into a mining museum.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and a closet to secure her merchandise.

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Harold Enrique él posee un taxi. Brinda este servicio desde hace 16 años, el ha logrado aprender mucho en este negocio, a pesar de los diferentes problemas que ha enfrentado como es el tiempo ya que tiene dedicarse a su hijo que tiene 10 años de edad. Este crédito es para la compra llantas, caja de cambios, mantenimiento, vidrios entre otros. Harold tiene muchas necesidades pero sabe cómo educar a su hijo y enseñarles cosas de la vida para que sepa cómo ganarse la vida.
texts.en: Señor Harold Enrique is the owner of a taxi. He has offered this service for sixteen years. He has been able to learn a lot about this business, in spite of the various problems he has faced such as time, since he has had to raise his son who is ten years old. This loan is for the purchase of tires, a gear box, maintenance and window glass among other things. Harold has many needs, but he knows how to raise his son and teach him things so that he may know how to earn a living.

loans.use: to purchase tires, a gear box, maintenance and replacement glass, among other items.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sharifah has a poultry farm business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sharifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Sharifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Adonon

texts.fr: Née en 1973 au Bénin, Adonon  est mariée à un certain Marcellin. Le couple à trois  enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. Adonon vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Adonon assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Adonon  n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Adonon vend des calebasses, des poteries et de façon secondaire, du maïs. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adonon vend des plantes de la médecine traditionnelle.  Adonon s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés  du Nord du  Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit,  Adonon  sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  deux premiers crédits dont Adonon  avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1973, Adonon is married to Marcellin. The couple has three children, who all attend school and depend on them financially. Adonon lives with her husband and children. She takes care of the various family expenses with her husband. She never went to school.
To meet her needs and her children's, Adonon sells gourds, earthenware, and as a secondary activity, corn. In parallel to this activity, she sells traditional medicinal plants. She gets her supplies from a market in northern Benin. This business generates revenues which help her cover her family's various expenses.
With the objective to further raise her activity level and to increase her profits, Adonon is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans she benefited from were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy earthenware and medicinal plants.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 45 years old and is married to Dolores, who is a business-minded woman. The couple is blessed with 4 children and they are grateful because their eldest son is already working. Through their sacrifices, they are able to make their businesses more productive. 

Jaime grows rice and has been doing this for almost 30 years.  He is able to earn about PHP 41,000 from the harvest on his rice farm and his wife earns about PHP 10,000 from her store and welding shop.  Jaime is asking for a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for his farm.

In the future, Jaime hopes to increase the profit he generates from his business so that he can sustain the needs of his family and improve their way of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are attending school.
Mary is a businesswoman. She is requesting a loan to meet the expense of housing repairs.

loans.use: to pay for housing repairs.

loans.name: Rosa Sarbelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 13 y 11 años de edad, quienes estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad, construida en unión conyugal.

Doña Rosa labora en la venta de frutas, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, sus productos los vende recorriendo en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos que es para su consumo y para la venta.
 
Este es su séptimo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para comprar frutas para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un vehículo para trasladarse.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the Maluay community bank.  She lives in the community that bears the same name, and which is part of Valle parish.  This parish has beautiful landscapes to admire, and its people are engaged in commerce, livestock and agriculture.  Many leave daily for the city to work in different areas, and the people maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Rosa is 33 years old.  She is married and the fruit of their conjugal union are the 2 daughters they conceived, who are 13 and 11 years of old.  They attend a small school in the city.  Her husband sells Herbalife products, and the house where they live is their property, constructed during their marriage.

Doña Rosa works selling fruits; she has been doing this activity for 20 years.  Her products are sold by travelling to a market in the city.  She works Sunday to Sunday from 8 am to 4 pm.  At home, she works raising chickens for their own consumption and for sale.

This is her seventh loan through the community bank, and she will invest it to buy fruit for her business.

Her dream is to have a vehicle to get about in.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Djekafo Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe DJEKAFO IV sont des femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Konfon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, AWA TAHIROU, qui est debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  15 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of DJEKAFO IV are married women. They are on average 42 years old and have an average of 6 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative district of Mali. 

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they grow are, among others, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With the loan, Awa Tahirou, standing in the middle, plans to buy inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing costs in order to maintain about 0.25 hectare of groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou markets to customers who are both men and women. 

The group members expect  to make an average profit of 15,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing an small equipment.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 46-year-old hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with three children aged 21, 20 and 8, all of whom attend school. For more than 20 years, John has been selling drums and jerrycans to provide for his family. Within the next 5 years, he wants to have laid a firm foundation for his business to prosper and expand.

John is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy drums and jerrycans for sale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to access credit easily.

loans.use: to buy drums and jerrycans for sale

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es:
María Maritza tiene 22 años es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR 28 de Enero  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El retorno, Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

María Maritza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial del Cantón Puerto Pechiche y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprarse una camioneta para poder transportar los productos para poder venderlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión y escuchar música.
texts.en:
María Maritza is 22 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her mom in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '28 de Enero' community bank is located in El Retorno, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

María Maritza is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in the shopping center in Puerto Pechiche canton and makes her sales in the same town and also in Ventanas.

María Maritza is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests and illnesses.  Her dream is to be able to buy a truck so that she can transport her produce to sell.

In her free time, María Maritza enjoys watching television and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Karagul

texts.ru: Карагулу – 79 лет, пенсионер. Карагул , отдавший 49 лет преподаванию географии в местной школе, является Отличником Образования Кыргызской Республики и известен как человек принципиальный, целеустремленный и ответственный. В 1992 году, в целях изыскания дополнительных средств к существованию для своей большой семьи, Карагул начал бизнес в животноводстве. Начав со стартового капитала в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) , Карагул сумел превратить свою ферму в преуспевающее хозяйство, поголовье которого состоит из 2 лошадей, 15 овец, 5 коз и одной коровы. Благодаря прибыли от ведения хозяйства, Карагул смог помочь своим детям обзавестись собственным жильем. На сегодняшний день, Карагул имеет прибыль от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов в сумме  15,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно.  В целях дальнейшего развития  своего бизнеса, Карагул обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят. Прибыль Карагул планирует использовать на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Karalgul is seventy-nine and retired after forty-nine years teaching high school geography and becoming a Kyrgyz Republic "Outstanding Achiever in Education." He is known as a principled, driven, and responsible man. 

In 1992, in pursuit of additional means to support his large family, Karagul started a livestock business. With 45,000KGS in initial capital, he managed to turn his farm into a successful establishment with two horses, fifteen sheep, five goats, and a cow. Thanks to profits from managing the business, Karagul was able to help his children get their own houses. Nowadays, Karagul has income from selling milk and meat products on the order of 15,000KGS per month.
