Karagul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000KGS to buy two calves so he can increase his earnings, which he plans to use to do repairs on his house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est un homme marié de 34 ans qui vit  sur  le territoire sénégalais. Il a 4 enfants et s’active dans le secteur de la mécanique.  Il s’est investi dans ce secteur d’activité depuis le bas âge sous l’influence de son grand frère  qui pratiquait la même activité. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2008. Il a déjà soldé 4 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées  à moindre cout. Ces pièces  détachées serviront a assurer la bonne qualité de ses services en cas de réparation des véhicules qu’on lui soumet.  Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité et par conséquent d’  améliorer le niveau de vie social de sa famille  a travers l’accroissement de  ses  revenus.
texts.en: Mamadou is 34 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married with 4 children, and is a mechanic. He learned the trade as a young boy, working alongside his grandfather. He has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since October 2008 and has fully repaid 4 previous loans. He is requesting a 500 000 franc loan so that he can buy low cost spare parts, which will be used to fix the cars that his customers bring in. This financing will enable him to make his business more profitable, and he will use the additional income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional clothing to sell for her ready-to-wear business.  Erlinda has been in this business for two years. Erlinda earns additional income from fishing.  Erlinda sustains her business activities by her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF.  Her dream is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Asencion

texts.es:
José, necesita comprar mercadería, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para seguir creciendo y darle continuidad al buen servicio que brinda a los clientes, su compra será en maíz, carnes, queso, leña, repollo, y gaseosas.
Esta compra le permite tener a disponibilidad de los clientes todo lo necesario para la demanda, estos financiamientos ayudan para el desarrollo del negocio en la obtencion de los comestibles, para preparar los menús.
texts.en: José needs to buy merchandise.  He’s asking for a loan once again to continue growing and provide continuity to the good service he provides his customers.  He will buy corn, meats, cheese, firewood, cabbage and soft-drinks.  This purchase will make it possible for him to have on hand everything necessary to meet customer demand.  These loans help his business develop by obtaining foodstuffs needed to prepare his meals.

loans.use: to buy corn, meats, cheese, firewood, cabbage and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en: The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of clothes to raise her business' working capital.

loans.use: To raise her business' working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Lolita has a shop that sells canned goods, soaps and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and soaps.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and soaps

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 45 years old and married with four children. She's from Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Merlyn operates a livestock business raising pigs for sale. Merlyn has been 3 years in her business and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 37 years old and has three children, age 6 to 15. All of them attend school. Her husband sells meat. 

She sells fresh dairy, eggs, and snacks in a shop she has been running for eight years. 

Leonille would like a loan to buy more fresh dairy, eggs, and baking flour for her shop. The profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy fresh dairy, eggs and baking flour to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 33, is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a grocery shop business, operating from the market where town-dwellers are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Samuel dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ariel Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Ariel  es soltero vive en casa familiar de  la ciudad de La Paz,  es artesano y  realiza rosones para eventos sociales y  cumpleaños y para regalos. El préstamo   para capitalizarse en su negocio comprando variedad de cintas para la elaboración de rosones para regalos ya que estas fiestas de fin de año es donde mas venta tiene, por la variedad de acontecimientos sociales, Ariel tiene  19 años  y tiene ganas de  emprender su propio negocio y desea  abrir una tienda ya que el es productor de  rosones y desea poder exponer sus productos, sin embargo  al momento  solo distribuye a sus clientes  fijos según a pedidos,  tiene experiencia en  el negocio durante 5 años, el es un joven muy entusiasta y trabajador con ganas de superación y se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Ariel is single and lives with his family in the city of La Paz.  He is an artisan and makes bows for social events, birthdays and gifts.  The loan is to be used as working capital to buy different kinds of ribbon to make gift bows, since the holiday season is the time of year when he has the highest sales volume because of the social events.

Ariel is 19 and determined to start his own business and open a shop where he can display his products.  For the time being he only distributes to his customers on an order basis.  This has been his source of income for five years.  He is an enthusiastic, hard-working young man who is determined to get ahead.  He is grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of ribbon to make bows.

loans.name: Mary Ngina

texts.en:
Mary Ngina is 51 years old and single. She runs a food stall in Mshomoroni, Mombasa and has been doing so for eight years. Her monthly income is 20,000 shillings. 

Mary Ngina is requesting her first loan from KADET, which she will use to purchase sufurias (pots), plates, serving dishes, and spoons. The anticipated profit will be used to further expand her business. She hopes to own a restaurant in the future..

loans.use: to purchase sufurias (pots), plates, serving dishes, and spoons.

loans.name: Gustavo Geovanny

texts.es:
Gustavo es una persona alegre, emprendedora y responsable en las actividades que realiza. Gustavo vive con sus padres en Otavalo provincia de Imbabura.

Gustavo trabaja solo en la crianza y venta de cerdos. Es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra ed balanceado para la alimentación de sus cerdos, para que esten bien de salud y aptos o de calidad para su venta. Esta inversión ayudará a gustavo a criar bien alimentados a sus cerdos para que en un futuro se engorden y tengan un buen valor en el mercado y poder mantener a sus padres y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Gustavo es poder tener un criadero más grande y poder distribuir a empresas grandes.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a cheerful, enterprising and responsible person in the activities he carries out.  Gustavo lives with his parents in Otavalo, Imbabura Province.
Gustavo works alone raising and selling pigs.  This is the third loan request to Fodemi and it will be used to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his pigs so that they will be healthy and of appropriate quality to be sold.  This investment will help Gustavo raise his pigs well-fed so that they will fatten up and have a higher market value so that he can support his parents and improve their quality of life.  Gustavo’s dream is to have a larger pig nursery and to be able to sell to large firms.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Geisel

texts.es: Geisel es una mujer con 38 años de edad, madre de un niño y es jefa de hogar. Vive con su hijo, el cual cursa la primaria y dos hermanas que ella mantiene desde el momento en que su madre falleció. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, esforzada y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Tiene visión empresarial. Su actividad a través de los años ha presentado altibajos, sin embargo se considera que le va bien, debido a que ha podido enfrentar las obligaciones y responsabilidades adquiridas. Su negocio es una librería y bazar. Está ubicado en su casa, ella acondicionó un cuarto en frente de su casa para mostrar su mercadería, en una comunidad aledaña al centro de Limón. Cuenta con una cartera sana de clientes, gracias al buen trato y forma de pago que les brinda, los cuales son familiares, vecinos, escolares y trabajadores de diferentes comercios e instituciones de la comunidad limonense. Ella va al centro de Limón a ofrecer su mercadería. Ha obtenido varios créditos con la Fundación y siempre ha mostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad. Ahora solicita otro financiamiento para reforzar su negocio comprando cortinas, colchas, ropa de mujer y hombre para su bazar, asi aumentar su patrimonio para satisfacer al cliente; generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Geisel is a 38-year-old woman, the mother of a child and the head of household. She lives with her son who is in primary school and her two sisters who she has supported since the time their mother died. She is a very hard-working and earnest woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She has an entrepreneurial vision. Her work through the years has had ups and downs, however she thinks it has gone well for her since she has been able to face the obligations and responsibilities she acquired. Her business is a bookstore and miscellany shop. It is located in her house, she set up a room at the front of the house to show her merchandise in a neighboring community to the center of Limón. She has a healthy customer base, thanks to the good treatment and the payment terms she offers them, who are family members, neighbors, students and workers at different businesses and institutions in the community of Limón. She goes to the center of Limón to sell her merchandise. She has gotten various loans from the foundation and has always showed punctuality and responsibility. Now she asks for another loan to strengthen her business purchasing curtains, quilts, women's and men's clothing for her miscellany shop, so to increase her legacy to satisfy the customers, generate more income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Hello, lenders! The above picture presents Rosemary, a mother of 11 who has been practicing agriculture for the last 5 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is known for maize farming. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Rosemary. She also keeps a dairy cow. Before joining Juhudi, Rosemary could not access loans from banks since she is a woman and also a smallholder farmer. She joined Juhudi Kilimo and learnt about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva. Rosemary is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Rosemary will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Rosemary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Mrs. Monica A. is 38 years old, and is married with 3 children.  She lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Nigeria where she sells firewood to her friends and neighbors.  Monica cherishes her business very much. A loan will help her purchase more firewood and expand her business so that she can help support her family.

loans.use: to improve on her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to cover the cost of buying good quality cows

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.en: Ilkham is an IDP from Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 1996, and has borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $2300. Now he would like to borrow $1100 ti incrase the variety of goods he can offer.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Ms. Emiliana C. rents a place since May 3rd in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosi in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is 38 years old and has one son. She has been a client with IMPRO since 1998 and made money with the first loan that IMPRO lent her for her cosmetics business. Currently, she is active in selling clothes like trousers, sweaters and polo shirts. She has found a good market for them, which allows her to have steady and sufficient income for all her needs. The loan she seeks now is to buy more merchandise in larger quantities. That is, by dozens so that it is cheaper and her margins are greater than when she buys merchandise for less (be it by units instead of dozens). Her payment history with IMPRO qualifies her as a “preferred client” as all her previous loans have been paid off in total in installed payments stipulated in each contract. IMPRO suggests giving Ms. C. this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Emiliana vive en alquiler en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; ella tiene 38 años de edad y un hijo. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 1998 e hizo su capital con el primer préstamo que se le concedió y su actividad era la venta de cosméticos. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa como ser pantalones, chompas y poleras, actividad en la que ella ha encontrado un buen mercado, que le permite tener ingresos constantes y suficientes para todas sus necesidades. El crédito que ahora solicita es para comprar mercadería en mayores cantidades, es decir por docenas que es cuando el costo se abarata y sus márgenes de utilidad son mayores que cuando compra mercadería al por menor (o sea por unidades, en vez de comprar por docenas). Su antecedente histórico con Impro la califica como cliente preferencial, pues todos los anteriores créditos han sido cancelados en su totalidad y en los plazos estipulados en cada contrato. IMPRO sugiere concederle este nuevo crédito.

loans.use: purchase clothing in larger quantities

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi, 34-years old, married and father of five children, owns a small, traditional snack business in Saida in the South of Lebanon. He is a hardworking person whose work day starts at 4.00 AM to prepare the food that he mainly sells in the morning. The busiest days of the week are usually  the week-end.The snack bar's main specialties are "falafel" (fried spicy vegetables balls), "full" (beans peparation) and "hummus" (chick peas preparation). These are some of the traditional Lebanese breakfast main dishes. Fadi has been a client of Majmoua for the past four years and has a very good record of on-time repayments. With the consecutive loans he received from Majmoua, he expanded his business and improved the living conditions and quality of life of his family. Fadi is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase a tomato paste making machine and a coffee machine. This will increase the items he sells and earn him more income.

loans.use: To purchase a tomato paste machine and a coffee machine

loans.name: Saili

texts.en: Saili is an older businesswoman who never wants to rest or waste any time sitting around. She has seven children, and all of them have graduated from school. Actually, it's her three sons who are doing the hard work, but Saili is the one marketing it and collecting the money. There is no competition in her area, and that’s why Saili is confident in her business. She really appreciates the help of the SPBD office that loaned her the money for her business needs. Saili earns more than 500 Tala ($200 US) a week, and she uses it to pay her loan and  her three sons and helps to meet other family needs. She is also looking forward to some more loans in order to buy more equipment needed in getting the job done because of the increase in customers.

loans.use: To buy a new lawnmower and repair kit

loans.name: Harti

texts.en: Harti is a 31-year-old woman and has been a member of MBK for 2 years. She has a chicken & duck business. She buys chicks and  ducks then raises them before selling them. She usually earns US$20 every two months. She really needs a loan to buy 20 more ducks. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Maksad

texts.ru:
Maksad H. is 58 years old, has a secondary education, is a chef by profession, is married and has 5 children. Maksad owns a small café at one of the city markets in Tursun-zoda called “Sahovat.” She provides local sellers with tasty and hot food. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Maksad will use her loan to purchase a dairy cow for personal use. Because she lives in a rural area, the cow will allow her to get milk to make dairy dishes and she also plans to use some of the milk in her cooking at the café. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамрокулова Максад, возраст – 58 лет, образование среднее, по специальности – повар, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Максад имеет небольшую столовую на одном из рынков в городе Турсунзаде, под названием «Саховат». Она обеспечивает местных торгвцев вкусной и горячей пищей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 4 лет. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать для приобретение дойной коровы для личного пользования. Так как она живёт в сельской местности, приобретя корову она получит возможность получать собственное молоко на приготовление молочных блюд, а также будет использовать это молоко у себя в столовой в качестиве ингридиента к различным блюдам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion to cover her children's college expenses

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa H. and her husband have been married for five years. They have one little daughter. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Channa has been selling bananas and flowers for many years. She buys jasmine flowers and bananas from a farmer in her village for resale at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband grows bananas, cucumbers and vegetables on a farm near their house. He sells his products to the middle man in the village.

Mrs. Channa is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase longans (a lychee-type fruit) on contract and to buy a motorbike to carry flowers and bananas to sell in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase longans and a motorbike

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Mr. Roberto Q. Huchani lives in his own home in the area of Pasankeri on the west side of La Paz with his wife, Mrs. Matilda Huchani, and their six children. Roberto is a policeman and his wife is a housewife. The loan will be used to build a retaining wall in order to level his property to the level of the street for access. This is the first time that Roberto has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably to access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Roberto Q. Huchani vive en casa propia, en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. con su esposa la señora Matilda Huchani y sus seis hijo. El señor Roberto es policía y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención ya que debe nivelar su propiedad a la vía de acceso. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a retaining wall to level his property to the street level for access.

loans.name: Mariadi

texts.id:
His will to expand his business is the reason for Mariadi to request a loan to DINARI. His business of electrical tools sales is currently quite good, with the only limitation of capital to increase assortments of his sales goods. Daily income is sufficient for daily expenses and a small savings. He hopes with the business expansion, later on he could provide schooling for his two children, Elok and Ellen. Today with his wife and two children, Mariadi lives in Kepaon Denpasar , by rentin a house. His family situation is healthy.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Keinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya menjadi alasan Mariadi mengajukan pinjaman ke DINARI. Usahanya sebagai penjual alat-alat listrik saat ini cukup bagus, hanya saja dia terkendala modal untuk menambah jenis barang jualannya. Penghasilannya setiap hari cukup untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga dan sedikit untuk tabungan. Dia berharap, dengan semakin berkembangnya usahanya ini, nantinya dia bisa menyekolahkan kedua anaknya, Elok dan Elen. Saat ini, bersama istri dan kedua anaknya, mariadi tinggal di Kepaon Denpasar dengan mengotrak sebuah rumah. Keadaan keluarganya sehat.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi N., 44 years old, grew up from a farmer family so her main source of income has always been farming and breeding cattles. In 1999, she joined TYM and started invested mroe money into breeding pigs as well as small-scale plantation (for family used as well as for their pigs). Vegetables are much more profitable than rice (up to 2 or 3 times). Having an understanding and hard working husband also helped make life and work easier for Mrs. N.. Of their 3 children, two are still in school while the eldest one is helping them with the family's work. During this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 15 millions VND to continue to invest in breeding pigs and vegatables. Her family income is 4 millions VND monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thi Ngoài 44 tuổi, xuất thân từ một vùng thuần nông nên thu nhập chính của gia đình hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Năm 1999 chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương, chị cùng chồng bàn bạc vay vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, vòng vốn đầu tiên chị mua lợn giống với thuận lợi nhà làm nông nghiệp nên chị đã dành một diện tích nhỏ để chồng rau làm thức ăn cho lợn, như vậy việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị không mất qua nhiều chi phí đầu tư, kết hợp với việc chăn nuôi gia đình chị cũng đầu tư vốn vào trồng hoa mầu so với cấy lúa thu nhập gấp 2 đến 3 lần. Chồng chị là người chịu khó biết chia sẻ công việc gia đình cùng vợ nên mọi việc của gia đình chị diễn ra thuận lợi, kinh tế gia đình ngày một phát triển. Chị có 3 con, 2 con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học, 1 con lớn đã giúp chị được những công việc gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đìn chị xin vay 15.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và trồng hoa màu. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Vosidjon

texts.en: Vosidjon O. is 38 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Vosidjon is a market vendor. He sells  shoes for men in the local market. After 10 years of working at the market, Vosidjon already has got enough experience to do his work successfully. He has clients who always buy from him. Vosidjon is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. He works very hard to give his children a good education and to make them happy. Vosidjon is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new summer shoes for selling. With this purpose, Vosidjon requests $950 for the term of 10 months. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing  new goods for selling.

loans.name: Gashang

texts.en: Gashang is the mother of 2 children. She was born in 1969. She lives in Baku city. Gashang has been in the beauty salon business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for improving her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things to improve her beauty salon

loans.name: Siwa Hashim's Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Siwa H., age 47, is married with 6 children (ages 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, and 26). She has a general shop, which she started in 2001. She works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $435.

Siwa has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start a clothing sales business. She hopes for a new loan to increase her stock and to open another shop with the same items. She will share this loan with her subgroup, Kipawa, members, who deal in tailoring, selling clothes, food, and hotels. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Siwa is 1st on the left.

loans.use: To increase her stock and to open another shop with the same items

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela es una mujer emprendedora que muestra mucho empeño en las labores de su bodega, por los avances que a tenido, su bodega es la más concurrida de su comunidad, porque es una tienda bien surtida y sus clientes pueden encontrar de todo en un mismo lugar.  Sin embargo, percibe  que sus vecinos requieren de otros productos, para satisfacer estas necesidades, Mariela ha pensado incrementar mercadería para mujer, ropa interior, para las damas de la localidad.   Para ello solicita un préstamo para implementar su negocio con nueva mercadería y así satisfacer las necesidades de las damas de su comunidad, como las suyas propios, contar con usted es la opción para que Mariela haga realidad estos proyectos.
texts.en:
Mariela is a hard working person who is very dedicated to the work in her convenience store. Thanks to the improvements in ther store, hers is the store that is the most visited in her community. It is well stocked and her clients can find everything all in one place. Nevertheless, she has noted that her neighbors require other products, and to satisfy their requests, Mariela has thought to increase her line of merchandise for ladies, such as undergarments, for those in her community. She is requesting a loan for this end, to implement the new line of products in her business and satisfy the needs of the ladies in her community. With your support Mariela can realize her goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments to increase the selection of merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Loveline

texts.en:
Loveline O. is 43 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of N70,000. She will use the loan to purchase more clothing and jewelry to stock her shop as the festive season is fast approaching.

She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance. She says the Lord will continuously bless you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelries to sell

loans.name: Mehrali

texts.en:
Mehrali H., a 45-year-old farmer who breeds calves in southern Azerbaijan, is married and has four children, three sons and one daughter. While very proud to be the father of a big family, he laments the fact that his family is very poor, calf-breeding being their only source of income.

To expand the business and earn greater profit, Mehrali needs additional funds and so is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves. Let’s do our best to help this father of four!

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Abdurabi

texts.ru: Абдураби мужчина в возрасте 37 лет ,отец пятерых дочек, жена работает учительницей в школе.Сам Набиев работает в Агроинвестбанке города Костакоза. Его две старшие дочери студентки ВУЗов.Поэтому Адураби ведёт дополнительный бизнес по продаже скота.Пока сейчас скот дешёвый на рынках он хочет в кредит купить две коровы.Он выражает благодарность всем инвесторам.
texts.en:
Abdurabi N. is a 37 year old man. He is a father to 5 daughters and his wife works as a school teacher. Abdurabi works in the Agroinvestbank in Kostakoz city. His two older daughters are college students. This is why Abdurabi has a side business selling livestock. While livestock is cheap at the markets he would like to take out a loan to purchase two cows. He expresses gratitude to all the investors.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Rukhsana Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
"My name is Rukhsana and I’m 39 years old and a married lady. I have been a citizen of a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 5 years. I got an education up to 8th standard but my parents couldn't afford to let me study further. I married a man whose name is S. H. and he is a farmer. He grows various flowers and when they become fully grown he sells them to flower shops and earns income. I help my husband in his flower-growing business. I have successfully repaid my two loans which I took from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I’m applying for a loan again to buy fertilizer and other necessary thing to expand my husband’s plant-growing business."

Rukhsana is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rukhsana baji and Kanizan baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Tahira yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to re-sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to grow flowers

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
La señorita Simona  es socia del banco comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichaya, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D.  56 años D. edad, es casada,  tiene cuatro  hijos y no posee estudios.
Ella es socia nueva con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. tunta, con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo pagará en 3 cuotas mensuales; le servirá para poder incrementar su mercadería y convertirse en distribuidora mayorista D. este producto. 
 Ella agradece D. sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Ms. Simona is a member of the “Ciudad Blanca” community bank in the town of Chijichaya, Ilave District of the Collao Province in the Puno Region. She is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She has no education.

She is a new member of the Manuela Ramos Movement. She has a business buying and selling a dried potato called “tunta”. She will payback the loan of 500.00 nuevos soles in 3 monthly installments. It will enable her to increase her stock and become a wholesale distributor of this product.

She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support of women.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more stock and become a wholesale distributor of this product.

loans.name: Fransisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca del Socorro R. R. tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado y cosmético. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio cada uno de los financiamientos han sido provechosos por lo que todos han sido destinado para capital de trabajo. Los deseos de Doña Francisca son de ahorra los ingresos del negocio y poder ahorrar para poder soportar la situación económica en un futuro. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Francisca del Socorro R. R. is 52 years old and single. She has 3 children who all work on their own. The main occupation of Ms. Francisca is the sale of general merchandise such as clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She has been in this business for 7 years. Each one of her loans has been productive for they all went to increase her working capital. Ms. Francisca wishes to be able to save the income from the business to be able to provide for her financial support in the future. She is requesting a loan of C$ 5500 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is fifty-five years old. She is a widow with six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of her children are in junior high and basic school. Others are in the senior high school. Her husband is a farmer. She is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

Akua trades in foodstuff, such as maize and yams. She buys bags of maize and tubers of yams from farmers in the nearby villages and sells them to food vendors at the local market. She also distributes to retailers. Akua has been in this business for thirty good years and wants a loan to procure food in bulk so that she can supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to higher levels in school.

loans.use: To buy yams and maize in bulk

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en: Yemi is a hair stylist. She also sells hair cream and hair extensions. She has two girls assisting her in the salon. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN (US$ 350) to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn A., 34, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Chea, 57, were married in 1995 and have four sons. Three of them attend school and another one is still young. The family lives on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthorn has been selling porridge in her village for one year; she used to be a silk weaver as well. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi since 1995. He transferred his old motorcycle to his wife to use; so, Chanthorn is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase one more motorbike for her husband to drive as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband’s motor taxi business.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Maria es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Maria vende cosméticos y edredones por catálogos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y edredones.
Maria sueña con ampliar sus negocios, terminar sus estudios de derecho y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Microfinance Institute.

Maria is a 37-year-old single mother with 2 children. She has her own general store, located in her parents’ home, in which she sells provisions and beverages. With the help of her children, Maria runs her business everyday. In addition, she sells cosmetics and bedspreads by catalog.

Maria needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing soft drinks and bedspreads.

Maria dreams of expanding her businesses, of finishing her law studies, and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and comforters

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.en: K. Saifiddin is 25 years old, married, and has a little child. He is a villager in Istaravshan town in Northern Tajikistan. He and his brother are farmers who own 0.8 hectares (2 acres) of land that they use to cultivate vegetables. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer. So, Saifiddin decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Be an important part of the well-being of this young and noble family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar G. is 25 years old and is just married. In May 2008, he bought bicycle repair equipment for 1,700,000 tugrugs ($1,200 USD) and started repairing bicycles; he rents a small room at the central local market for his shop. Uuganbayar not only repairs bicycles bur also sells new bicycles. Before fall comes, he is planning to expand his business and purchase more bicycles from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar, where he goes every two months to purchase bicycles and spare parts at  very cheap prices. His wife Batchimeg works as a saleswoman at a local food stall and is paid 150,000 ($110 USD) tugrugs per month. With this loan, he will purchase a variety of bicycles at wholesale prices to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and new bicycles

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Fish vending is the business of Renato D. Sr. He is a simple person trying to develop his vending business to give his family a better living. His family lives harmoniously at Barangay Ranga - Ay San Agustin, Isabela, a village that is isolated and mountainous. 

His eagerness to develop his business into a more progressive one gave him the idea of asking financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 that he will utilize in his fish vending business. According to him, his business is a big help in providing his three children their daily fees for school. He hopes that someday his children will earn a degree for their future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es: Senovia  está solicitando  su 8vo  refinanciamiento  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en la Escuela Diriangen desde hace 20 años, esta clienta tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de  17 años de edad estudia su quinto año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 14 años estudia su tercer año de Educación secundaria,  esta clienta se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesta, trabajadora, su esposo es comerciante el cual viaja a las colonias del Municipio de Nueva Guinea a comprar ganado con un hermano,  ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos pero bien unida, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 2 años y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, viven  en la colonia San Antonio en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que estos van adquiriendo con AFODENIC, tener estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Senovia is asking for her 8th loan in order to invest in improving her manner of living (constructing a room). She has worked as a docent in the Diriangen School for 20 years. This client has two children. The eldest is 17 years old, or of school age, and is in his fifth year of secondary education. The younger daughter is 14 years old, and she is in her third year of secondary education. This client is known for being responsible, honest, and hardworking. Her husband is a businessmen who travels to the area of the Municipality Nueva Guinea to buy livestock with a brother. They share the family’s household expenses, and they are a family of few resources but they are very tight-knit. This loan would be repaid in two years and so little by little to go on improving their home. They live in the area San Antonio in a neighbourhood where each day the population is increasing. Her dream is to go on improving her home with each loan that they get with AFODENIC, to have work stability, health, and that her children continue studying so that they may do something with their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 30 year married with four children aged between 9 and 13 years. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with five people. Robinah takes care of one additional family member.There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She doesn’t incur any extra transport as she buys from her place of work running a bar and on average she sells to 15 customers a day. Robinah sells to mature people only people and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for the eight years Robinah has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more  crates of beer and soda  Robinah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger ,and owning a big bar  
 

.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
"Malama T. (0) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Pitonuu.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Malama owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Malama has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Malama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Malama is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Malama is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Malama plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Percy Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio Percy, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Puno, y reside en ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, y nuestro socio alterna sus otras actividades con la que es la principal el comercio minorista, el socio confecciona prendas de vestir. Él trabaja en esto como parte de una pasión, hace trajes de vestir para varones y mujeres, por lo que el socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, parte de ello el utilizará para uso personal.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deuda en el tiempo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im T., 47, pictured here with her sister, is a widow with one child lives with her sister in the Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$6 each day, while her sister is a worker. She makes about US$3 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Im T. is asking for a loan of US$500 to diversify her grocery items to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: Expand grocery items.

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico S. is from the village of  Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 37 years old. Monico is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Monico owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Monico has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Monico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monico is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Monico from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Elizabeth de 25 años de edad,  es casada, no tiene hijo y su esposo labora en zona franca trabajando de operario, con un salario bajo pero con mucho deseo de ahorrar para hacer su propia casa, Janina se desempeña como docente en un colegio del barrio desde hace dos años, ella estudio ingeniería en sistema con computación, gracias al apoyo de su papa ya que su mama los abandono desde pequeña, a mucho sacrificio saco su secundaria tuvo que trabajar como domestica para poder pagar los estudios y estudiar los sábados, luego trabaje en zona franca para poder pagar la universidad ya que mi padre no alcanzaba por ser de pocos recursos económicos, es difícil pero lo logre hay que tener mucha voluntad y deseo de superación. Su meta es poder encontrar un mejor trabajo en donde pueda poner a práctica su carrera a si como ganar mejor para poder comenzar  hacer su casa. Con este préstamo comprara: piedra arena, hierro  para ir adelantado y tener un comienzo ya que todo esta caro y es difícil construir de una sola vez,  da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 25, is married and does not have children. Her husband is a workman for the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua). His salary is low, but he has a great desire to save to build his own house. She has worked as a teacher at a neighborhood school for two years. She studied as an engineer in computer systems. Thanks to her father (her mother abandoned them when she was little), who sacrificed much, she finished high school. She had to work as a domestic employee to be able to pay for her education, and she went to school on Saturdays. Then she worked for the Zona Franca to be able to pay the university because her father had few economic resources. It is difficult, but she did it. You have to have a lot of will power and the desire to succeed. Her goal is to be able to find a better job where she will be able to practice her profession. That way she would earn more and be able to start building her house. She will use the loan to buy rocks, sand, and metal to go forward and start. Everything is expensive, and it is difficult to build all at once. She is grateful to Afodenic for the financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement, and iron to start building her house

loans.name: Hulley

texts.es:
La señora Hulley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Barbará II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun es estudiante y depende de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de carteras y zapatos, ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de manualidades, no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e implementar su propio negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará materiales como: Múranos, corrospa, lentejuelas, plantas de zapatos, cueros y viocueros. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Hulley, se siente muy joven, tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hulley is a member of the "Santa Barbara II" Community Bank, District Banda de Shilcayo, in the Province of San Martin, city of San Martin. She is married, is 25 years old and is the mother of a son who is a student depends on her financially. Mrs. Hulley's fighting spirit has always defined her and has helped her move forward enough to begin her own business which involves selling handbags and shoes. This business started out from hand crafted items, but gradually became known to her customers and she is doing very well today. She sells her products out of her home and also goes door to door to sell her handbags and shoes. With this loan, Mrs. Hulley will purchase materials such as "Murano" products, sequins, soles of shoes, leather hides, etc, Some of the money will also be invested in buying a cabinet, where she'll be able to showcase her products in a display for her customers. Mrs. Hulley, is very young and content with what she does and thanks the Manuela Ramos Organization for their help with the fulfillment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará materiales, para realizar sus productos. (to purchase materials in order to make more products - shoes and handbags - to sell)

loans.name: Bujengwe Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Lydia is 37 years old and married with nine children aged 20 – 3 years; she also takes care of her parents and six orphans, all in Mayanja Cell. Lydia has been in agriculture for 12 years and her major challenges have been the lack of labour (since most times, everybody works on their own farm and very few are left for paid labour) plus her limited capital. She is able to make 300,000/= a month as profits from the sale of tea which helps in boosting her business.

Lydia always ensures that her customer care skills are good; the location of her business is good, and there is a ready market for her produce plus it is high quality. She hopes to expand her business and educate her children further in addition to having a family with good health. Lydia needs a loan to help with the rehabilitation of her tea plantation so that she can increase her income and be able to pay wages efficiently.

loans.use: Rehabilitating her tea plantation for better produce

loans.name: Lady

texts.en:
Lady C. is from the village of Nicdao, Baungon  Bukidnon. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Lady owns and runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  She mainly sells food and daily use products in the local community. Lady has been in business for over two years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lady joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Lady is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expanding her business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 
------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide is forty-four years old. She is married and has three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

Adelaide works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community, procuring her goods from Accra.

Adelaide has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La Señora Wilma es una cliente responsable y dinamica esta casada y tiene un hijo  ella vive en el Barrio Monte Alto  y su esposo es el Sr. Benito, se dedica a trabajar de chofer, el esta afililiado en un sindicato de la ciudad, la Sra. Wilma tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende distintos tipos de ropa como pantalones y chompas que son los productos que mas venta tiene, ya tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos y directamente entrega.
 
El destino del crédito solicitado es para capital de trabajo comprar más mercadería por fin de año. 
La Sra. esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Wilma is a responsible and dynamic client. She is married and has a son. She lives in the Monte Alto neighborhood and her husband is Benito. He works as a driver and is affiliated with a union in the city. Wilma has a business selling clothing. She sells different types of clothing such as trousers and sweaters which are the most sold items. She has customers who make orders and who she delivers to directly. The requested loan is for working capital to purchase more merchandise for the end of the year. She is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided by granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana G., age 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Felicisimo G., a businessman, they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own bakery for quite some time now.

Feliciana has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her bakery.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will use her loan to buy equipment and expand her bakery.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that they can renovate their house and finish educating their children.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment and expand her bakery

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Teófilo (50), quien es agricultor, y de sus 4 hijos de 22, 17, 13 y 10 años.

Cada día se levanta con los primeros rayos de luz para ir a supervisar, junto con  su esposo, sus campos de maíz. La tarea es ardua y nada fácil porque se necesita paciencia y dedicación para impedir que las condiciones climáticas y las constantes amenazas de plagas no destruyan lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha cuidado. Luego de un tiempo puede observar con mucho orgullo lo dorado de las mazorcas, las cuales vende a los comerciantes mayoristas. Estas ganancias le permiten vivir bien y darles educación a sus hijos, ya que quiere que algún día lleguen a ser profesionales. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, tiene un toro de buena raza y ganado ovino que vende de vez en cuando, sobretodo cuando hay algún tipo de necesidad urgente. Angélica tiene muchos planes para el futuro y el más cercano es comprar algunas vacas para vender leche fresca.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir adelante. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes para su siembra y también comprará dos vacas para empezar a producir leche.
texts.en:
Angélica is 48 years old and lives in her own home, along with her husband Teófilo (50), who is a farmer, and their four children, ages 22, 17, 13, and 10. Each day she rises with the first rays of the sunlight in order to tend to the cornfields, along with her husband. The work is strenuous and nothing easy. It requires patience and dedication in order to fend of the effects of the weather and prevent the insects from destroying what she put so much effort into caring for. After a while she is able to proudly see the golden cobs, which she sells to large businesses. This income allows them to live well and provide for their children’s education. They hope that one day they will become professionals. She also raises livestock and has a good breed of bull and some sheep that she sells now and then, mainly whenever there is an urgent need. Angélica has many plans for the future, the next is to buy some milk cows and sell fresh milk. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is thankful for all the people who make it possible for her to get this loan and move ahead. She will use the money to buy sacs of fertilizer for her crop, and two cows so that she can start selling milk.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for her crop and two milk cows

loans.name: Reina Rocio

texts.es:
Reina Rocío R. R. es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos de 8, 15 y 17 años, con quienes vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio de estrato 1, donde la mayor parte de personas son trabajadores independientes. Muy cerca de su vivienda tiene el negocio de vender CDS DVD, MP3, dulces y frutas, que está ubicado en una vía vehicular, en los alrededores del mega centro comercial  “Metrocentro”, al lado de  una vía principal llamada la calle murillo en la ciudad de Barranquilla.
Reina Rocío solicita un financiamiento por valor de: $1.300.000, para frutas como ciruelas, mangos, piñas, melón, dulces y CDS DVD, MP3, que ella comprará directamente  en el mercado público y a proveedores varios. Este  es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, tiene 2 años de estar vinculada a esta organización, y explica que  con sus créditos ha aumentado su bienestar económico y ha podido salir de los prestamistas callejeros, que le ofrecen intereses muy altos.

Inició  este negocio hace 15 años cuando trabajaba con su cónyuge; antes de incursionar en esta actividad  fue empleada en una empresa donde vendía rifas y lotería  de allí se retiró para  trabajar en su propio negocio de 9:00 A.M. a 9:00 PM y de Lunes a Domingo; sus clientes son peatones y referidos por sus clientes, ella dice que precisamente “como hay una alta competencia, el mercado alcanza para todos”  

Su sueño es introducir productos de mayor innovación en su negocio, tambien que sus hijos salgan adelante en sus educación, aunque ella está feliz porque estudian carreras técnicas  y porque 2 de ellos están becados por instituciones educativas reconocidas, debido a un notorio desempeño en sus clases. Su gran desafío es  mejorar su vivienda que esta en obra negra y ampliar su negocio de mercancías.
texts.en:
Reina Rocío R. R. has 3 children - 8, 15 and 17 years old. They live in the 20 de Julio district, where a large part of the population work independently. Very close to her house she has a business where she sells cds, dvds, mp3 players, sweets and fruit. The shop is located on a busy route, surrounding the mega commercial centre 'Metrocentro', next to a principle road called Calle Murillo in the city of Barranquilla. Reina Rocio is seeking a loan of $1,300 to purchase fruit such as plums, mangos, pineapples, melons, sweets, cds, dvds and mp3 payers. She will buy them directly from the public market and various providores. This is Reina Rocio's third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has been bound to this organisation for 2 years, and explains that the loans have improved her economic well-being and she has been able to move away from street loans, which offer very high interest rates. Reina Rocio began her business working with her husband 15 years ago. Before this she was an employee of a company where she sold raffle and lottery tickets. She retired from there to work in her own business from 9am to 9pm, Monday to Sunday. Her customers are pedestrians and referred to by other customers. She says precisely "because there is a high level of competition, the market is big enough for everyone". Her dream is to introduce innovative products in her business. She also desires that her children progress with their education, although she is happy because they are studying technical careers and 2 of them have scholarships with well-known educational institutions, owing to their good grades. Her biggest challenge is to improve her home, that is under construction, and expand the merchandise in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit such as plums, mangos, pineapples, melons, sweets, cds, dvds and mp3 players.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en:
Tetee T. is 38 and married with 6 children (ages -month - 21).  She owns a business venture, raising cattle for sale.  Tetee has 4 years of experience in this business.  Tetee needs a loan of WST $1500 to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Tetee joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tetee's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Miladys Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Miladys tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene un hijo, que tiene ocho años de edad y esta estudiando en primaria. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de venta de comida, negocio que lo realiza diario por las noches. Ella además de esto vende ropa nueva y usada, esto los distribuye de manera ambulante. Ella empezo a trabajar en este negocio desde hace diez años, esto fue producto de la falta de trabajo, además de esto su mama anteriormente había tenido la venta de comida en su casa, lo que le sirvió de inspiración para su negocio. Este crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de ropa de verano, ya que se esta acercando la semana santa y quiere aprovechar para vender sus productos. Lo que desea la señora es viajar a Managua a comprar a bajos precios al mercado y vender a su casa los artículos veraneros. Su sueño siempre ha sido establecer una tienda ya sea en su casa que brinde las facilidades económicas a su familia y que pueda brindar de apoyo para que su hijo pueda estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miladys is 34 years old, married, and has son who is 8 years old and studies in primary school. She has a business selling food in her home every night. In addition to this, she also is a traveling saleswoman of new and used clothing. She started to work in this business ten years ago, due to a lack of work. Also, her mother had previously sold food out of her home, and this served as the inspiration for her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy summer clothing, as Holy Week is approaching and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to sell her products. She desires to travel to Managua to buy the summer articles below market value and then sell them from her home. Her dream has always been to start a store in her home that will provide for her family economically and support her son financially so that he can study in the university.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Noe

texts.en: Noe L. is 43 years old and has one child. He started his rice farm business in 1988 and he owns the land that he tills. The income that Noe gets from his business goes towards the needs of his family. He works very hard to provide for all his family's needs. Lately, he has been inspired by other clients of Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) who have succeeded in their businesses. Noe is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase his harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Jose Lenin

texts.es: José Lenin tiene José tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de ataúdes. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con esta actividad hace más de 30 años, pues tiene que mantener a sus hijos que tiene a cargo, es una persona muy honesta y humilde. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de clavos, pega, pinturas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos para continuar con esta actividad.
texts.en:
José Lenin has been an excellent Fundación client for a long time now. He has been a coffin maker for over 30 years because he has children to support. He is a very honest and humble person. He is asking for funding to buy nails, glue and paints, among other supplies. His wish is to improve his earnings so that he can continue in this occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nails, paint, glue, etc.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin trabaja en una empresa donde realiza mantenimiento de equipos médicos; es independiente y la única fuente de ingresos es su trabajo en la empresa “Intersanitas”.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi  de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá para mantener records de sus trabajos en forma ordenada.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Edwin works at a business that maintains medical equipment. He is independent and his only source of income is his job at the company called “Intersanitas”. He lives in a rented house located in the district of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to purchase a computer so that he can maintain his work records in an orderly fashion. This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO. Edwin has demonstrated responsibility with his loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer so that he can organize his work

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan. She has six children who couldn’t get their education due to financial reasons. Her husband is a carpenter by trade and has a business doing furniture-making while Shamim helps her husband by doing embroidery work. She started her embroidery business few years ago with the help of an Asasah loan. 

Shamim’s husband is out of stock these days and as a result is facing losses in his business. She has helped him in this crucial time by working hard in her embroidery business.  

Shamim has applied for the second time for a loan from Asasah. She will invest the loan amount in her husband's business which will allow him to buy woods and nails for the manufacturing of furniture. Shamim hopes that her husband will be able to re-establish his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase required material for furniture-making business

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 53 years of age and currently lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. S. owns a small store in front of her home where she sells a few groceries to villagers for a profit. She is married with six children: two are married and four are single. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. S. is requesting a loan to enlarge her business capital.

loans.use: To enlarge her business capital.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan sells second-hand clothes and children's shoes. He is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, and has previously serviced five loans. These have helped him add stock to his business hence improving the business. His living standards have also improved and he can afford to pay school fees for his children.
Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 90,000 KES to purchase stock of clothes and shoes. He has been running his business for seven years and hopes to open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ALIMATA T., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1, 6 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environ par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi I  portent tout leur espoir sur le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi I" are married women averaging 39 years of age and four children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Wobougou, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being better able to organize their work when winter begins.  Their crops include rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans.  The group members are on their second farm loan.  The previous loan was repaid.  With the new loan, Ms. Alimata T., the group's president, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of peanuts and beans.  After the harvests, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of consumers and retailers in the cities of Dioïla and Massigui.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 70,000 francs CFA each planting season.  The women of this group put all their hope into the smooth progress of the winter planting effort. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, weeding, and equipment

loans.name: Mujeres De Los Riscos Group

texts.es:
Doña María Victoria S. A., es casada, tiene 4 hijos, es una persona que se ha dedicado a la elaboración D. pan ya que a través D. este trabajo ella a superado a si mismo a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por trece personas,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes actividades las que mencionamos como crianza D. animales, venta D. frutas y verduras, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario.

Las integrantes del grupo decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia, las integrantes del Banco Comunal, Mujeres D. Los Riscos, del Barrio Patzite  Momostenango.
texts.en:
María Victoria S. A. is married and has 4 children. She is a person who has dedicated her time to making bread, and through this work she has had economic success and has been able to support her family and cover the household expenses. Along these lines, she had the idea to form a group of women so that they could also succeed. This group is comprised of 13 people, women who work in different areas, including raising animals, selling fruit and selling products that are basic necessities. The members of the group decided to request a loan from ASDIR to improve the living conditions of themselves and their families. The name of this communal bank is "Mujeres D. Los Riscos," and they are from the Patzite neighborhood of Momostenango.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 47-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a businesswoman and, like many African men, Stephen has ten children. He sustains a family of 15 people and he hopes to ensure they all get a bright future. He is a banker but is a major helping hand in his wife's business as well. This is Stephen’s fifth loan and, as for many parents and guardians, the issue at hand is payment of school fees; thus, he intends to use the loan proceeds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by selling fresh and dried fish. She lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. As a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she now earns an average monthly income of PHP 33000. Nancy is now borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her business. This will be her twenty-first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nancy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.
