About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for fish-selling business

loans.name: Perisca

texts.en:
Perisca E. is a 20-year-old, married woman. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children, and all of their children attend school.

At present, Perisca is in the business of selling oil, sugar, simsim, and groundnuts. She is seeking a loan to increase her inventory relating to simsim and groundnuts for resale purposes. With the additional profits generated as a result of this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing her stock of products

loans.name: Aregnazan

texts.en:
Aregnazyan is the proud mother of four sons (eighteen, twenty-two, twenty-three and twenty-five). She was born and has always lived in the village of Shirakavan, which is in the Shirak region of Armenia. Shirakayan is a rural village and most of the residents are engaged in agricultural activities.

For the past eleven years, Aregnazan has been involved in growing vegetables and raising cattle. Aregnazan supports her extended family with the products of her farm. Her dream is to open a small bakery in Shirakavan. Aregnazan is seeking a loan to purchase additional livestock and develop her business. With this investment, she expects the family's income to increase by twenty percent. This is her first microfinance loan and she looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo, de 62 años, es un hombre muy alegre, cortés y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Felicita de 66 años y sus 2 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días Máximo abre desde las 5 de la mañana su tienda y comienza a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, su negocio es muy concurrido en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es un vendedor muy persuasivo y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprar más de lo que tenían que comprar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, sobre las cosas que suceden en la ciudad, así aprovecha para distraerse un poco, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para poner una tienda venta de plásticos y productos afines. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y solidario. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en: Máximo is 62 years old; he is a very happy, corteous, and hardworking man. he lives in his own house alongside Felicita, his 66-year old wife, and his two young daughters. He hopes to improve their quality of life. Every morning Máximo opens his store at five in the morning and starts to sell his delicious snacks. He has a well-trafficked business in the city of San Francisco because he is a very persuasive seller, he can convince his clients to buy more than they planned. He has been running this business for six years. The thing he likes most about his job is talking with his clients about what is happening in the city. These conversations provide a small distraction. The thing that is hardest for him is to spend all day in the store and weight for clients. In the future he wants to raise enough money to start a shop where he sells plastic products. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he knows that he has make all his payments on time. He is a happy and loyal member of the community bank. With the 2,000 new soles he is applying for he will buy more snacks to improve his business.

loans.use: Comprar más golosinas para suministrar su negocio.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a grown daughter. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd who runs a small clothing sales business in the central marketplace of her home town. She sells women’s outer clothing, such as jackets and fur coats. She owns two vending facilities: a big pavilion and a kiosk at the market. Presently, she has 80,000 UAH in working capital. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 7,500 UAH to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale in her vending locations. The approaching winter season means increased buyer activity, so she wants to stock her supply of clothing items to be able to meet customer demand. She is planning to invest the income generated from the loan back into her business, and to continue growing her trade in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Luis is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 4 & 5 (Going Forward). He makes his home in a simple structure with his son and some other family members. Luis operates a 'colmado,' a store where customers can find all the ingredients to make their daily food; normally, there are colmados within a short walking distance from any home in every neighborhood.

Luis is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his colmado for nine years, which he started with some savings. He is planning to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing rice, beans, canned food, sugar and flour. He will use the profits to invest his business and improve it. He says that his most difficult challenge was working hard after he had an accident and broke a leg. He plans to continue playing dominoes in his free time.

This Esperanza associate began with us because he needed capital for his business and some neighbors invited him to join the group. His story is generally representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). The group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and its sugar cane industry. The main economic activity is a free traD. zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. 

The man standing with the blue shirt is representing his wife, Miguelina, a member of the group who could not attend the meeting.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar and  flour

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 31 years old.  He is married and blessed with a five-year-old child.  For a living, he repairs computers and provides Internet access for a fee.  He has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ three people.  He also does farming for extra income.  He hopes to expand his computer business to other towns in the future.  He has requested a loan for 80,000 Kes to buy laptops and network server for field work.

loans.use: To buy laptops and a network server

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Alejandro; El socio tiene 36 años de edad, el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en su zapatería, el socio tiene una zapatería ya que él es zapatero de profesión, el socio vende zapatos y también los repara, su conyugue lo ayuda en su zapatería ellos también venden plantillas, escobillas, tintes, grasas y otros materiales de zapatería y accesorios. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para fabricar zapatos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para fabricar zapatos para esta temporada.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Nuevo Amanacer de Urubamba communal bank  which is located in Urubamba province in Cusco department.

He is Alejandro, 36, married, with two children. A shoemaker by profession, he works in a shoe store where he sells and also repairs shoes.  His wife helps him in the store and they also sell insoles, brushes, dyes, shoe polish and other related items and accessories.  Alejandro needs the loan to buy materials to make shoes and that is why he is requesting the loan for this season.

He is very happy with the loan extended to him and he promises to make all the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy material to make shoes for this season

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana de 37 de años, vive con dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, es madre soltera y se dedica a vender comida, negocio que nace por iniciativa propia hace 6 años, este negocio es la fortaleza para cubrir las necesidades del hogar, los clientes son amigos de la zona, su horario es de 6:00am a 7:00pm, gracias a Dios hasta el momento es rentable.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para cubrir unos gastos de vivienda, ya que ella no tiene casa propia y esta por recibir una del fondo Social para la Vivienda, esta empresa es la que le da oportunidad a las personas que no tienen vivienda en el país de adquirir una a un bajo costo, con cuotas pequeñas, por esta razón ella solicita el préstamo y pagar el adelanto que la empresa solicita para entregar la vivienda.
Con este préstamo podrá contar con una vivienda digna y de la cual no estarán moviéndose porque será de ellos, para Ana uno de sus sueños esta cumpliéndose que es tener casa propia, pero continuara trabajando por lograr que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, lives with her two children who are 14 and 10 years old in San Miguel.  She is a single mother who works selling food, a business she started on her own initiative six years ago.  This business is the strength to cover household needs.  Customers are area friends.  Her schedule is from 6am until 7pm.  Thanks to God, to date it’s been profitable.

She is asking for a loan to cover housing costs.  She does not own a house and is about to get one from the Social Housing Fund, a firm that provides housing opportunities to people living in this country to acquire a low-cost home, paying low installments.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to pay the down payment the firm requires in order to deliver her house.

With this loan she will be able to have a proper home of their own and not be having to move around because it will be theirs.  Having a house of her own is a dream come true for Ana but she will continue to work so that her children will stay in school and become professionals.

loans.use: To pay down payment on her house.

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en: Imelda B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. Imelda has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. Imelda is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Imelda B.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Santos Pilar

texts.es: Santos Pilar Q. C., es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual reside en el departamento de San Vicente, en donde vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja en la alcaldía del lugar y así mismo vive junto a dos hijas mayores de edad, las cuales le ayudan a su madre con el negocio. Santos posee una venta de tortillas, las cuales elabora y comercializa en su casa de habitación, en donde posee muchos clientes. Así mismo todos los días por las tardes se dedica a elaborar platillos típicos, entre los cuales están, las yuca frita, pastelitos, atoles y otros más. De esta manera Santos logra brindarle ayuda económica a su esposo, lo cual le permite tanto a ella como a su familia salir adelante, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos.
texts.en:
Santos Pilar Q. C. is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She lives in the San Vicente department along with her husband, a city employee, and their two adult daughters, who help their mother with her business. 

Santos makes and sells tortillas out of her home and has many customers. She also works every afternoon cooking classic regional dishes such as fried yucca, 'atol' (a spiced corn-based beverage), and 'pastelitos' (pastries made from puff pastry with a sweet or savory filling), among others. This work allows Santos to provide her husband with financial support so that they can build a better future for their family. This is why she has requested a loan. With these funds, she will be able to purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, esta actividad la raliza en las afueras de su domicilio y tiene la ayuda de una de sus hijas, lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años.
Con este préstamo de  S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 10 kilos de pescado seco, 3 kilos de fariña, 2 racimos de plátano, 2 kilos de tomate, 2 kilos de cebolla, 5 kilos de papa, 1 kilo de ajos, 1 atado de culantro de la región, 1 lata de pan, 1 lata de biscocho, 1 caja de galleta, 1 paquete de papel higiénico, ½ caja de leche chica, ½ caja de aceite, 1 caja de mantequilla.  
Con todos los préstamos que ha tenido de Manuela Ramos ha ido incrementando su pequeño negocio, las ganancias las utiliza para pagar las cuotas al banco y también le alcanza para darse unos pequeños gustos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and a single mother of five children.

Elizabeth sells food products. Her business is located just outside of her home and she has the help of one of her daughters.

Elizabeth has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years. With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy 10 kilos of dried fish, 3 kilos of flour, 2 bunches of bananas, 2 kilos of tomatoes, 2 kilos of onions, 5 kilos of potatoes, 1 kilo of garlic, 1 bunch of cilantro grown in the region, 1 case of bread, 1 case of biscuits, 1 package of cookies, 1 packet of toilet paper, ½ case of milk, ½ case of oil, and 1 case of butter.

With the loans from Manuela Ramos, Elizabeth has been able to steadily increase her small business. The profits she earns are used to repay her loans to the Communal Bank and purchase a few small luxuries for herself that she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase various products for her business.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Hortencia de 55 años, reside en Villanueva con su compañero de vida pues sus 8 hijos viven de manera independiente. Ella es una mujer llena de metas y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante. Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de tortillas y tamales ubicado en su vivienda, es bien frecuentado por las personas del lugar, ya que ella se destaca por ser buena vendedora y por ser amable con su clientela. Es por eso que le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, comales, bolsas, entre otros productos. Maria tiene gran esperanza en que esto le permitirá mejorar la economía de su hogar y así aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Hortencia is 55 years old, and she lives in Villanueva with her lifetime partner as all of their 8 children live on their own. She is a woman with many goals and a willingness to improve herself. Marian engages in selling tortillas and tamales in a shop she has set in her house. It is well attended by the locals, as she stands out for being a good seller and for being kind to her customers. For this reason she is requesting a loan she will use to buy maize, comales (clay dishes used to prepare tortillas), and bags among other products. Maria has high hopes this loan will help her improving the economy of her family in order to reach a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy maize, comales, bags and other products for her activity.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 42 years old and a member of Favour Self Help Group under Faulu Kenya. She sells smoked and dried fish. Being a mother of six, she works hard in her business to help her husband with household expenses. She hopes to grow her business to generate more income. She has been guaranteed a loan of 30,000 Kes by her group members. With the loan, she will buy fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Letty Cecibel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Letty, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  una hija de tres años y bebé de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es Ing. Civil. Ella es maestra en una institución privada en Rocafuerte.

Se dedica también al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, ventiladores, etc. por catalogo. Nos cuenta que trabaja dos horas al día y también aprovecha su tiempo en la escuela para venderles a  otras maestras y a madres de familia que llegan hasta la institución. Lleva año y medio que se dedica  a esta actividad y empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar artículos para el hogar como: planchas, tostadoras, licuadoras, ventiladores, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella pudo financiar  su negocio.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the members of the Dulce Amistad [Sweet Friendship] community bank meet every two weeks. The area is known for its delicious candies prepared by the locals, and they are very well known throughout the country. Its people are warm, friendly and hardworking. 

Here we met Letty. She is 30 years old, married and has one three year old daughter and an eight month old baby. Her husband is a civil engineer and she is a teacher at a private institution in Rocafuerte.

She is also a merchant. She sells items for the home, such as irons, toasters, fans, etc. via catalogue. She tells us that she works two hours a day and she also uses her time at the school to sell to other teachers and to the mothers who come to the institution. She has been doing this for a year and a half and she started the business with the first loan she received from the bank. 

She will use this loan to buy itmes for the home such as: irons, toasters, blenders, fans, etc. She has been in the community bank for 4 cycles and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she was able to finance her business. 

Her dream is to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy irons, toasters, blenders, fans, etc.

loans.name: Duo Las Colaboradoras Group

texts.es: Duo las colaboradoras.:este grupo esta conformado por doña Maria quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años en su comunidad ella nos cienta que le a hido muy bien ya que pues su ventas an aumentado considerable mente ella solicita este credito para la compra de ropa por mayor porque ella dice que le venden mas barato y asi de la misma manera aumentar sus ganacias ella es la lider de este grupo, doña Maria Lucita tambien se dedica a la venta de carne y solicita este credito para la compra de mas carne para la venta.
texts.en: Las Colaboradoras Duo: This group is composed of Maria who has been selling clothes for many years in her community and she tells us that it has done very well. Her sales have increased considerably. She requests a loan to purchase clothing in wholesale because it is sold at a more affordable price. This will help her increase her profits. She is the leader of the group. Maria Lucita sells meats and she requests a loan to purchase more meat for resale.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in wholesale.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Edy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su suegra. Hace más de 11 años se dedica a elaborar telares artesanales en casa de su madre, lugar donde tiene un taller. Ella es muy exigente en su trabajo, pone todo su empeño para obtener una prenda de calidad, a fin de que su clientela se sienta satisfecha del servicio que le solicitaron. Actualmente hace telares de pequeñas cintas que se utilizan como accesorios en los trajes típicos de su zona, de esta manera logra tener ingresos para su hogar. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la agricultura y  crianza de animales, ambos obtiene ingresos que le ayudan en la manutención de su familia. Su gran deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y modernizar sus herramientas de trabajo. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, tiene tranquilidad de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de lana de diversas calidades y colores y también renovar su maquina telar
texts.en:
Edy, 31, lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house.  For over 11 years she’s been weaving textiles in her mother’s house where she has a workshop.  She is very exacting with her work and puts all her efforts into obtaining a quality item so that her customers will be satisfied with the service they requested.

She’s currently weaving small strips that are used as accessories on the traditional costumes in her area; this is how she earns income for her household.  In addition to this activity, she also farms and raises animals; both activities provide support for her family.  Her great wish is to improve and modernize her work tools.

This is loan #3 with MFP.  She has the peace of mind of knowing that she can count on financial support from her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive.  

She thanks all those who will fund the requested loan which will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy wool in a variety of qualities and colors and also to repair her loom.

loans.use: to buy wool and to have her loom repaired.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 2 years, Beryl has operated a tailoring business, selling by retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailoring shop operators. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase fabric and a sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa is 50 years of age and married with six children. Leafa owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Leafa needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Leafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leafa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 32 years old.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She has a retail store where she sells different products to the local community. Juvilyn has had this business for 3 years and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month.

Juvilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles to sell in her store.  In the future, she hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: buy shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
MARTA JULIA

La señorita Marta Julia es soltera vive en Caserío Manzanal  se dedica a la  Crianza de Animales ( cerdos y pollos)   como también elabora tejidos ( Guipiles , servilletas, blusas y fajas típicas), inicio la crianza de animales hace 8 años con la ayuda de sus padres  que le dieron el capital para la compra un cerdo y luego con la ganancia de la venta del cerdo  ella  compro otro cerdo e invertir también en la compra de pollos   y asi venderlos, en el tiempo libre se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos  que inicio desde muy pequeña ya que su  mama   le enseño a tejer  ahora ella necesita un capital para poder invertir en la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos y la compra de pollos su deseo es poder  tener un poco mas de pollos , como también  quiere iniciar con la agricultura de follaje en su casa  y asi mismo para poder incrementar  sus negocios  su deseo es poder seguir ayudando a sus padres  para  salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señorita Marta Julia is single and lives in Caserío Manzanal. She earns her living by raising animals (pigs and chickens) and also by weaving (traditional blouses, napkins, blouses, and traditional belts). She began raising animals eight years ago with help from her parents who gave her the money to buy a pig and chickens to sell later. In her free time she weaves, something she’s been doing ever since she was a young girl. Her mother taught her to weave.

Now Marta needs money to buy supplies for her weaving and also some chickens. She would like to have a few more chickens and also to begin growing shrubs (greenery) at her house. In this way she will diversify her businesses. Her wish is to be able to continue helping her parents make headway in life.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 49, lives in the Philippines and is widowed with six children. She has a retail shop selling fish-like sardines and mackerel, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Lourdes is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda Maribel

texts.es:
Lucinda tiene 32 años vive en Machachi cerca de Latacunga con su esposo y un hijo que tiene 7 años, se desribe como una persona pacífica que si se le presentan problemas los trata de resolver y le gusta trabajar con sus vacas.

Trabaja en la crianza de ganado para la producción de leche,si ha trabajado con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para comprar un ternero que en un futuro aumentará sus ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida; su sueño es tener un ordeño metálico (máquina para ordeñar vacas) para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 32 years old and lives in Machachi, near Latacunga, with her husband and their 7 year-old son. She describes herself as a peaceful person who, when faced with problems, tries to resolve them. She enjoys working with her cows.

She works raising cows for milk production. She has worked with FODEMI before. She is requesting this loan to buy a calf that will increase her future earnings and improve her quality of life. Her dream is to have a machine that milks cows, as this would improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines, a  widow and mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a barbeque stall. She regularly buys pork, beef, and chicken entrails that she prepare for cooking and sells in the afternoon in her barbeque stand near her house. She also earns additional income by selling frozen meat products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like beef, pork, chicken and frozen meat products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedes dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sodji

texts.fr:
Sodji est un homme âgé(e) de 30 ans. il est mariée å une  revendeuse. il a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.  
Sodji travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend les produits d’alimentation générale  pour ses clients composés de toute personne. de toute servis dans sa boutique. il travaille seule dans sa boutique. 
Sodji a requis son 2ème crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. il veut acheter une moto pour en faire une exploitation commerciale notamment un taxi moto. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sodji voudrait solliciter un plus gros crédit après avoir remboursé son 2ème.il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sodji is a 30-year-old man. He is married to a reseller. He has 2 children who both go to school. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. Sodji has been working as a reseller of general food products since 2005. He buys and resells the general food products to his customers, the public, all in his shop. He works alone in his shop. Sodji has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy general food products. He wants to buy a motorcycle to start a commercial operation specifically a motorcycle taxi. In the coming years, Sodji would like to seek a larger loan after repaying his second one. He says that, with the profits, he plans to ensure the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en:
Pharis is a businessman who is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last two years, he has been managing a boutique to earn a living. 

Pharis has worked hard to grow his business.  He is also grateful for the financial support from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to manage a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and make-up.

loans.use: To buy clothes and make-up for his boutique.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC in South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for resale. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 42-years-old and lives with her daughter and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in  the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a clerk at the mining company. Her daughter works as a waitress at the local restaurant. 

She started her business in 1995 by selling clothes at the Denj market. She increased her turnover capital successfully and now she has clothes worth over 3,5 million MNT. She has many years of work and business experience. In the future, she plans to expand her business activity by renting another commercial space at the other market. She is a diligent and hard working woman who says, "I want to expand my business and open new branch." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes and increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Canaani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Canaani Group in Western Kenya! Violet is the facilitator of the Canaani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Violet is a mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Violet will educate her children and use the same in loan repayment.

In 2012, the members of Canaani group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Violet is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages four and seven, who are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a welder. Josephine operates a tailoring business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six years and was previously employed as a receptionist. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Josephine describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Josephine will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy sewing materials for her business. Josephine aspires to open a boutique and cosmetics shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 43-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and four children. 

Dung earns income to support her family by operating a general store, which she has run for the past 20 years. Dung would like to take out a loan to expand her general store by purchasing a greater range and quantity of cosmetic products, beverages and miscellaneous items to serve a larger number of customers. 

She hopes that through the loan her business will be able to generate more income and enable her to improve her family's living conditions while putting aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products, beverages and miscellaneous items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: El señor Ignacio, es un humilde campesino, de 48 años de edad, quien se dedica a vender leña y a criar cerdos, el vive en Chacaraseca una comarca de León,  tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes. Don Ignacio a duras penas aprendió a leer y escribir pero con trabajo honrado se ha sabido ganar la vida en su humilde carretón de caballo donde monte la leña para salir a vender en toda la comarcas pues donde vive no todos tienen acceso a cocinas de gas la mayoría son muy pobre y cocinan con leña cuando no se dedica a esta actividad el se dedica la crianza de cerdos para vender. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un lote de leña y comprar cerdos para crianza. El espero seguir comprando poco a poco materiales de construcción para ir componiendo su casa poco a poco, mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ignacio is a humble 48-year-old rural worker who lives in Chacaraseca, a region of León.  His business is selling firewood and raising pigs.  He has four children who are independent.  Ignacio barely learned to read and write but, through honest work, he has known how to make a living from his humble horse-drawn cart on which he carries firewood to sell in different regions.  Where Ignacio lives, not everybody has access to gas stoves.  Most people are very poor and they cook with firewood.  When he is not working in this business, Ignacio raises pigs to sell.  He needs this loan to buy a load of firewood and also some pigs to raise.  He hopes to continue gradually buying building materials so that he can gradually build his house and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a load of firewood and also some pigs to raise

loans.name: C2193 Abadatenguha Group

texts.en:
Faustin is 36 years old and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10. He sells vegetable and fruit in his business. His business is well organized and he works from 7 am until 5 pm every day, except on the weekend. He is the leader of the group called "C2193 Abadatenguha" in the local language. Faustin has one year of experience in this work. 

Faustin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more vegetable and fruit for sale. With the profits he earns, he plans to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Malieta

texts.en:
Malieta is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza nació en la ciudad de Huayopata en la provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (La ciudad es un sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Maritza tiene 43 años edad y es viuda pero tiene cinco hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo, ella trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba en el área de desarrollo económico Agropecuario, ella tiene otros ingresos económicos como por ejemplo alquila sus habitaciones y casas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Maritza es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que su hija mayor estudia la carrera profesional de derecho, el segundo hijo estudia administración  y los demás están estudiando el colegio. En esta oportunidad Maritza requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos osea para pagar las matriculas y otros gastos. 

Maritza es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Maritza was born in the city of Huayopata in the Concencion province, Cusco department.  She currently lives in the city of Ollantaytambo ( the city is an archaeological  Inca site, capital of the Ollantaytambo district (Urubamba Province), located south of Peru, 90km northeast of the city of Cuzco)

Maritza is 42 years old, a widow, and has five children.  She splits her time between work and family.  She works at the Urubamba municipality in the area of economic agricultural development.  She has other income such as that from the rental of rooms and houses in the city of Ollantaytambo.  Maritza is a hard working and enterprising woman that is getting her family ahead.  She tells us, with much pride, that her oldest daughter is studying law, her second son is studying administration and the others are also in school.  At this time, Maritza is needing the loan to be able to pay the cost of registration and other educational expenses of her children.

Maritza is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" group, which is made up of 12 members that live in the city of Ollantaytambo where they also work.

loans.use: to pay the education costs of her children.

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en: Yasinta is a 31 year old single woman. She owns a produce business, which she has been running for some time now. She started her business with 200,000 shillings. But now her capital base is steadily growing and the business is now worth 2,000,000 shillings. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and she hopes to educate her children. She wishes to expand her business to new markets and she is requesting for a loan to buy maize and rice to resell.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 40 años de edad, está acompañado con la Sra. María hace 12 años, juntos tienen 2 hijos, Laura de 9 y Rodrigo de 7 años.
El Sr. Nelson es letrista, y nos cuenta que tiene su negocio tiene en la casa de su madre sobre la avenida principal de la ciudad, Comenzó la profesión de letrista muy joven, antes era empleado hasta que se decidió a montar su propio taller de letras y creatividad, comenta que en principio le costó un poco por la falta de capital y crear su propia clientela, con el tiempo empezaron a conocerlo por sus trabajos que fueron aceptados y valorados con lo su negocio fue creciendo y hoy en día ya es un gran microempresario. Nelson nos cuenta que todo su trabajo es por sus hijos, ya que quiere que ellos el día de mañana sean personas con buenas profesiones que trabajen bien y no tengan de que preocuparse.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, lonas, lienzo y de más insumos necesarios para hacer sus carteles. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
Nelson, 40, is from Coronel Oviedo, has been married to Maria for 12 years and they have 2 children: Laura, 9 and Rodrigo, 7.
Nelson is a printer and he tells us that his business is located in his mother’s house on the main street of the city.  He began his career when he was very young.  First he worked as an employee until he decided to open his own print and design shop.  He tells us that at the beginning it was difficult because of the lack of capital and having to develop his own customer base.  But with time he became known for his work that was appreciated and accepted and his business was growing.   These days he is a big micro entrepreneur and Nelson tell us that all of his work is for his children because he wants them to be professionals in the future and to have good jobs and not to have to worry.
He is requesting the loan to buy paints,canvas, cloth and other supplies needed to make posters. He appreciates the help he is being given from the Foundation and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy paint, canvas, cloth and other supplies

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: After completing middle school, Agatha decided to set up her own bakery in Ebubonku, a town near Cape Coast. She is currently looking to expand her business, but is limited by a lack of funds. As a result, she is requesting this loan to help her buy more baking ingredients. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a laborer) support the upkeep of their house and ensure that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: 34 years old married woman, Nadia running a low income private school.  Her elder sister opened this school in her community since 1997 with the support of her family. Currently Nadia is looking after this school as school owner.  She has desire to provide a quality standard school to her community with maximums facilities. Due to lack of much resource she could not provide these facilities to the children. Her school has 197 students out of which 52% female students are enrolled. She desires to have trained teachers in her school. Nadia is enabling the children of her rural community to change and secure a better future in the long run. She requested for Rs 100,000 to buy furniture and to repair the school building.

loans.use: to buy furniture and to repair the school building.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth E. specializes in the sale of "baby items" such as clothes and toys.  She is 39 years old and a mother of four children. She plans to expand her business with a loan.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie is 50 years old with no formal education. She has 4 children who are grown-ups and fending for themselves. She prepares kenkey for sale in her community and beyond. Maize, the primary ingredient of kenkey, is Auntie's major concern. Most often she has to buy the maize for her kenkey on credit and pay back upon sale in 2 weeks. This situation erodes her profit margin greatly.

Auntie wants the KIVA loan to purchase the maize upfront and thereby retain a higher percentage of her profits and also reduce the workload that goes with her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Mrs. Dieu is 49, and her husband is 49 years old. They have three children between 19 and 23 who are going to the university. They have 8,000 square meters of growing rice land. Her husband works as a laborer, but the work is unstable. Tuition expenses are high, so it is important for Dieu to sell breakfast food in order to increase income by about $1/person/month. This brings her average income to $11.5/person/month. She wants to borrow $40 for her selling business.

loans.use: selling food

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica was born in 1965, is married and a mother of five. She is an orphan, having lost both parents when she was young. This deprived her of receiving basic education or any vocational training, hence she was unemployed. To start a business, she sought help and became a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. She has been able to invest and repay all of her loans with which she raised money to buy good food for her household, pay fees and buy medication.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to equip her hairdressing salon so as to attract as many clients as possible so she can have enough money to increase the business.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

The picture shown here is of Veronica cultivating cassava. This is how she currently brings in income, but she is hoping to use this loan for her other hairdressing business.

loans.use: Purchase of dryer, washing sink, hair rollers, hair products

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Mastona has been a client of MicroInvest for the past 2.5 years. Over this time she was able to significantly increase her turnover. Before she used to buy and sell dried fruit on local markets. Gradually she made the switch to selling fabric. This way she is able to get the money necessary to support her family. She is 27 years old, married and has two children. The new loan will allow her to buy fabric for the fall season.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мастона является клиентом Микроинвест уже в течении 2,5 лет. За этот период она увеличила свой оборотный капитал в несколько раз. Раньше она занималась куплей продажей сухофруктов на местных рынках. Постепенно она перешла на торговлю тканями. Это дает ей возможность получать нормальную прибыль, достаточную для содержания семьи. Мастоне 27 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. новый займ она планирует потратить на закупку тканей осеннего ассортимента.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Mr. Ilgar is a vulnerable low income person. He is 39, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Since 1993, Ilgar has been running a mini shop and sells spare parts. Every week Ilgar goes to the wholesale market, which is situated in the capital, Baku, to buy spare parts at reasonable prices. His sales are going well, and he requires more investment to develop the business further. For this purpose, he applied to the Normicro Saatli branch to get a $600 loan. Using these additional funds, he plans to raise his monthly income 30%.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Soleha

texts.en: Soleha is 34-year-old woman, married with four children aged 14, 12, 5 and 3. She has a small shop which sells snacks and a few household goods. She usually earns US$10 per day with a small profit. Soleha requests a loan to buy more goods for her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Gasim

texts.en:
Gasim M. is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Gasim owns and operates a small car-repair store in Beylagan. He is an experienced repairman and businessman. 
Gasim requests a loan of $700 to buy new equipment for his car-repair store. He believes that this loan will help him increase the number of repairs he can do and so increase his business.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for repairing cars

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan lives in Calle Pasco n. 1175 of San Jose de Yunguyo zone, located in El Alto city. He lives with his three children ages 17, 12 and 8. He makes a living by making leather handbags, wallets, coin purses in his home's workshop. He wishes to use the credit to purchase more materials (leather, liners, threads, etc) to be able to continue with his business. This is his second credit with Impro, the evaluation made qualifies him for another loan. He is an IMPRO client since February 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Froilan vive Calle Pasco n. 1175 de la zona San jose de Yunguyo, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 12 y 8 años respectivamente. Trabaja en la confección de chamarras de cuero, monederos y billeteras, en su taller que se encuentra en su domicilio. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material (cuero, forros, hilos, etc.) para desempeñar su trabajo. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Febrero de 2007

loans.use: Purchase of leather, linings, threads in order to make handbags and wallets

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean Y., 34, works selling chicken in a busy market, making on average around $3.50 of profit per day. Her husband Mr. Mot Mak, 34, is a musician in the village; on average, he earns about $2 a day of profit. All four of their children are students.

This loan will be used to purchase more chicken to sell in the market to meet customer demand.

(Mrs. Sean Y. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase more chicken to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
E. Kate sells clothing materials. She is a single parent of 2 children. Demand for the goods has increased and she wants to increase sales but she lacks enough capital.

She is asking $525 as additional capital to buy more inventory.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Esi Araba

texts.en:
Esi Araba A. is divorced and has two children. She travels to a distant town to purchase food supplies like maize, in large quantities, to sell in smaller quantities. Business is doing very well but the cost of transportation is her major problem.

Ms. A. is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her small profit.

loans.use: To subsidize transportation costs

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang B. lives in Trapaing Sla Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a grocer and wants to expand her business. Thus, Mrs. Samnang B. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell to her customers. Her business now faces a small problem because some of her customers come to buy on credit. As a result, Mrs. Samnang B. does not have enough money to expand her business. Her husband, Mr. Phearith Yin, is a farmer.

Mrs. Samnang B. is 29 years old and the mother of four children. One attends school. The remaining three are too young to work or study. Her husband appears on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her business

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr:
This young man is the owner of a film and photography reporting studio. With more than 5 years experience in the field, he wants to enhance his studio and increase his revenue by reporting on the popular football championship “Navétanes” and the marriages that precede Ramadan. Mr. C. is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Ce jeune est propirétaire d'un studio de reportage photo et caméra. Fort d'une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans le secteur, il veut renforcer son studio et augmenter ses revenus avec le championnat populaire "Navétanes" et les mariages qui précédent le Ramadan. Avec ses affaires C. est marié et pée de trois enfants.

loans.use: Photography studio enhancement

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through middle school. Doris sells fabrics for sewing clothing in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. She keeps the fabrics in a large basket on her head as she walks around from customer to customer. Her husband is a technician.

Doris uses her income to pay utility bills and expenses for food for her family. Doris will use this loan to purchase more fabrics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina O. was born in 1974 and she is from Kalesija. She is married and has two children, one 11 and the other 14 years old. Her husband is employed and he helps her with paying for food and the other things.

This is Sabina's first loan with Women for Women International, in the amount of 1200 KM ($US900). Sabina will use this loan to buy poultry. She wants to work more with poultry and in that way she will make better conditions of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot S., 42 years old, is married and lives with her three children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer and makes US$2 each day. She grows rice two times a year. 

First, during the dry season, it takes about 3-4 months to harvest rice while during the rainy season, it takes around 6-7 months. Her husband is a cow dealer, making around US$3 per day. Three of their children all students. Mrs. Mot would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more cows.
(Mot S.'s husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase additional cows for reselling.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella M. sells female wrappers (sarongs) and children's clothes. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is in Primary 4 at a public school.

Stella buys the wrappers from Onitsha market and sells them to people in her neighborhood. She had a shop at Uselu market but a fire burned the market. She lost most of her wrappers and the shop. She relocated back to her house and now sells her wrappers from home.

Stella hopes for a loan in the amount of N51,000 to use to rent a new shop at the market and to purchase more wrappers for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more female wrappers (sarongs) to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 50 años de edad y es madre soltera de 4 hijos, además tiene un nieto a su cargo. Su principal dificultad fue tener un conviviente que la maltrataba y también tener que separarse para empezar sola su vida junto a sus cuatro hijos. Su más grande logro ha sido sobresalir, iniciar un negocio y construir su casa. En la actualidad comenta que se siente tranquila porque con su negocio de venta de peluches, regalos y celulares está creciendo mucho. Su tienda está ubicado en la Av. Fitzcarrald 247 desde hace un año. También comenta que por primera vez inició un negocio con S/.88 y que gracias al primer crédito que le otorgó el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por medio de su Banco Comunal, ha crecido mucho. En estos momento tiene invertido en su negocio un promedio de s/.50,000 en toda su mercadería.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de juguetes para la campaña navideña.
 
A Julia le encanta la idea de seguir creciendo, tanto en su negocio como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Julia is a 50-year-old who is a single mother of four children and also cares for her grandson. Her greatest difficulty in life was having a partner who was abusive. This resulted in their separation and Julia having to start a new life with her four children. Her greatest accomplishment has been to rise above this by starting her own business and building her own home. She tells us that she is happy these days because her business, where she sells wigs, gifts, and cell phones, is doing so well. She also tells us that her business, which she began with the equivalent of only $25 USD, has grown a great deal thanks to the first loan she obtained through the Manuela Ramos Group. At this point she has been able to invest $15,900 USD in her store and merchandise. With this loan of $975, which she will pay back in four installments, she will purchase games and toys for the Christmas season. Julia is so happy with the idea of continuing to grow both personally and economically through her hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of games and toys for her store

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana se dedica a la compra y  venta de aji, chuño (papa secada al sol) y mote; su esposo es chofer. 
Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz tiene tres hijos en edad escolar
Requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería ( Aji, chuño, Y mote)
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Valeriana makes a living buying and selling "aji" (a kind of chili), "chunos" (sun-dried potatoes) and "mote" (boiled maize). Her husband is a cab driver. She lives in the Irpavi II neighborhood of La Paz and has three school-aged children. She needs the loan to buy merchandise (aji, chuno and mote). This is her sixth loan from Impro. Her history qualifies her as a premier customer because she has a good record of repaying past loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Khoudia D. habite la banlieu de Mbour ,elle a 44 ans ,elle est mariée et mere de 5 enfants.Pour entretenir sa famille elle vend de la nourriture .le matin elle vend le petit dejeuner cafe et autre et le soir elle vend le diner dans un coin de la rue du quartier.Ce travail elle le fait depuis plusieurs années et les revenus tirés du travail lui permettent de participer aux charges de la maison  au meme titre que son mari.Les repas servis le soir sont a base de céréale  avec le pret  qu 'elle sollicite elle veut constituer des stocks pour pallier à la hausse des prix des céréales
texts.en:
Khoudia D. lives in the suburbs of Mbour. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of five children. In order to support her family she sells food. In the morning she sells breakfast, coffee and other items, while in the evening she sells dinner on a street corner in her neighborhood. She has done this work for several years and the income permits her to help her husband with household expenses. The meals she serves in the evening are grain-based, and with the loan she has requested she would like to stock up on grain to offset the rising cost.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
Cosme trabajo en varias empresas, en todas ellas por contrato fijo y nunca hizo
Atigüedad, además fue chofer de transporte público por su cuenta y nunca se jubilo o pensiono, por lo que inicio su propio negocio para salir adelante. Comenzó el negocio n Febrero de 2006 Primero vendiendo joyería ya que su esposa se dedicaba a esto y veía que le iba bien, pero como algunos clientes le quedaron a deber decidió cambiar al giro de compra-venta de ropa nueva y siente que le ha ido mejor en esta actividad. Aunque tiene poco dedicándose a vender la ropa le ha ido bien y ya cuenta con un buen número de clientes que compran sus productos.

El solicita un préstamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas para comprar mas mercancía y poder tener un mejor surtido de ropa que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cosme worked for a number of businesses. All his jobs were on contract and he never had job seniority. He also was self-employed working as a public transportation driver and he never retired: he started his own business in order to better his situation. He opened a jewelry business in February 2006 as his wife had the same type of business and he saw it was going well, but because some clients did not pay him he decided to change businesses and began buying and selling new clothing and feels this business is better. Although he has not been selling clothing for very long, the business is going well and he has a good number of customers who buy his products. He is asking for a MXN $3,000 loan which he will repay in 6 bi-weekly installments to buy more merchandise and increase the stock of clothing to offer his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his clothing business

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es: La señora Zaida se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos desde hace siete años, inicio con dinero que Afodenic presto es por eso que da las gracias por que ha podido beneficiarse con sus préstamos. Tiene 30 años de edad, reside en villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 16 años de edad, con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda ya que viene el invierno otra vez y desea que su familia este en mejores condiciones. Va  a repellar las paredes y hacer un intermedio para tener privacidad ya que ella tapa con una sabana donde duerme.  Sus meta es poder mejorar la infraestructura donde tiene su negocio para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zaida has sold clothes and shoes for the last seven years. She started with money from Afodnic, and she is very grateful to have had the benefit of their loans. She is 30, and she lives in Villa Venezuela in Managua. She has two children, ages 5 and 16. With this loan she will buy construction materials to improve her home. Now that it is winter again she would like for her family to have better living conditions. She will plaster her walls and build a partition where she now hangs a sheet so she has privacy where she sleeps. Her goal is to be able to improve the structure where she has her business so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to plaster walls and build partition

loans.name: Noma

texts.en:
Noma F. is 47 years old and married with six children. She has three years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells taro to the public and to villagers two days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers, farming equipment, and chemicals for her plantation. Some of the loan will be saved to fund her children’s school fees and school activities. 

Noma has had one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala ($25 USD).

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer, knife, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells drinks and provisions. She is 32 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes to own a big super market in the future. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Basbaatar

texts.en: Basbaatar N. lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Basbaatar, with his wife, moved to the capital a few years ago. Since the move, he has been running a small retail business in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. With his wife, Basbaatar sells women's and men’s clothing at the stall that he rents in the Narantuul market. Basbaatar frequently travels to Beijing, China where he purchases cheap yet high quality clothing for his business. When he travels to Beijing, his wife Odgerel sits at the stall and sells the clothing. It has only been a couple of years since Basbaatar married his wife and they do not have any children yet. They would like to build a small house on the plot of land they own. Basbaatar hopes to have the house built before his first child is born. He requests a loan to purchase more clothing from Beijing, China. In the picture, Basbaatar's wife, Odgerel, is at their stall at the market.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, vive en el Jr. Libertad cdra. 01, Distrito Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 31 años, 02 hijos aun en etapa escolar.

Amelia, una mujer que fue capaz de cumplir una de sus metas, implementando su propio negocio  de venta de abarrotes y con el apoyo de su pareja salieron adelante. Nos cuenta, que siempre las cosas que uno quiere hacer en la vida, se las puede cumplir, con esfuerzo y dedicación; con su primer crédito que obtuvo en Manuela Ramos, se inicio a vender sus productos, poco a poco fue incrementándose mas y mas.
 En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya segura que a diario acude a su bodega a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando cosméticos de la línea Esika y CyZone.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the "Virgen de Las Mercedes" Village Bank. She lives on on the first block of Libertad Street in Juanjui District of Mariscal Caceres Province in San Martin Department. She is 31 years old and married with two school-age children. Amelia was able to achieve one of her goals when she opened her own neighborhood grocery store, and with the support of her husband she was able to get ahead in life. She believes that one can do anything in life with effort and dedication. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, Amelia started to sell her products, and was gradually able to buy more and more products. Today, she has regular customers who buy from her on a daily basis, since she stocks everything a housewife needs and always attends her clients with her own special brand of charisma. With this loan of 2000 soles, Amelia will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, different brands of canned fish, cleaning products and personal hygiene items in order to better serve her clients. She will also use part of the money to buy Esika and CyZone brand cosmetics. Today, Amelia feels like an accomplished woman, and she wants to keep working to get ahead in life and achieve her dreams. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her and many entrepreneurial women like her start and expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara abarrotes para su stock de productos

loans.name: Aterei B Akello Florence Group

texts.en: A. Florence is 40-years old, married, and has seven children (five of whom are school-aged). She takes care of two additional dependents, one of whom is school-aged. She deals in poultry, selling chickens locally. She has been in her business for three years. She is using the loan to purchase chickens for sale in local mobile markets. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her children and to obtain livestock too.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for sale in local mobile markets.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: A. sells tailoring material and clothes and she also sews clothes. A. is 33 years old and is married with 3 children. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells sarongs and fufu (made out of cassava). She is 49 years old and she has 6 children. Felicia is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs and cassava to sell. She say thanks you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and cassava

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is thirty-seven years old and married and she has 3 children who are all in school. She has been selling eggs for the past fifteen years. She obtains her supply of eggs from wholesalers and retails them to her customers, most of whom are food vendors. She wants to use her loan to buy crates of eggs to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use proceeds from her operation to build a stall where she can store her eggs. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is the 45-year-old single mother of two children aged 23 and 25 years. Both of her children are no longer schooling. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with five people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Mary resides and works in a semi-urban area. She sells clothes in Nalukongo market and works six days a week. She sells to all categories of people and on average she sells to fifteen customers a day. Her major monthly expenses include monthly market dues and she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.

Mary has been in this business for the last thirteen years and has been with MCDT for five years. She is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes.

Mary is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and also to owning as many as three stalls in Owino Market.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Laly Karito

texts.es: La señora Laly Karito, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 28 años y no tiene hijos.Laly Karito, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto y asi poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.Lleva 1 año dedicada en el negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes de su barrio y de otros lugares.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como: harina de maíz, azúcar y clavo de olor, para dar un rico sabor a sus bebidas. Rosa Graciela, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Laly Karito is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Dinámicas II”, which is located in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 28 years old, single, and has no children. Laly Karito is a woman who enjoys working, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks. She doesn’t have a set schedule for her business and she enjoys being her own boss. With 300 soles, she started her business by purchasing 3 packs of sodas. She did very well and started to gradually invest more into her business. Her business has been in operation for a year and she is well-known in her neighborhood and other places.

With her loan of 1500 soles, Laly Karito will buy more beverages such as sodas of different flavors, sizes and brands. She will also buy mineral water, carbonated and non-carbonated. Part of the money will also be invested in ingredients such as cornmeal, sugar, and cloves that will give rich flavor to her beverages.

Laly Karito has many goals and is motivated to make them a reality. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed assistance. She is responsible with her loan repayments and will continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas of different flavors

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Rosa, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad de Apurimac, pero reside en la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con el trabajo de secretariado, ella trabaja de secretaria  en la distribuidora fénix, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder hacer uso personal de este dinero, en cuanto a unos pagos que ella adquirió.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the community bank called “Leaders of the Third Millennium”. This community bank is located in Apurimac. Mrs. Rosa lives in Cusco. This member is 31 years old; she has a partner and two children. She alternates between several work activities. She works as a secretary for Phoenix Distributors. She is asking for a personal loan. She is willing to take on the payments. This member is appreciative of the opportunity to have the loan and promises to make the required payments.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Niavelle

texts.en: Niavelle D. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Niavelle owns and operates a business planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Niavelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Niavelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from GDMPC.
