She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz T. is from the village of Green Hills Suarez, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Luz is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables in the local market. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yawa Akoélé

texts.fr:
Yawa Akoélé M. est une dame de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, une ville située à 120  kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse des produits de l’alimentation générale. Avec ce crédit de Kiva, elle voudrait se ravitailler en achetant des cartons de sardines, de laits, de savons, de bougie, de l’allumette, de pâtes alimentaires, de détergents, de l’huile et autres. Avec ces bénéfices, elle aimerait s’occuper de ses 6 enfants sur le plan sanitaire qu’éducatif. 

FECECAV est une union de caisse créée en 1995 et agréée en 1997. Elle couvre la région des plateaux et maritime. Sa mission est de satisfaire les besoins financiers des populations de la région exclues du système financier classique. Elle compte aujourd hui plus de 50000 membres et entend étendre ses activités dans les autres localités environnantes de la région. FECECAV est à but non lucratif.
texts.en:
Yawa Akoélé M. is a 43-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children.  She lives in Lomé (capital of Togo), a city located 120 km from Kpalimé.  She is a retailer of grocery items.  With this Kiva loan, she would like to resupply herself by buying boxes of the following:  sardines, milk, soaps, candles, matches, pasta, detergents, oil, and more.  With the profits, she would really like to take care of her six children with regard to sanitation and education. FECECAV is a savings union created in 1995 and approved in 1997.  It covers the region of Plateaux and Maritime.  Its mission is to meet the financial needs of the people in the region who are excluded from the standard financial system.  Today, FECECAV has over 50,000 members and plans on extending its activities to surrounding towns in the region.  FECECAV is a not-for-profit organization.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food items

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard M., from the village of Eastern Poblacion Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, is 31 years old, married and the father of one school-aged child. To make a living, Richard owns and operates a fishing business whose main income is derived from selling fish in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 20 years, earning approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Richard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to expand the business and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary Miraflor

texts.en:
Mary Miraflor T. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Mary Miraflor is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mary Miraflor has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Miraflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Miraflor is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Miraflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand retail business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old. Emerita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emerita owns & operates a business selling specialty daily food products and bananas in the local community. Emerita has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emerita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out her borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Rehema B., age 30, is married and has three children, who are 5, 7 and 10 years old. She sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business since 2007. From the business, she is able to able to earn a monthly profit of around $110.

This will be Rehema’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business.
	
Rehema will share this loan with her loan subgroup, which includes two other members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Rehema is the woman in the middle of the picture.

loans.use: The loan will pay for fruits and vegetables to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of televisions and beauty products

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is from the village of Balulang in Cagayan de Oro. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Analyn makes and sells snacks, such as lumpia (spring rolls), waffles, and other delicacies, in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase the ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Analyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Hilvia

texts.es:
Hilvia, de 30 años, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres en compañía de su esposo Rubén (35), quien es agricultor, y de sus tres hijos; Elio (8),Vanesa(5) y Jordi (2).

Desde muy joven, esta trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura; siembra maíz y papa junto con su esposo. Con mucha paciencia vigilan sus cultivos hasta la temporada de cosecha y venden toda su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas que les paguen el mayor precio. Paralelamente, tiene una tienda de comestibles instalada en su vivienda y como es uno de los pocos negocios de la zona, le genera buenas ganancias. 
Siendo una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para producir más y ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, ya que quiere abastecerla con mayor cantidad de productos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que la ayudará a seguir trabajando en busca del progreso. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de alverjas, también comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes y abono para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Hilvia is 30 years old and lives in the house she inherited from her parents. Her husband Ruben (age 35) is a farmer and they have three children: Elio (age 8), Vanesa (age 5) and Jordi (age 2).

From a young age, Hilvia has worked hard has a farmer. She and her husband grow corn and potatoes. With great patience, she monitors her crops until harvest season. She sells all of her produce to the wholesale merchants who pay higher prices. At the same time, she manages a grocery store in her home. Since there are few businesses like hers in the area, she is able to generate good earnings. Being a very enterprising woman, Hilvia intends to plant more seeds in the future so that she can increase her output. She also plans to expand her store so that she can restock it with a larger quantity of products.

This is her second loan with MFP. Hilvia is very grateful to everyone who made it possible to receive this loan that will allow her to continue working. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds for a new crop of peas. She will also purchase various sacks of fertilizers and compost to maintain her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
La Señora Hilaria siempre quiso tener su negocio propio al darse cuenta que en su barrio no habían bodegas, ni bien junto algo de dinero lo hizo ella empezó vendiendo gaseosas después ya le pedían galletas y otras cosas mas, con el producto de sus ventas ella compraba lo que le pedían es así que de a pocos logro tener mas productos para vender. Su bodega esta creciendo al igual que sus ingresos, con el producto de su trabajo ha podido apoyar a sus hijos que están en la universidad los ayuda con la movilidad y alguna otra cosa. ella se siente feliz de poder apoyarlos, ellos también la ayudan en la  bodega, por otro lado su negocio marcha bien y como aun no hay competencia la venta es buena ahora esta  incursionando en la venta de gas y esta segura de que lograra clientela en ese rubro.
Hilaria se siente bien formando el grupo “LAS AGUILAS” del cual es  tesorera, su  préstamo lo usara para comprarse mas andamios para mostrar sus productos y tener mas ventas. el futuro lo tiene bien pensado pues quiere dedicarse a la venta por mayor de abarrotes ella esta segura que lo hará por que tiene el apoyo de sus hijos que serán profesionales gracias a su esfuerzo

*La señora Hilaria esta sentada con blusa amarilla y pantalón negro
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilaria always wanted to have her own business and she realized that there weren’t any convenience stores in her neighborhood. She saved money and began selling soft drinks and then cookies, and other things. With the profits from her sales she bought what people asked for and soon she succeeded in having more products to sell. Her store is growing as well as her income. With the profits from her work she has been able to support her children who are in the university. She helps them with transportation and other things. She is happy that she can help them and they also help her in the store. Her business is doing well and there is still no competition. Her sales are good and she has started selling gas and she’s sure she will get customers in this area. Hilaria feels part of the group “LAS AGUILAS”. She is the treasurer. She will use her loan to buy more shelving to display her products so she can have more sales. She has thought carefully about the future and she wants to work selling grocery products wholesale. She is sure that she will be able to do it because she has the support of her children who will become professionals thanks to her efforts. *Mrs. Hilaria is seated wearing a yellow blouse and black pants.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shelving for her store

loans.name: Sylvia Lorena

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Sylvia Lorena G. Rivera, tiene 30 años de edad, casado, es maestra Escuela Primaria de una comunidad Rural que se llama los laureles, tiene una hija, la que está cursando la escuela primaría.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de cuatro créditos, los que le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último para mejorar su vivienda, vale mencionar que en los tres créditos otorgados anteriormente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This is Sylvia. She is 30 years old, is married and she teaches elementary school in a rural community called "Los Laureles." She has a daughter attending elementary school. She has gotten four loans through our institution and has used the money for personal expenses and the latest to make improvements to her home. She has been very timely in repaying her previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Batan Orcco Group

texts.es:
Los socios del “BATAN ORCCO” se reúnen cada treinta días en el  distrito D. Huaro D. la provincia D. Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. El banco comunal está representado por las señoras; Julia que es la presidente, Livia que es la secretaria, Narcisa que es la tesorera y Martha que es el fiscal. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el II ciclo y está conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

En la ciudad D. Huaro los pobladores se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura y ganadería, Huaro es zona D. tierra fértil donD. se cultiva productos como por ejemplo maíz, zapallo, zanahoria, habas y etc. Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios es por ejemplo; venta D. tamales, compra y venta D. verduras, compra y venta D. granos secos, venta D. ponche y comida,  venta D. tubérculos y venta D. comestibles. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios como por ejemplo D. seguridad ciudadana. 

Martha es fiscal del banco comunal, tiene 44 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos y su actividad principal es la venta D. comestibles y su actividad complementaria es la venta D. jora D. chicha y la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo los cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, ella es una mujer trabajadora que participa en el programa corredor Puno – Cusco y en el vaso D. leche ayudando a sus vecinas D. la comunidad D. Huaro.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of “BATAN ORCCO” meet every 30 days in the Huaro district, located in the Quispicanchis province in the Cusco department. The communal bank is represented by three ladies; Julia who is the president, Livia who is the secretary, Narcisa who is the treasurer, and Martha who is the auditor. The bank finds itself in its second cycle and is maD. up of 10 hard working and enterprising people. They are constantly searching for opportunities that will help them get ahead and proviD. a better life for their children. In the city of Huaro the population depends exclusively on farming and raising livestock. Huaro is a zone of fertile land where they raise crops such as corn, squash, carrots, beans, etc. Some of the members' businesses involve; tamale sales, buying and selling vegetables and dried grain, sales of punch and food, and sales of tubers. Others proviD. services such as security. Martha, the auditor, is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Her primary activity is the sale of food, but she also sells "chicha" and raises livestock, such as guinea pigs. She's been doing this for a number of years and has been doing well, thanks to effort she puts into her work. She needs this loan in order to increase her working capital and to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs. She is a hard working woman who participates in the Puno – Cusco program, helping her neighbors in the Huaro community. The members value and appreciate the loan they received through this means and they promise to repay according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josefina's Group

texts.en: Josefina Y.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is 37 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of San Pedro. Josefina has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. Josefina is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Josefina Y.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es: Maria Marlene tiene 37 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio como una forma de vida para ella ya que en ese momento no tenía un medio de ingreso para ayudarse a mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Empezó vendiendo ropa para niños, pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado ampliar su oferta. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior.
texts.en:
Maria Marlene, 37, is a clothing merchant. She has been in this line of work for over 7 years. This became her way of life when she realized that she needed to have a source of income to support the two children she has under her care. She started out selling children's clothes but as time passed she widened her stock offerings. She will use the funds to buy pants, shirts, skirts, t-shirts and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Capital to invest in work

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophon R. (pictured here), age 28, and her husband, Mr. Sothy Ton, age 25, have been married since 2007 and just have one young son. The family lives along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophon sells shoes, feed for pigs, and cosmetics such as shampoo, powder, lotion and body spray…. Her husband is a motorcycle repairman. The house where they live is old and in bad condition which causes Sophon to want to build a new one. But she lacks money to use for her project. 

Hence she is asking for her first loan in the amount of US$ 1,000.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
Rosielyn L. is from the village of San Vicente, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, is single, and has one school-aged child. Rosielyn owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Rosielyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosielyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Flor De Mayo 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada D. oficios Domésticos, tiene 6 hijos, se dedica a la Tejeduría (Elaboración D. Sabanas y Manteles), cuenta con dos operarios y telares, con 12 años D. experiencia, recibe un crédito por medio del Banco Comunal denominado FLOR D. MAYO 2 el cual en conformado por dieciséis mujeres, cordinado por ella misma, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá como capital D. trabajo adquiriendo  materia prima, para incrementar elñ volumen D. producción y cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, sueña con ver su negocio mucho más granD. y que les generé mejores ganancias. D. igual manera las integrantes D. este grupo esperan que con la inversión que hacen capitalizando su negocio, hará que tengan mejoresD. ganacias y mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 45 years old and is a married homemaker with 6 children. She is a weaver (Making Sheets and Tablecloths), she has two operators and looms, with 12 years of experience. She is receiving a loan through the Communal Bank called FLOR D. MAYO 2 ("Flower of May 2") which is maD. up of sixteen women, who she coordinates. The loan received will be invested as working capital buying raw materials, to increase the production volume and cover the demand of the customers. She dreams of seeing her business grow much bigger and generate greater profits. Likewise the members of this group hope that with the investment that they make putting capital into their businesses, it will mean that they have better profits and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Martha Wangare

texts.en:
Martha Wangare is a businesswoman who has operated a retail shop in Naivasha town for over two years now.  She is 30 years old, married to Peter T., and they have five children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy retail goods to sell, including soap, sugar, rice and flour. Her main objective is to expand this business by ensuring that there is good stock available for her customers. 

Martha hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy retail goods to sell, including soap, sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudia Ingeniería Química en la Universidad Nacional, Melina tiene 2 teléfonos monederos en la tienda de su mama, además Melina realiza trabajos de bisutería en fantasía fina, sus productos los ofrece a los trabajadores de instituciones y también hace pedidos, también hace chocolates para eventos como el día de la madre.
Melina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y solicita un crédito de 750 soles para la compra de materiales.
Los sueños de Melina son tener una empresa relacionada a su carrera y tener una tienda de joyas y chocolates.
texts.en:
Melina is single and lives with her parents while she studies chemical engineering at the Universidad Nacional. Melina has 2 pay phones in her mother's store and makes costume jewelry. She sells thes jewelry to employees at various institutions and takes special orders. She also makes chocolates for special events like mother's day. Melina is a partner in the Delfin community bank and is requesting a loan of 750 Soles to buy materials. Melina's dreams are to have a company in a field related to her studies as well as jewelry and chocolate shop.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo P. is from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. He is 42 years old. Alfredo is single. To make a living, Alfredo owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month in these activity.

In 2007, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will again be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Alfredo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Milo

texts.en:
Milo P., age 47, is from the village of Salamague Lamut, Ifugao. He is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Milo raises livestock, specifically pigs, for fattening and sale. Milo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever he sells one of his raised animals.

Milo joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services. His goal was to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Milo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to build shelter for his livestock. This will be the first loan taken out by Milo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build shelter for the borrower's livestock.

loans.name: Margrete

texts.en: Magrete K. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim and other food items and is requesting a loan to stock more foods like cassava, potatoes etc. to sell. Magrete is 36 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more food stall like cassava, potatoes etc. to sell.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina Y. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods like green vegetables and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes to sell.  Edina is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children, one of whom goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Nohemi Luzmila

texts.es:
Nohemí es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudió hasta primero de educación secundaria.

Nohemí viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su  primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales menores.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar ovejas.

Su sueño es mejorar el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Nohemí is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Communal Bank.  It is in the Azángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  She is 24 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.  She completed the first year of high school.

Nohemí has been working with the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She used the money to increase the capital in her business of selling small farm animals.

She is requesting a new loan for 500 soles, which she will use to buy sheep.

Her dream is to improve her business.  What she likes most about her communal bank is what she gains in savings.

loans.use: To buy sheep for her business of selling small farm animals

loans.name: Jorge Camilo

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en una casa alquilada, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Santa Cruz, un distrito ubicado en la sierra norte del país y que pertenece a la región Cajamarca. Se encuentra situado a más de tres horas de viaje de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposa en la venta de golosinas, emoliente y comida, esta actividad la desarrollan desde hace 4 años, por lo que cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Ellos realizan esta actividad de manera ambulante valiéndose para ello de un triciclo.

Jorge se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, el destino del crédito será para implementar otro triciclo, con el cual piensan ampliar su negocio ya que están cerca las fiestas navideñas y durante estas fechas la demanda suele incrementarse. Con esta inversión el espera obtener mayores ingresos y poder mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in a rented house in the district of Santa Cruz, which is located in the northern mountains of the country and which belongs to the region of Cajamarca. Santa Cruz is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. 

He works with his wife to sell sweets, emoliente [an herbal beverage], and food. They have had this business for 4 years, so they have an established base of customers in the neighborhood. They work as street vendors and use a tricycle cart to carry everything.

Jorge is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will buy another tricycle cart, which they plan to use to expand their business, since the holiday season is coming up and demand usually increases. With this investment he hopes to increase his income and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle cart to expand his sweets-selling business.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 4 Group

texts.en:
Valeria is the coordinator of the group Banco mujeres poderosas 4 (Bank of Powerful Women). She makes her home in a simple structure here with her long-term partner. Valeria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is starting her business with this first loan, with which she plans to purchase curtains, blankets, and towels that she will sell. She will reinvest her profits in her business. She says that her most difficult challenge is that she doesn't have her own house. She plans to continue enjoying to dance and to sing.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to start a business, and her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy curtains, blankets, towels, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr: Beatrice N. est tailleur.  Elle a 31 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a une éducation d’école primaire.  Elle a 3 enfants entre 4 ans et 9 ans, et tous vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter es tôles, ciments, briques, et des portes pour la construction de sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et elle voudrait acheter 3 machines diversifiée pour son commerce de tailleur.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait avoir l’habitation.
texts.en: Beatrice N. is a tailor. She is 31 years old, widowed, and has a primary school education.  She has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 9. All attend school.  She will use her loan to buy sheet metal, cement, bricks, and doors for the construction of her house. Her business growth strategy is to save, and she would like to buy 3 different machines for her tailoring business. For her family, she would like shelter.

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal, cement, bricks, and doors for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabina; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. artesanía en un lugar llamado la posada del inca, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria, la socia venD. diferentes tipos D. artesanía como chompas, mantas y collares y aretes D. plata, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Los Andenes communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Gabina is 57 years old and married. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling handicrafts in a place called La Posada del Inca. She makes her sales by foot and offers different types of handicrafts such as sweaters, blankets and silver necklaces and earrings. She wants to expand her handicrafts business and is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts.

Gabina is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale handicrafts

loans.name: Henry Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Henry Jesus H. E. tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres  en el barrio Tabladita  de la ciudad de Tarija. Henry no es casado y no tiene hijos. El señor Henry se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años a la producción de plantas ornamentales las cuales las vende en las diferentes ferias y exposiciones de plantas que realiza la alcaldía. Henry quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de ampliar su vivero porque el que tiene ya esta pequeño. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la ampliación de su vivero, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                  Henry nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para seguir ampliando su vivero.
texts.en:
Señor Henry Jesus H. E. is 29 years old and lives in his parent's house in the Tabladita neighborhood in the city of Tarija.  Henry is not married and doesn't have any children. 

For more than 6 years now, Señor Henry has been growing ornamental plants that he sells in the various markets and plant shows in his municipality.  He wants to increase his income so that he can get ahead, but he tells us that he needs to expand his nursery because it is small.  It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan.  Henry tells us that he wants to improve his living conditions and that the next loan he requests will be used to expand his nursery even more.

loans.use: To expand his ornamental plants nursery

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza C. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jonaliza owns and operates a direct sales business offering cosmetics, clothing and shoe products in the local community. Jonaliza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Jonaliza joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jonaliza is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem K., 35, is married and lives with her four young children in the Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband is a soldier making $2.50 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Lem K. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to repair her house.

loans.use: repair the house

loans.name: Alfredo Sandro

texts.es: El señor Alfredo, se dedica al transporte en radio taxi, es una persona joven, tiene dos hijos mellizos, la esposa tiene la venta de carne, y por el momento se encuentra de viaje, ambos son parientes de un cliente antiguo y bueno, el joven invertirá en la compra de repuestos, como llantas y radio de comunicación para su transporte, ellos viven por la zona de peña azul, es una pareja joven y responsable que trabajan mucho por el bienestar de su hijo, su deseo del Sr. Alfredo desea poder comprarse su casita y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Alfredo works for a radio taxi business.  He is a young man with twin children.  His wife sells meat and, at the moment, she is traveling.  They are both relatives of a respectable, long-standing client.  This young man will invest his loan in buying spare parts such as tires and a two-way radio for his vehicle.  Alfredo and his wife live in Peña Azul.  They are a young and responsible couple who work hard for the well-being of their children.  Alfredo's wish is to be able to buy his own house and thereby provide his family with better comfort.  He is grateful to the institution for the support with which they have provided him.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Jose Lazaro

texts.es:
Don José Lázaro, de 55 años de edad,  reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipián, es un señor de familia, vive con sus hijos y nietos. Don José tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la producción agrícola, aprendió en su familia desde pequeño el proceso que lleva el trabajo de la tierra.
Actualmente quiere sembrar maíz y pipián, para lo que solicita un préstamo y cubrir con él los gastos en abono y fertilizantes, esto le permitirá estar preparado con los materiales para cuando inicie el proceso del cultivo.
Para don José la actividad agrícola significa mucho, por lo que no quiere dejar algún día de cultivar el maíz y pipián,  cada año se esfuerza por tener una mejor producción y dar los cuidados necesarios, ya que de este trabajo depende su familia.
texts.en:
Don José Lázaro is 55 years old and lives in the division of Jiquilisco in Usulután region.   He works in growing corn and pipián fruit.  He is a family man who lives with his ​​children and grandchildren. Don José has been devoted to agricultural production for 20 years, since childhood he has learned from his family the ways of working the land.

Currently he wants to sow corn and pipián fruit, which is why he is requesting a loan to cover expenses of manure and fertilizers.  This will allow him to be prepared with the materials for when he starts the cultivation process.

For Don José farming means a lot, so he doesn't want to miss one day of growing corn and pipián fruit.  Each year he strives for better production and to take care of necessities, as his family is dependent on this work.

loans.use: to cover the costs of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a business-lady who sells second-hand clothes. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She also relies on her husband for financial support. She works hard in her business so as to help her husband in raising their eight children. She hopes to have a stable business within five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Vivitz Grace

texts.en:
Vivitz Grace R., from the city of Dipolog City, is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Vivitz Grace owns and operates a bakery selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Vivitz Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan, she is requesting her second loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase flour and other ingredients for her bakery. Vivitz Grace plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour and other ingrediets for her bakery

loans.name: Alban

texts.es: Alban A. C., tiene la edad de 30 años, está casado  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el dinero realizar la preparación del terreno para que esté en buenas condiciones y así facilitar  su siembra. El cuenta con experiencia en este cultivo y quiere lograr una mayor producción de frijol por lo cual le hará esta asistencia al terreno para así obtener mejoras este año en cuanto a producción. El con esto quiere generar las ganancias e ingresos para su bienestar familiar y también para seguir invirtiendo en esto y crecer como agricultor  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alban A. C. is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children who are his highest priorities. He intends to use the money for preparing his land so that it will be in good condition to facilitate planting. Alban has experience in cultivating crops and wants to achieve better bean production. For this reason, he is requesting assistance for his land so that his production will improve this year. He hopes to generate earnings and income for the welfare of his family. In addition, he wants to continue investing in his land and grow as a farmer.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Alban has not had any previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing beans.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is a policeman and he has worked with the police as a dog expert since 1995. 

At the same time, he, his wife and his mother are engaged in farming. They raise cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. They also grow potatoes on their farm. With profit from farming they are able to meet their family’s needs and develop their farm.
   
Vardan is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer. 

Vardan is 38 years old and he has three children who are pupils. Vardan and his family live in Zovaber village in the Sevan area.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia, 24 years old, is married with a 2-year-old child. She has been operating a beauty salon for one year. Her business is well-organized. Claudia works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. every day and employs three people to help her. 

Claudia has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase new materials such as chairs, hair cream, etc. for her beauty salon. She will reinvest any profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase new materials such as chairs, hair cream, etc.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La señora Zonia es socia D. banco comunal Las Fresitas D. Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Ella se dedica a brindar servicio D. alquiler D. motocarro, el pago por alquiler es diario, esto le permite solventar los gastos básicos D. su casa.

Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, pagará al mecánico por el mantenimiento D. su motocarro, comprará 1 sistema D. arrastre, 2 llantas traseras, 2 cámaras, 2 intermitentes, 1 par D. espejos, 6 focos.
El dinero que recibe a diario lo guarda para cualquier emergencia y también le sirve para el pago a Manuela Ramos, solo tiene un hijo a quien paga sus estudios ya que el otro es independiente.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por permitirle tener un negocio con el que pueD. ayudar a su hijo, solo espera que todo le vaya bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zonia is a member of the communal bank Las Fresitas [The Little Strawberries] from the district of Yarinacocha and department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living providing motocar rental services. The rental payments are maD. daily, which allows her to cover basic living expenses in her home. 

With her new loan of S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, she will pay the mechanic for maintenance of her motocar. She will buy one towing system, two rear tires, 2 chambers, 2 signal lights, one pair of mirrors and 6 light bulbs. 

The money she receives each day she keeps for any emergency, and it also is available for making payments to Manuela Ramos. She is only paying for the education of one child since the other is now independent. 

She thanks Manuela Ramos for allowing her to have a business by which she can help her son. She only hopes that everything go well.

loans.use: to purchase a towing system and tires for her motocar.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia believes in saying "try and try until you reach success".  Cecilia is 37 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. 

She has a retail store where she sells different products in the community.  Cecilia has had this business for 7 years and she earns approximately PHP 5,000.  Cecilia is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods to sell to her customers.

In the future, Cecilia hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.en:
Rosalio is 46 years old and single with one child. He has a small grocery store in Urubamba in which he sells all kinds of groceries. He also has a small farm at his house where he produces corn and vegetables. At times he travels to Cusco in order to sell the corn that he has grown on his farm. 

With his $1,000 loan, Rosalio plans to purchase all types of groceries so that he may expand his grocery store. He is hard working and committed to making all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon, a 36-year-old married father of two, lives in the Philippines where he has been providing motorcycle or habal-habal services for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, Marion has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the service's utilities. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the service's utilities

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Amavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Amavi travaille comme revendeuse d’oranges depuis 2002. 
Amavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des oranges.
texts.en: Amavi is a forty year old mother of two children who is married to a chauffeur/driver and lives in Togo. She has been working in orange sales since 2002. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more oranges from a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: Purchase oranges

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh. For the past ten years she and her husband have earned a living running a general store.

Hanh would like to take a loan of 12,000,000 VND to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods including snack foods and confectionaries to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers.

Hanh hopes that because of the loan her business will yield a higher income. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Mariela Margarita

texts.es:
Mariela nació hace 34 años en salitre, pero vive en Guayaquil con sus hijos específicamente en la zona periurbana de isla trinitaria (localidad de Guayaquil). Ella tiene varios años con su negocio que es un bazar en donde vende artículos varios del hogar, en sus actividades diarias que inician desde las 7 am tiene la ayuda de su madre.
Es madre  y mantiene sola a sus 3 hijos los cuales son buenos estudiantes de una escuela fiscal. La zona en la que vive es muy insegura pero está en proyecto de regeneración. Al momento está realizando un préstamo el cual lo va a utilizar para comprar artículos del hogar y como adicional quiere hacer recargas para teléfonos celulares, además vender confitería.
En el futuro espera que le siga yendo bien como hasta ahora y tener un local más grande y surtido.
texts.en:
Mariela was born 34 years ago in Salitre.  She now lives in Guayaquil with her children, in the peri-urban area of Isla Trinitaria (town of Guayaquil).  She has owned her business for several years.  Mariela has a store where she sells various household products.  She has her mother's help in her daily activities which start at 7.00am.

Mariela is a mother and she supports her three children on her own.  They are good students and attend a public (state) school.  The area where Mariela lives is unsafe but it is part of a regeneration project.  Right now, Mariela is requesting a loan to buy household products.  She would also like to offer her customers cell phone minutes and candy.

Mariela's hopes for the future are for her business to continue to do well as it has up until now.  She would like to have larger and better stocked premises.

loans.use: to buy cell phone minutes and candy

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is at the site where she makes palm kernel oil for sale at Abura in the Central Region of Ghana. She is divorced and has seven children. She uses her income to provide for the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy palm nuts to make oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts to make oil for sale.

loans.name: Jumapili

texts.en: Jumapili has fully repaid his first Kiva loan three months ahead of schedule. He is now taking a bigger loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), with which he intends to renovate his chicken house, add more chicks and chicken feeds. He dreams of becoming a main supplier of eggs in the region and also incorporating a spare parts shop in the future.

loans.use: To start a poultry business, purchase poultry feeds and add more chicks.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Her daughter is only 2 years old, while her sons are getting their education. 
Her husband is a watchman by profession. His income is not enough for fulfilling the needs of the family.  A few years ago, Shaheen started a sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband. She receives orders from her clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders in less time and increase her profits. 
She has 6 years of experience in her work and she is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her and help her establish her business. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 10 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara platos como estofado de pollo, lomo saltado y sopas, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” community bank. It is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Hilda; she is 44 years old, married, and has ten children. She divides her time between her daily responsibilities at home and her small business. Hilda prepares dishes such as stewed chicken, Peruvian stir fry, and soup, and sells them from a street cart from 9:00 a.m. to 7 p.m. The income she generates from her business helps her support her children. Hilda wants to expand and improve her food preparation services. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as rice, meat, poultry and vegetables.

Hilda is happy to have access to this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, meat, poultry and vegetables.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 39 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children, ages four to ten; all of them are in school and live at home. For the past five years she has been selling water and peanuts in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack and peanuts for her business. She hope to improve her business and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: purchase more water by the sack and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by earning an income as a driver for hire. 

For four years, Diep has supported her family by selling lottery tickets in various locations. She would like a loan to expand her business as a lottery ticket vendor and to buy a larger quantity of lottery tickets to sell. In addition, she intends to buy a motorbike for her business, which will enable her to cover greater distances. 

Diep hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets to sell and a motorbike for her business activities.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng is a 39-year-old married woman who has been residing in Reussey Keo commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh city. Seng and her husband are working for the same company. Together they are able to earn a monthly salary of $200 per month. They are blessed with a young child who is attending a local primary school.

With the sum of $500, Mrs. Seng will build a small room made of bricks under her wooden house. This is her second loan from HKL and Kiva, and Seng hasn’t made a late payment on any of her previous loans.

loans.use: to build a small room made of bricks under her wooden house

loans.name: Reina Argentina

texts.es:
Reina Argentina tiene 38 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 16 y dos años de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Reina se dedica al comercio y a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 7 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para tener como capital y comprar los insumos y semillas.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. El sueño tener bien arreglado la casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pintarse las uñas.
texts.en:
Reina Argentina is 38 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two sons who are 16 and 2 years old. She lives in the Ventanas region of Los Ríos. She is a member of the San Juan Community Bank located in San Francisco in the district of San Juan. The group members work in agriculture.

Reina has worked for seven years in commerce and farming rice and corn. She buys and sells in San Juan. She is asking for a loan to have for the capital needed to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will be of great help for her to buy seeds without any type of financial trouble. She has had no problems so far. Her dream is to have her house in good condition. In her free times she likes to paint her nails.

loans.use: get the capital to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a widow with seven children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a fish business, selling door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand in the future.

Nazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale with a 10,000 KES loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es:
Henry Francisco tiene 21 años es soltero, vive con los padres y abuelos  no tiene hijos. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Henry Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  Su sueño es comprar tener casa propia y una finca para tener animales.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte festejar las fiestas junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Henry Francisco, 21, is single living with his parents and grandparents; he has no children.  He lives in Recinto Las Blancas in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “26 de Noviembre” communal bank is located in Recinto Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Henry Francisco is a corn, rice and pigeon pea farmer; he buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market.

He asked for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure like urea and insecticides that are commonly used for crops.  The loan has helped him increase family income and to invest in seeds and supplies.  His dream is to have a house of his own and a farm to raise animals.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports and celebrating feast days with his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Laly

texts.es:
Laly de 19 años de edad. Convive con Alan, su pareja con quien cuida a Andrews, su hijo de 4 años. Ésta joven familia habita un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo en el distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Laly está orgullosa con los resultados de sus esfuerzos y sacrificios. 
Ella y Alan se dedican a al agricultura. Ellos saben que les conviene y como negociarlo. En todo este tiempo juntos aprendieron que el café, el kión y las yucas nunca deben faltar en sus terrenos de cultivo. Es así que cuentan con una parcela y media de café y yuca cultivado y otra parcela de kión . Estas siembras están bien cuidadas y atendidas.
“Cada año el café me bota 30 sacos y el kión 1500 kilos. La yuca la vendo por arrobas a 12 soles, me va muy bien”, menciona. Los días en que los precios bajan, son desfavorables, pero nunca llegaron a perder su inversión.
Los compradores ya conocen a Laly y saben de la calidad de sus productos por eso los vende con facilidad, muchas veces en su propia comunidad. Espera iniciar más siembras adquiriendo más terrenos cultivables. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Laly obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo”, del que se muestra entusiasmada.
Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de víveres para la preparación de alimentos para los jornaleros que trabajarán sus tierras, a quienes también pagará por sus servicios.
texts.en:
Laly, 19, lives with her partner Alan, with whom she takes care of Andrews, her four-year-old son.  This young family live in their own home in the native community of San Pablo in the district of Pichanaki, province of Chanchamayo.  Laly is proud of the results of her effort and sacrifice.

She and Alan work in agriculture.  They know it is worthwhile for them and how to negotiate it.  In all this time together they learned that their fields should never be without coffee, ginger, and yucca.  This is why they have one-and-a-half plots of coffee and yucca and another plot of ginger.  These plants are well cared for and tended.

"Every year gives me 30 sacks of coffee and 1500 kilos of ginger.  I sell the yucca at 12 'soles' [$4.45 USD] per 11.5 kilos.  It is going very well for me," she mentions.  The days on which prices go down are unfavorable, but it never came to losing their investment.

The buyers already know Laly and they know about the quality of her products, so she sells them easily, many times in her own community.  She hopes to introduce more plants, acquiring more arable land.

This will be the first loan that Laly will get from MFP.  She is excited about it.  Now she is part of Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo Communal Bank, about which she is enthusiastic.

She will invest the money in buying food to prepare meals for the day laborers who will work their land, whom they also will pay for their services.

loans.use: to pay for the services of day laborers and buy food to feed them.

loans.name: Marinete

texts.es:
La  Sra. Marinete es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada, su marido trabaja por Asunción. Tiene 4 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 2 menores que aun van a la escuela.
Ella cuenta que tiene una cantina en la Facultad de Cepeia, además se dedica a la compra y venta artículos de mercería. Tiene una clientela bien formada debido a la buena calidad de los productos y a los buenos precios que tiene. Nos dice que gracias a estos negocios ella ha podido mantener a su familia y ayudar también a su marido.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su mercería con prendas de verano y así surtirse para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Marinete is from the city of Santaní.  She is 42 years old, and she is married.  Her husband works for the city of Asunción.  She has 4 children, 2 who are older and 2 who are younger and still go to school.
She says that she has a snack shop in the Department of Cepeia.  In addition, she buys and sells hardware products.  She has a well-established clientele due to the good quality of the products and the good prices that she has.  She tells us that thanks to these businesses, she has been able to take care of her family and help her husband as well.
She is asking for the loan to supply her hardware store with summer garments, and therefore stock up to offer a better variety to her customers.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use:
buy summer garments in order to supply her hardware store.
Comprar prendas de verano para abastecer su mercería.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is a married woman with four children; three adults and one dependent child. She does a sari-sari (variety) store and hog raising business for their sustainability. She has been in this business for three years with the help of her husband, who is a retired army. Ermelinda wants to operate this business continuously. That is why, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans to improve her store. She will use the money to buy grocery items such as drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, snack foods, toiletries and food seasonings. Other part of her loan amount is to buy feed for her pigs. In this way, she will be able to improve her sales and augment their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy uy grocery items such as drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, snack foods, toiletries and food seasonings; feed

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Mr MICHAEL K. is a pastor of a local church (Full Gospel). He is married with 3 children. His eldest girl is married. In addition to his pastoral duties, he is also a farmer specializing in raising pigs. The loan of $225 to Mr K. is intended to purchase feed for his growing stock. Once they mature, they are sold to one of the major meat processing companies. The project is intended also to act as a training ground for his church members as a way of empowering them economically. Pastor K. is therefore providing an important service to the local community, and this is a project that deserves our support by PEMCI.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Felichesm

texts.en:
M. lives in Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. He owns a shop selling different consumable items. He aims at increasing the stock of soft drinks. Soft drinks have high turnover in his shop. The demand for soft drinks in Dar es Salaam is high because of the weather - it is hot throughout the year. The profit margin of soft drinks, mainly Pepsi cola are high if a retailer buys more than 50 crates at a time.

The loan requested will enable M. to buy in quantities that will make his business profitable. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000.

loans.use: Buy stock for soft drink business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
My name is Rosa M. and I have dedicated myself to selling popular goods at my convenience store for the past four years. My business is well-stocked, but I need a wider variety of products to increase my sales volume. With the earnings I'll be able to remodel my store, which is part of my home, and provide for my two children (I'm a single mother).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Rosa M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi negocio esta muy surtido de productos pero neccesito tener una mayor variedad de productos para tener mejores ventas, con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y alimentar mis dos hijos ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase milk, sweet and white bread, churros, chocolate, deodorant, cheese, butter, lard, oil, salt, sugar, tortillas, chicken, nail clippers, etc.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin C. is a 43-year-old widow. She has 4 children, 1 of whom is an electrician. The electrician owns a shop and Mrs. Yin C. would now like to receive this loan in order to expand the shop's inventory.

loans.use: To purchase tools and some equipment for her son's electric shop

loans.name: Ilhem

texts.en: Ilhem M. (pictured on the left) sells fruits and vegetables at the bazaar in his northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Ilhem has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years and he is married with two children. He has already successfully re-paid two loans with Norwegian Microcredit. His last loan was in the amount of $600 and he is currently looking to get $1,200 so that he can begin to build a store where he can sell his produce.

loans.use: Ilhem would like to begin constructing a shop where he can sell his produce.

loans.name: Ijeoma

texts.en: Ijeoma O. is 27 years old and married. She hails from Ajamgbadi, in Lagos State, Nigeria. Ijeoma sells motorcycle parts to support her family and children. Ijeoma has been in the business since 1999, and she would like a loan of $450 to purchase motorcycle parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle part for sale

loans.name: Talafou

texts.en: Talafou is 40 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer and a very hard working man. Talafou and her family are very poor. They hardly eat meat in a week. Through years of struggling and sacrificing, her family has managed to earn good money from their plantation. They have slowly improved their family house and managed to build a flushing toilet. Talafou decided to grow a vegetable garden so they can earn extra money. With her first loan she will buy the necessary equipment to build her garden.

loans.use: Talafou would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru:
Hakim H. is 53 years old and has 4 children. His oldest daughter is getting married. According to our traditions, it is customary to give a gift of furniture and appliances for the house to the newlyweds. This is why Hakim decided to purchase a bedroom set for credit. Hakim works as head specialist in the local administration of Khujand city. His salary is insufficient in order to purchase the furniture for cash. This is why he decided to come to the microcredit organization MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Хомидов Хаким, возрост 53 года имеет 4 детей. Старшую дочь хочет выдать замуж, но по нашим обычааям принято дарить в подарок для молодожен мебель или необходимую технику для дома. Поэтому Хаким решил купить в кредит спальный гарнитур.Хаким работает главным специалистомв хукумате г. Худжанда. Средний заработок у него не достаточен для покупки мебели за наличные. И он решил обратится к нам в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Furniture purchase

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Mwajuma C.. In 2006, Mwajuma established a general store, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional goods in bulk for her store. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly L., 34, is married and has four children. She earns $3 per day as a garment worker. Her husband Mr. Saom Suy, 38, is a wedding chef in the village and normally earns about $2.50 a day. All four of their children are students.

This loan will be used to purchase groceries, plates, and pans as well as renovate their house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, plates, and pans as well as renovate their house
