loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
Blanca Adriana H. is originally from the Somotillo area of Chinandega an dshe sells second hand shoes and clothing. She sells in the nearby markets of this community. For approximately 11 years she has worked to improve her quality of life and she has dreams of selling greater quantities of clothing and shoes to her faithful customers.

Ceprodel has been a pillar of support for her business as it has provided the loans used to buy merchandise from her suppliers. Today once again she has approached our institution to obtain a loan and thereby continue growing her business and meeting the needs of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Blanca Adriana H. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega y se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos ambos de segunda mano. Ella vende en las cercanías al mercado de esta comunidad. Desde hace doce años aproximadamente ha venido esforzándose para mejorar su nivel de vida y es por esto que sus sueños son ampliar su negocio vendiendo mayores cantidades de ropa y zapatos a sus fieles clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por el hecho de que le ha proporcionado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de su mercadería a los proveedores. Hoy en día una vez mas acude a la institución para obtener el crédito y de esta manera continuar con la manutención de su negocio y además con las necesidades de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and clothing

loans.name: Dayzi Inocencia

texts.es:
Dayzi comes from a humble family that has advanced in small steps from a grocery business they've run. She has 4 children and has been a very industrious person since a young age. Currently, this is the fourth loan that seeks as an individual, having had an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dayzi proviene de una familia humilde que poco a poco sacaron adelante un negocio de abarrotes tine 4 hijos, es una prsona muy trabajadora desde pequeña. Actualmente es el cuarto credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 39 years old, doesn't have a happy family as many other people. She divorced herr ex-husband and their children are currently living with her. Her job at a manufacturer give her 1.5 million VND monthly. Throughout the 12 years with TYM, she had taken out many loans to invest in breeding pigs and opening variety stores. With a good location (her house is right near the main street) her small business has been doing very well with almost 80 thousands VND daily. She would like to borow 19 million VND for this cycle to invest into the variety store. He monthly income is 4 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị N. 39 Tuổi, không được hạnh phúc như bao gia đình khác, chị đã ly hôn chồng, hiện có 1 người con đang sống cùng chị và đang làm công nhân tại công ty bao bì thu nhập ổn định 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Qua 12 năm tham Quỹ chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế, từ những vòng vốn đầu chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn cho đên nay chị đã chuyển sang bán hàng nước giải khát, với lợi thế nhà chị ở mặt đường nên số khách đến quán chị rất đông, thu nhập bình quân từ bán hàng 80.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư thêm hàng giải khát và mua săm thiết bị tủ lanh. Thu nhập bình quân: 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Seok

texts.en:
Mrs. Seok C., 47, is a widowed grocery seller in Tonle Bet Krom Village, Kampong Cham Province. She earns around $2 per day and lives with her three children. One of her children is a driver for a private transportation company, while another works for a tobacco factory. Part of her children's income support the family's expenses. As C.’s business expands, she would like to request a loan of $200 to purchase more grocery stocks to sell. The loan will allow her to increase her income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks

loans.name: Upendo (Delete This Enterpreneur) Group

texts.en:
Zena has owned a salon in Dar Es Salaam since 2007. She is 25 years old, married, and has one 7-year-old child. She works daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm at her salon. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $150, but she is hoping that taking out this loan will help her to expand her business and increase her profit. She intends to purchase lotions and other items for the salon with the loan.

Zena will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members. Businesses of the group members include charcoal, clothing, and fabric sales.

loans.use: To buy lotion and other items for salon.

loans.name: Maryam's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Maryam R. is 27 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 12 and 4 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit about $25 from her sales.

Maryam R. is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes (vitenge & khanga--traditional Tanzanian clothing) for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maryam A..

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge &khanga) for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun B. is 34 years old and breeds pigs for a living. She has a full year of experience raising the pigs at her home. Thoeun is married to Mr. Preng Koem, 34, a fisherman, and they have three children, all of whom live at home and attend school. Thoeun talked with her husband about their lack of capitals to expand the business, and she decided to ask for a $400 loan to purchase more piglets to breed. The loan will help grow their business and increase their income to better meet the family's living expenses. Thoeun is one the leader of a group of three women sharing the loan. The other two are:

1. Mrs. Choem N., 25, a fish seller. She depends on her husband to do the fishing, while she sells the fish in the market. Choem requests a loan of $300 to purchase fishing tools, such as nets and traps, for her husband's business.

2. Mrs. Vuttha S., 38, also a fish seller. She purchases fish from a supplier and sells them in the market. Vuttha seeks a loan of $300 to stock fish for resale. The women all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to breed

loans.name: Zokhra

texts.en:
Zokhra has been in cafe business for ten years. She is a mother of three children. This woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. She was born in 1955.

Now, Zokhra needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy kitchen appliances for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances for her cafe.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana sells foodstuffs and sachet water. She has been in this business since the year 2002. Juliana needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more frozen foods like chicken and turkey to sell. She is happy because the festive season will attract more customers to her store and she hopes to make more profits.

Juliana is a LAPO client. She and her family live in Issashi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Karina Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Karina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró productos de belleza de unique para vender. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que estudia nutrición en la universidad.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza de unique.
Karina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser directora de su empresa de productos de belleza y montar un restaurante de comida andina nutritiva.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 25 years old, single, and does not have children. With her first loan for S/ 500 she bought Unique beauty products to sell. She has been working with the Communal Bank for almost 4 years and she tells us that she studies nutrition at the university. With his loan for S/. 2, 500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy a large quantity of Unique beauty products. Karina wishes to continue working to become director of her beauty product business and open a restaurant of nutritious Andean food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is fifty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, three of whom are females and five males. The last born is currently in the junior high school. The grown-ups have completed school and some are learning trades, while others are working. Georgina’s husband is a farmer who cultivates both cash crops and food crops such as cocoa, plantain, cassava, banana, etc. Georgina lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in Offinso. Ofinso is a farming as well as a commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

She is industrious, and sells maize to support her husband in taking care of the family. Georgina buys bags of maize from farmers who come from the surrounding villages to sell at affordable prices. She later sells it at the local market, especially to the food vendors in her community. Georgina has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy maize in large quantities so she can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca”, centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 meses, ella se dedica al engorde de ganado menor (ovejas y chanchos); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas ganado (ovejas) las que vendió en forma de carne en las ferias de Ilave. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir ganado mayor(un toro) para engordarlo y venderlo a un mejor precio en las ferias de Ilave o Pilcuyo; con las ganancias obtenidas ahorrara y juntara capital para adquirir mas ganado, en el futuro ella quiere comprarse una casa para su hijo y su familia, así como contribuir en la educación y sustento de su hijo.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the community bank Ciudad Blanca, in the town of Chijichaya, Ilave district, Collao province, department of Puno. She is 24 years old, married, has two children, and a high school education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six months. Roxana raises livestock (sheep and pigs), and used her first loan of 500 soles to purchase more sheep, which she sold for meat at the fairs in Ilave. With a new loan of 900 soles, which Roxana plans to repay in three monthly instalments, she can purchase a bull to raise. Later, she will be able sell the bull for a good price at a fair in Ilave or Pilcuyo. With those profits, she plans to buy more livestock, eventually buy a house for her family, and put money toward her son's education and well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle (a bull) to raise and later sell at market for a better price.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
La señora María Graciela es viuda y pensionada a parte cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, obtiene otros ingresos ya que tiene una tiendita de variedad, en ella vende collares, aretes y entre otras cosas también fritos con queso etc. 
Por tal motivo es que esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Graciela is a widow. She receives a pension and her children also help her with her expenses. She also depends on the income she receives from a small variety store that she has. In the store she sells necklaces, earrings and other things, like nachos. She is asking for a loan so that she will be able to invest the money in her business.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in store

loans.name: Guillerma,

texts.es:
Guillerma tiene cincuenta y siete años, a su edad maneja un negocio rentable de confección y tejido.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en diversos talleres de confección, pues uno desaparecía detrás del otro, pero siempre conseguía un puesto de trabajo debido a su dedicación y responsabilidad que la caracterizan.

Le iba muy bien por ello decidió independizase hace diez años y trabajar por su cuenta en su casa. Ella ofrece el servicio de confección industrial de manteles, forros de sofás, sábanas y también tejido de chompas con  lana e hilo al por mayor y menor.

Ella cuenta que se especializó en ambos rubros,  tejido y confección puesto que el primero le genera ingresos en la temporada de invierno y lo segundo en  temporadas cálidas como el verano. En un futuro tiene pensado comprar un puesto en algún mercado o centro comercial para vender sus productos.

Con su trabajo ella sola se encarga de mantener su hogar, puesto quedo viuda hace algún tiempo. su tercer hijo de veintiocho años la apoya en todo. También se encarga de criar y educar a su menor hijo de catorce años.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 57 years old and runs a profitable sewing and weaving business. She has always worked in various sewing shops, but each one eventually disappeared. She always had a job because she of the dedication and responsibility that she is known for. Things were going well and 10 years ago she decided to become independent and work for herself. She offers the service of making blankets, sofa covers, sheets and also wool sweaters and wholesale thread. She specializes in both categories, sewing and weaving because sewing provides her with income during the summer months and weaving in the winter. In the future she would like to buy a booth in a market or shopping center where she will sell her products. With her job she supports herself and her home, since she was widowed awhile ago. Her third son who is 18 years old helps with everything. She also cares for her youngest child who is 14 years old.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to make sheets and sofa covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on rice

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Selenge T. is 21 years old and lives with her mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Selenge is a senior majoring in German Studies in one of the large universities in Ulaanbaatar. In order to pay her tuition and living expenses, she runs a small food retail store, in cooperation with her mother. Her mother works at the cashier in Selenge's food store.

Selenge and her mother started their business in 2006 by using one of their bedrooms in her apartment. Since the beginning, they have done well and expanded their business. Selenge hopes to successfully graduate from her university and focus on her business expansion. She requests a loan to purchase more food products to sell at her store.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Aurora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Nicolás de Pierola  cdra. 05 –, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 66 años y es madre de 09, tres de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, con un local muy acondicionado, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz del trabajo que hace y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Aurora, a customer of the Community Bank “El Abiseo”, lives in Jr. Nicolás de Pierola cdra. 05 –,in the Juanjui district of San Martín. She is single, 66 years old, and has 9 children, three of whom still depend on her. Faced with the necessity to provide an income for her home, the self motivated Rosa started a small business selling groceries with her first loan of S/. 300.00. She was successful from the start due to the quality of her products, her reasonable prices and fine customer service. Currently, she operates the business out of her home, with a site in good condition, where her main customers are the people in her neighborhood. With this loan of S/. 3,000.00, Rosa will purchase more inventory to stock her business, such as rice and sugar by the kilo, eggs in bulk, personal hygiene and cleaning products, soft drinks by the case, sweets and other products to please her customers. Rosa is very happy with the work she has and thanks Manuela Ramos, for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes Manuela continues her work for a long time and helps many families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in inventory to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hạ Nguyễn Thị (1044061364) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four school-aged children.

Hạ owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Hạ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Hạ is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Milca

texts.es: Milca tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Ella estudió la profesión de agronomía, una vez egresada hizo planes de sembrar numerosas hectáreas en su pueblo de Huasahuasi, denominado “La zona semillera del Perú”. Este proyecto lo hizo junto a su padre y a su esposo, quienes le brindaron todo el apoyo posible. Sembraron varias chacras de papas y en esa época el precio de la papa les favoreció. Desde entonces, cada cosecha la enviaba al mercado de mayorista de Lima, donde le generaba mejores ganancias, con las que adquirió su carro, fueron años de bonaza a base de trabajo duro. Pero desde que tuvo un embarazo y un parto riesgoso, aminoró sus siembras; entonces decidió instalar una bodega en la casa de su suegra en aras da captar dinero para su hogar. Mientras tanto su esposo sigue trabajando con su carro transportando productos desde La Merced (selva de Junín) a Lima. Ahora, esta pareja se ha propuesto comprar pronto un terreno y construir su casa propia. Este es el cuarto crédito de Milca con MFP, durante los 3 periodos anteriores consecutivos era la presidenta de su banco comunal, pero dejó el cargo debido a que se mudó a otro lugar más alejdo, pero para las reuniones asiste puntualmente y apoya en las cobranzas. Cabe resaltar que Milca es muy recta, vela por el ahorro de sus compañeros y los orienta con mucha paciencia para que usen su dinero sabiamente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y con la otra mitad comprará productos comestibles para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Milca, 31, is married and has a son. They are currently living in her mother-in-law’s house. She studied the profession of agronomy. Once she graduated she made plans to plant numerous hectares in her town of Huasahuasai, which is called “The seedbed of Peru”. She worked on this project together with her father and her husband, who offer her all of the support possible. They planted various fields of potatoes, and potato prices were favorable at the time. From then on she sent every harvest to the wholesale market in Lima, where it generated better earnings. She used the earnings to get a car. They were boom years. But, since she had a pregnancy and delivery that were high risk, she decreased her planting. She then decided to set up a store in her mother-in-law’s house in order to get more money for her household. Meanwhile, her husband continues to work with his car transporting products from La Merced (forest in Junín) to Lima. Now, her husband has suggested buying some land and building their own house soon. This is Milca’s fourth loan with MFP. She was the president of her community bank for the last three previous periods. But, she had to leave her post because they moved to another place that is farther away. But, she attends the meetings punctually, and she helps with the collections. Milca is very honest and upright. She watches over her colleagues’ savings, and she patiently guides them to use their money wisely. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers. With the other part of the money she will buy food products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nyame Ye Baako Group

texts.en:
Farouk is forty-one years old. He is married and has four children. He is a butcher. He runs a butcher shop. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame ye baako’ which literally means 'God is One'. He is the man standing in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando V. R. tiene 50 años. Su actividad económica es mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio Orlando se hace cargo de 2 hijas. Este negocio surge por la esposa de Orlando ya que no tenía un trabajo para generar a su familia los ingresos necesarios, y con la ayuda de de su esposa aprendió este negocio. Y así decide aportar cierta ayuda a su familia y aportar lo necesario para su familia. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños, calzado y bolsos. Su mayor sueño es cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Orlando V. R. is 50 years old. His work is in sales of general merchandise. More than 7 years since Orlando began this business he care for 2 daughters. This business moves forward because of Orlando's wife. He was without work to generate the family income they needed, and with the help of his wife he learned the business. As such he decided to provide some assistance to his family and give them what they need. The loan will be used as business capital to buy men's and children's clothing, shoes, and handbags. His dream is to meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used spare parts for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthoeun Chum Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
22-people who all live in Daem Rues village in Kandal province is made up the village bank and all the members will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Chanthoeun C. us a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1.08-hectar to cultivate rice. In rice farming, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil so it is affected to her rice crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Preap Sambath, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Chanthoeun C. is a mother of a child who is attending the local school. 

Seven members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Grupo Pasaniep Group

texts.es: Las personas integrantes del grupo PASANIEB, del Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango han venido trabajando desde hace cinco años, ellos se dedican mayormente al comercio como una alternativa para obtener ingresos que contribuyen al sostenimiento de sus familias, otros se dedican a la venta de mercerías y otros a la crianza de animales, ellos han encontrado una excelente forma de trabajar y es a través de los micro créditos ya que permite de manera oportuna ampliar su capital de trabajo y de esta forma ampliar su capacidad de atención y el mejoramiento de sus ingresos.

loans.use: AMPLIACION DE CAPITAL DE COMERCIO

loans.name: Shar Abas Group

texts.en: Shar Abas is the group leader of Shar Abas group. There are four members in this group. They are want to take a loan for expanding business and make it larger. Kabraw wants to take a loan for quilt making. Gul Handam wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Muhammad Tanfees wants to take a loan for the business of general store. Zabida wants to take a loan for the business of bead working. They are happy form this process of loan in Afghanistan and around the worlds.

loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
la señora Ciriaca C. B. tiene un hijo que depende de ella, Ciriaca se dedica a la venta de lacteos dentro del mercado de Nacaome y su deseo es poder graduar a su hijo de la universidad.

las ventas las realiza diariamente, viaja de su lugar de origen, la aldea aguafrillita Guascoran Valle, su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal.
con este negocio ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo en cual esta estudiando y ya le falta poco para salir de la universidad.
esto le ha motivado mucho a Ciriaca ya que esta viendo los frutos de su trabajo.
nos comento que se siente muy cansada pero que toda via tiene fuerzas para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Ciriaca C. B. has a son whom she supports. Ciriaca sells dairy products in the Nacaome market and her wish is to have her son graduate from university. She travels every day from her home in a village in the Guascoran Valley to sell her products in the city market. Through her business she has been able to support her son who is in school and is close to finishing his education at the university. Her son has motivated her and she is seeing the fruits of her labor. She commented that she is tired but has the strength to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for the creation of lollipops

loans.name: Rosa De María

texts.es: Rosa D. María S. D. L. D. 28 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos todos estudiantes menores D. edad. Rosa posee una venta D. ropa para hombres y mujeres D. todas las edades, así mismo venD. cosméticos y productos D. uso personal. Ella solicita un préstamo para obtener el capital necesario para invertir en la compra D. más productos para su negocio, ya que uno D. los mayores deseos D. Rosa es ver crecer su negocio y D. esta manera percibir más ganancias las cuales beneficien a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa D. María S. D. L. is 28 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children who are all underage students. Rosa owns a sale of men and women’s clothing for all ages and also sells cosmetics and products for personal use. She needs a loan to have the necessary capital to invest in buying more products for her business since one of her biggest wishes is to see her business grow so that she can have more income that will help all of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina A. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 53 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Catalina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP whenever she sells her fully-grown animals. In 2009, Catalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita M. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years-old and married with six adult children. Mariquita owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like sweetened banana and banana-cue (deep friend banana and caramelized sugar) in the local community. Mariquita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mariquita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariquita is requesting a first loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Los Esforzados De Nueva Imperial Group

texts.en:
This village bank is called “Los Esforzados de Nueva Imperial” (The Hard-workers of Nueva Imperial). The members are from the city of Nueva Imperial in the Temuco region of Chile. This city is approximately 415 miles south of Chile’s capital, Santiago. The region of Temuco is known for its natural springs and its native and eye-catching flora and fauna.

“Los Esforzados de Nueva Imperial” is comprised of 22 persevering members. The main activities of its members are the manufacturing and sale of various products, such as fabric, clothing, earrings, necklaces, wooden utensils, cooked food such as empanadas (folded and stuffed pastries), ice, and ice cream. There are also members who sell medicinal herbs and a member who runs a service center of telephone booths.

This village bank’s president is Pedro, who is pictured above in the center of the photo wearing a white shirt. He is an artisan who works with wood, making a range of items including kitchen utensils, earrings, brooches, yokes, and wagons. He sells these items in a shopping mall and various local markets with permission from the municipal government, similar to the other members of the village bank. With the loan, Pedro would like to purchase an electric saw to help him grow his production. His hope is to remodel his 59-year-old home where he lives with his mother, and his dream is to one day export his products to grow his sales.

For Pedro, Fondo Esperanza has meant great economic help for his business, because thanks to prior loans, he was able to purchase a copy machine and a key copier, which allowed him to offer more services and secure more economic stability. The rest of the members of “Los Esforzados de Nueva Imperial” also plan to invest their loans in machines and merchandise so that they can continue growing and reaching their personal goals.

loans.use: machines and merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en:
Farze Z. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called We Are One. She is 40 years old and is married with six children aged two to 23 years old. Their educational levels are kindergarten  through 11th grade.  Farze herself did not continue her education beyond seventh grade due to pregnancy.   Farze and her family live and work on Front Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  

Farze’s business is the sale of general goods such as pomades, styling gel, candles, matches, torch lights, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of Front Street in Monrovia.  She has been running this business for more than 10 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.

Farze started by selling alcoholic drinks and her capital was 3,000 Liberian Dollars that was given to her by her brother.   She talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Farze needs this loan to purchase more general goods such as pomades, styling gel, candles, for resale.  She dreams of educating her children and building a house for them.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Farze is the one holding the sign.  Lorpu M. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more general goods to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou M. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Marilou is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tsetsegdulam

texts.en:
Tsetsegdulam is 30 years old and lives with her son in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own apartment. Her husband was in a mining accident and receives a disability pension.

Tsetsegdulam has been operating her wholesale Mongolian products business for four years. Recently, domestically produced Mongolian products have become rarer, and she has been selling only underwear and scarfs made in Mongolia.

Tsetsegdulam is a very hardworking person. She says, “I'm spending a lot of time and money for my husband's treatment because it's so important to us, and I would like to see my husband recovered.”

Tsetsegdulam is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to increase her inventory of scarfs, socks, and underwear.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her business

loans.name: Hugo José

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo José S. Arteaga, es casado y padre de familia de un hijo el que se  encuentran en edad escolar. El Sr. Hugo acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita comprar materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que necesita comprar perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa el cual esta deteriorado y en invierno el agua penetra en su hogar.
Cabe mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha estado financiando créditos e podido mejorar mis condiciones de vida para mi familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo José S. A.is married and is a father to a boy of school age. Mr. Hugo went to ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) to get a loan so that he can buy construction materials to improve his home since he needs to buy tiles, zinc, paint and nails for the roof of his home since it is damaged and in the winter water leaks into his home.

He says that since ceprodel has loaned him money, he has been able to improve his families' living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en: Sakina is a wife of M. B. and lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She is a very active lady. She stays at home and takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a fruit selling business. His earnings are the main source of income for his family, which forces him to work hard to meet their financial needs. He purchases fruit from fruit markets and supplies fruit shops. Currently, Sakina is requesting a loan to open a fruit shop in the community so her husband can sell fruit for his own shop and get more profit from it.

loans.use: To start their own fruit shop

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Manuela Del Socorro, es casada con 2 hijos mayores de edad que viven de manera independiente. La señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y golosinas en su casa de habitación, además que distribuye de manera ambulante cosméticos y vestuario. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 31 años, ya que en ese tiempo ella laboraba en Plastinic una empresa de fabricación de plástico y deseaba dejar de laborar en ese local y tener un negocio propio. Empezó vendiéndole ropa y cosméticos a sus compañeras de trabajo y poco a poco fue haciéndose de un buen inventario. Comentaba la señora, que algo que ella hace ahora es que solamente vende al contado, ya que muchas personas a las que les había otorgado crédito no le pagaron. Su esposo labora como mecánico y él le ayuda en lo que puede. Este préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de  productos variados, principalmente para cubrir unos pedidos de cosméticos que actualmente posee. Su meta siempre ha sido tener una pulpería que venda granos básicos y que le proporcione mayores ganancias para realizar unas mejoras a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Manuela is married and has two adult children who are now on their own. She sells fruits and snacks out of her home and also sells cosmetics and clothing on foot. She’s been doing this for the past 31 years. She used to work for “Plastinc,” a company that manufactured plastic goods, but she wanted to have a business of her own. She started out by selling clothing and cosmetics to her co-workers and little by little she began to build a good inventory. She tells us that she now only sells for cash, as many of the people she had previously extended credit to did not pay. Her husband works as a mechanic and he helps her where he can. She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of products, mainly to fill some cosmetics orders. Her goal has always been to have a general store where she can sell some basic grains, so that she can increase her revenue and be able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda G., 42 years old, is a tenant of a two-hectare rice field. She has one child. She helps her husband manage their farm so that they will have an abundant harvest to feed their family. She dreams of having her own farm someday, that is why she is doing her best to be able to prosper and improve their harvest. She would like to apply for a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Yeam

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 30-year-old wife and mother. She has been farming for years, cultivating rice and some vegetables. Her husband, Sot, aged 32, appears in the photo. He works with her on the farm field. The couple lives with two small children who are going to school. S. is currently planting a rice crop, which she will harvest when it is mature. S. has another big farmland, on which she plans to plant crops for additional profit. Because S. doesn’t have money, she has applied for a loan to purchase many sacks of fertilizers and crop seeds to grow a better crop. She is hopefully that the loan will provide her with much income for her family and for her loan installment.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fertilizers and crop seeds to improve crop growth.

loans.name: Ruth Yessenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ruth Sánchez es socia del banco comunal Despertar, se encuentra en la banca comunal hace seis ciclos, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus hermosas calles, iglesias, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente es muy amable cordial y hospitalaria.

Doña Ruth es de la provincia del Oro, y ha llegado a esta ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, tiene 30 años de edad, viven unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 14, 9 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija cursa los estudios en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos se encuentran en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos L´bel, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años y le va bien ya que vende a sus amigas, hace un mes ha empezado a trabajar en un restaurante, en la cual labora de lunes a domingo de 4 p.m. hasta las 12 p.m., su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos L´bel, su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ruth Sánchez is a member of the Despertar Communal Bank. She has been in the communal bank for six cycles. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its beautiful streets, churches, and its four rivers that bathe the city. The people are nice, friendly, and hospitable. Ruth is from the Oro province. She came to this city looking for better work. She is 30 years old, and she is in a common law marriage. They have three children; who are 14, 9, and 6 years old. Her first daughter is in high school, and the last two are in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic. They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live. Our member has been selling L’bel products for five years. It is going well for her; she sells to her friends. A month ago she started to work in a restaurant. She works there from Monday through Sunday from four p.m. until 12 midnight. She will use the loan to buy more L’bel products. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy L'bel cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 52 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream and "halo-halo" (a popular Filipino dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits, and served cold) to the local community. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over a year now.

Jessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jessie from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mr. Vanna B., is 29 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Thuch (both are in the photo), is 30 years old, have been married for ten years and have two children: one son and one daughter. All of them are still young. The family is lives along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vanna has full-time employment in a company in Phnom Penh. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. His old motorbike breaks down a lot and does not work well, which causes him to pay a lot of money to often repair it. 

Facing this, Vanna is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one. He will then not spend a lot of money in repair costs anymore.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua J. sells various sizes of polythene bags at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is divorced and takes care of three children.

Ekua has been selling polythene bags for fifteen years and is able to feed and educate her children with the little income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more bales of polythene bags to distribute to her customers.

Ekua plans to open a shop for her business as a result of the profit she hopes to earn.

loans.use: To buy more bales of polythene bags to sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Olivia has a business selling bras at the market. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of bras.

The main business challenges for Olivia include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand bras

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en: Wennie L. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general-store business. She lives in Sitio Kabangkalan, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general-store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Wennie is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she could use it as additional working capital. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Wennie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dunhhanon(a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Women Together #2 Group

texts.en:
Marie T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Women Together #2". She is 39 years old, single and has three children whose ages are between 9 and 16 years. She was only able to attend school through tenth grade due to lack of financial support.

For four years, she has been manufacturing and selling “iron soap”, a locally manufactured soap made from caustic and red oil, in the Red Light market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more gallons of caustic and red oil. She describes herself as a jovial woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of caustic and red oil

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa M. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 49 years old. Nimfa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a restaurant serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nimfa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nimfa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Peter Waithaka

texts.en:
Peter has been in transport business since 2007. He operates his motorbike around Naivasha town. He is 35 years old, married to Serah Wambui and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his 1st loan of KES 20,000 well and in good time. He plans to use this cash to buy a new motorbike.

In future, Peter hopes to own a taxi which he will still operate in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Denis Kebaso

texts.en:
Denis Kebaso M. is a twenty six year old Motor Bike spare dealer in Changamwe, Mombasa. He is a single man who has been in this business for the last one year. 

Denis joined KADET and he has currently applied for a loan which he would like to use to purchase more spare parts for resale. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to purchase a motor bike. 

In future he would like to own a matatu (public transport van).

loans.use: Buy more motorcyle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 40 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flora de 39 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Las tierras de Jorge, son de las mejores cultivadas en el poblado de Palmapampa (pueblo ubicado en la selva Ayacuchana) él tiene sembrado cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que son rápidamente comprados por los mayoristas en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que saben de la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, motivo por el cual es considerado uno de los mejores agricultores de su pueblo, siente que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que afectan a sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para volver más productiva sus tierras.
texts.en: Jorge is 40 years old.  He is a very hard-working and humble man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Flora, who is 39 years old, and their 4 beloved children for whom they want to create a better future.  Jorge's land is amongst the best cultivated in the village of Palmapampa (which is located in the Ayacuchana jungle).  He grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf, products which are quickly bought by wholesalers in the city of San Francisco since they know that his crops are of good quality.  What he most likes about his work is cultivating his land and he does this with a lot of care.  He has been in the business for 15 years which is why he is considered one of the best farmers in his village.  He feels that the most difficult part of his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from infestations of insects which can damage his plantations.  Over time he hopes to buy new land to increase his crop production.  This is his second loan from MFP and he feels capable of making his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will buy fertilizers to make his land more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Leonena

texts.en:
Leonena D. is a married woman who lives in Purok Sampaguita, Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating a seafood sales business.  Her husband Rey D., who is 47 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between the ages of 9 to 20 years old. 

Leonena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children.

Leonena D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of seafood sales business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
MARIA R. L.
La señora María Raxón López, de 39 años  casada tiene 3 hijos 1 mayor de edad y dos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de Tortilla y veladoras , que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 10 y 5 años  de vender su tortilla de casa en casa, luego  su esposo la animo a que también vendiera veladoras  en su casa la cual ahora fabrican  desde  hace tres años, la venta de tortillería  inicio con el apoyo de su nuera  vendiendo de poco en poco mientras su nuera los hacia ella salía a la calle para ofrecer, con el tiempo puedo tener a una persona que le ayudara a sacar su venta ya que con el tiempo las personas la conocían y le pedían por cantidades grandes para festividades sociales, en su tiempo libre también se dedica a la venta de atoles, venta de fruta , frijol, también sale a lavar de casa en casa, su  mayor deseo es poder invertir un poco más  en la fabricación de veladoras, el deseo que tiene para sus hijos es que salgan adelante  ella y su esposo .
texts.en:
María Raxón López, 39, is married and has three children, one older and two younger. Her business is the sale of tortillas and candles from her home. She sold her tortillas door-to-door for 15 years. Then her husband encouraged her to also sell candles from their home. They have been making and selling candles for three years. 

The tortilla business began with support from María’s daughter-in-law, who would make the tortillas while María would go out and do sales. Later, she was able to employ another person to help out. Now, she is well known and often receives large orders for social events.

In her spare time, María sells atole (hot corn drink), fruit, and beans. She also does washing from door-to-door. Her greatest desire is to be able to invest more in the candle business, and that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: Fabrication of candles

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Gladys; ella tiene 47 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su puesto en el mercado virgen asunta ahí vende todo tipo de fruta al por mayor y menor,la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y para el revestido de su puesto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Adelante."  This bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Gladys is 47 years old, lives with a partner, and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling fruit.  She has a post in the "Virgen Asunta" market where she sells all kinds of fruit at wholesale and retail.  Gladys has had this business for a number of years, and she is feels very content with it.

Gladys requests a loan to buy more merchandise for her business, and to refinish the walls of her stall.

She is very happy to receive this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, and to refinish the walls of her stall

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eveling; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos, la socia atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la scoia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para la tienda de abarrotes.  
        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to "Los Andenes" communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Her name is Eveling, and she is 29 years old, with a live-in partner and 2 children. She combines her daily activities with running a grocery store, selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles. The associate tends the store from 5:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m and by means of this business she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand the grocery store, and requests this loan in order to purchase wholesale products for her store.   
 
The associate is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the terms of payment.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco O. O., tiene la edad de 49 años, está casado y tiene 5 hijos que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar un lote de tierra que mide 500 metros cuadrados para poder sembrar hortalizas en los ratos que tiene libre. En la actualidad trabaja como jornalero en fincas donde le den trabajo de peón agrícola. En algunas ocasiones ha sido administrador de finca.  Con ésta opción  puede mejor sus ingresos  y trabajar en su propio negocio y así tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto él como su esposa y sus hijos. Su  esposa y sus hijos le pueden ayudar a  realizar dicho negocio Piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y poderles  dar estudios para que  sean  buenos  profesionales.  En la actualidad todos sus hijos están estudiando.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Francisco O. O. is 49 years old. He is married and has five children who are his main priority. He wants to buy a parcel of land that measure 500 square meters so that he can plant vegetables in his spare time. He currently works as a laborer on farms where he can find farmhand work. On a few occasions he has been a farm manager. With this option he can improve his income and work at his own business. This will allow for a better quality of life for him, his wife and his children. His wife and his children will be able to help him with his business. He thinks about his children's future and about being able to provide for their studies so that they can become good professionals. Currently, all of his children are in school. 
This is the first loan he receives from field partner FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had loans with state banks but field partner FUDECOSUR has given him this loan with greater ease and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: Purchase land.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 47-year-old married man with five children. He live in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 20 years he has been trading in beans and maize. The main business challenge he faces is problems with transportation facilities. His dream is to own a store in town. Peter is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita D. V. tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria y esta casada cone le señor Rodolfo Reyna con el cual tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro son mujeres y una mujer, los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente solo vive con su esposo en la comunidad de Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Mago(como la llaman sus amigos y vecinos) nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de tamales, chiles rellenos y ropa. Ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio para tener otra entrada de dinero y ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que en estos tiempos ningun dinero alcanza.  Ella vende sus tamales y chiles rellenos los martes y algunas veces los jueves, tambien nos platica que se turna una semana vende chiles rellenos y la  siguiente vende tamales para variar y no cansar a sus clientes, tambien vende ropa la cual va a buscar los jueves a un tianguis que se pone los jueves en la una pequeña comunidad que se llama Ciudad Aleman que se encuentra a 40 minutos de su localidad, Ella vende sus productos en su comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos casa por casa.	

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de  carne, maiz, manteca, aceite, variedad de chiles, huevos, especies y ropa de dama y caballero para preparar su comida y posteriormente venderla.

Ella espera en un futuro seguir tabajando para poder arreglar un poco su casa y seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita D. V., age 49, has a second grade education.  She is married to Rodolfo Reyna, and they have five children.  The children, four boys and a girl, are married.  She currently lives with her husband in the Mata Naranjo community.  It is 35 minutes from the Tierra Blanca municipality in the state of Veracruz.

Mago (as her friends and neighbors call her) tells us that a little over a year ago she decided to start her own business selling tamales, “chiles rellenos” (stuffed mild chili peppers), and clothes.  She decided to start her own business in order to have another income to help her husband a little with the household expenses.  In these times money does not stretch far enough.

She sells tamales and chiles rellenos on Tuesdays and sometimes on Thursdays.  She also tells us that she alternates.  One week she sells chiles rellenos, and the following week she sells tamales.  She does this so that her customers have variety and do not get bored.

She also sells clothes, which she looks for at a street market that is set up on Thursday.  The market is in a small community called Ciudad Aleman, and it is 40 minutes for her place.  She sells her products door to door in her community to her friends and neighbors.

She needs this loan to buy meat, corn, shortening, oil, a variety of chilies, eggs, and spices to prepare food to sell.   She also needs it for clothing for women and for men. 

In the future she hopes to continue working in order to fix up her house a little and to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy food and clothes

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad, está separada pero   de una relación que tuvo hace varios años  tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive la menor de sus hijas que es soltera sus otros hijos ya son casados.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos,  por el momento trabaja de lunes a sabados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las 18h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, nos cuenta que su local recién lo abrió con el crédito que recibió el ciclo anterior, pero que siempre se ha dedicado a vender comida, antes lo hacía por pedidos pero ahora que ya puso su local espera que las cosas sean mucho mejores.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos, además de ciertos utensilios que le hacían falta para su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le sacan de muchos apuros económicos.  Su sueño es tener un restaurante de lujo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Here we find 56 year old Maria.  She is separated but has three adult children from a relationship she had some years ago.  Her youngest daughter is single and lives with her and her other children are married.

She has a small restaurant in her home, where she prepares delicious dishes.  At the moment she works from Monday to Saturday from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.  Her daughter helps her with her business.  [Maria] tells us that she recently opened her place with the help of the loan she received during the previous cycle, but that she has always sold food.  She used to do it to order, but now that she has opened her place, she expects things to get much better.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients that she will use to prepare her dishes.  She will also buy some utensils she needs for her business.  She’s been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she enjoys it because the loans help her very much.  Her dream is to open a luxury restaurant someday.

loans.use: ingredients

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells second hand clothes at Abura near Watreso. She is married and has two children. Her husband also deals in used clothing. She assists her husband in feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy clothing in bulk for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Del Santuario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRIUNFADORAS DEL SANTUARIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por catorce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza de la señora Julia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de chalecos, venta de refrescos, venta de lana de vicuña, venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, construcción, venta de ropa, venta de camas y ollas de presión, venta de edredones, venta de coca.
 
La señora Julia tiene como negocio la venta comida, para la compra de sus ingredientes se dirige a la feria de Extranca de Rio Seco y lo vende en la ex parada 8 (ambos lugares en la ciudad de El Alto); con el crédito que sacará pretende ampliar su negocio.

En la actualidad la señora tiene treinta y nueve años, es casada y tiene una hija, la que le ayuda todos los días en su negocio.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el aprender y la organización.
texts.en:
The “TRIUNFADORAS DEL SANTUARIO” communal bank will start its first cycle with the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 14 members and led by a governing board chaired by Julia.

The businesses the members carry out are varied.  Among them are: vest making, sale of soft drinks, Vicuña wool sales, food sales, grocery store, vegetable sales, blanket weaving, construction, clothing sales, sale of beds and pressure cookers, comforter sales and coca leaf sales.

Julia’s business is selling fast food.  To buy her ingredients she goes to the Extranca de Rio Seco market and she does her sales at the #8 Ex-Stop (both places in the city of El Alto).  She will use the loan to expand her business.

She is 39 years old, married and has a daughter who helps her in the business every day.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes to learn and the organization.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Lida's Group

texts.en:
Lida B. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.  

Lida is 61 years old, a widow, blessed with two children, both of whom are adults.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in selling bananas. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 20 years already earning a monthly net income.  

In 2009, Lida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.She is now requesting a loan of Php 20,000 as her 8th loan which will be used for medical expenses and purchase medicine for her illness.   

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses and purchase medicine for her illness

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mrs. Mara K. (pictured) is a 40-year-old, married woman. Her husband, Mr. Sawy Son, who she has been married to since 1990, is 43 years old. They have five children: one son and four daughters. Four of their children are in school, while the other child is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a village off National Road Number Two, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

To earn a living, Mara is a construction worker, while her husband is a policeman. She is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get to school.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 44 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city with her husband (who has seasonal work), his daughter and her father-in-law.  Eleven years ago Jemma rented the shop where she runs her business. She sells women’s and children’s clothing, underclothes, shoes and slippers at her shop. Jemma buys merchandise from Yerevan and resells it in Vanadzor city to raise money and support her family.  
  
Jemma needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy summer seasonal clothes and sandals for her business.

loans.use: To buy summer seasonal clothes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells food at the market which contributes to her other source of livelihood. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 60 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 02 hijos a su cargo Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, dicha casa está ubicada en el caserío La Salina en el distrito de Tambogrande  en  Piura.
