Esperanza  vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Esperanzase dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado ovino, caprino y pavos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años y cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.
Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia de 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola en la cual tiene mango y cacao en producción. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno (vacas lecheras).

Por lo mismo Esperanza ha solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de animales y su respectiva comida. Ella desea incrementar sus ventas podrá solventar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Esperanza es conocida por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de  mejorar su estilo de vida en la vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 60 years old, married, and has two children in her care.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her children.  It is located in the village of La Salina in the Tambogrande district in Piura.  She lives in the rural part of the district and does not have access to utilities.

Esperanza works raising and selling livestock like sheep, goats, and turkeys.  She has done this work for six years and she has appropriate and spacious pens.  When the animals reach their ideal size and weight, she sells them at the local market.  Her husband is a farmer who has his own two hectare parcel of farm land where he grows mango and cacao.  He also works raising dairy cows.

Esperanza has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase animals and feed for them.  She wants to increase her sales to settle her loan and improve her quality of life.

Esperanza is known for being an honest and hardworking person with the desire to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg is 52 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia.They own  a small land plot with a house on it. Her daughter, Davaajargal, is 24 years old and she helps in her mother’s business.
 
Otgonchimeg’s husband runs a vehicle repairing business. Otgonchimeg is running a waste material collecting business. She collects waste materials such as cans, bones, copper, metal and plastics and sells them to waste recycling companies for a profit. She doesn’t have a special warehouse to store waste and uses her front yard as a collecting point. 

She has been doing this business for last five years and her working capital has reached 3,089,000 MNT. 

Otgonchimeg is planning to connect her house to centralized pure and sewage water line. Therefore she needs 1,600 USD to pay for the labor cost to the construction company for connecting her house to the line. She is going to repay her loan from her business profit.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost to the construction company for connecting her house to a centralized pure and waste water line.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, a town to the north of Monrovia.  She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are currently in school. She did not attend school herself.

She has a small business selling dried meat and oil, which she has run for 11 years.  She is self-taught and commenced the business with help from her friends.

Rebecca has requested a loan to purchase more stock for the business and will use the profit to help with the family expenses. In the future, she hopes to improve the quality of life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 48 years old, is married with three children and lives in the Philippines. Helen has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, spices and vegetables. She has had this business for 20 years. Helen has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices and food seasonings to sell. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business. Helen is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy spices and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Téko

texts.fr:
Tèko est une femme âgée de 60 ans .Elle est veuve et à deux enfants.
Têko  travaille comme   revendeuse depuis l’an  2000.Elle vend  de la boullie, du pain et du gâteau dans un quartier de la place.Têko s’approvisionne à lomé.Elle ne se fait pas aidé dans son commerce, elle travaille seule.
Têko a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs ,de la farine de blé et de l’huile pour la fabrication de ses produits de vente.
texts.en:
Téko is a 60-year-old widow with two children. She became a merchant in 2000. She sells porridge, bread and cake in a local neighborhood. She buys her supplies in Lomé. She runs her business alone and does not employ any helpers. 

Téko is seeking her second loan from WAGES to buy the corn, wheat flour, and oil necessary to make the products that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make porridge, bread and cake for sale

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
This is Ivy, aged 61, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a driver, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Ivy operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Therefore there is a need for computers, especially for students who need to do research and write papers. Ivy rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Aside from this she also sells electronic cell phone loads. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Ivy earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.
To help Ivy continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy computer parts, software and electronic loads for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Ivy hopes to add more computer units in her shop. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy computer spare parts and cell phone load products.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, vive con su esposa y una hija de 1 año de edad, el inicio con el negocio por la influencia de un hermano, quien le enseño desde hace 10 años, con un horario de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos, ollas, sartenes, cacerolas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar y surtir el negocio, aprovechando a vender más y aumentar las ganancias para el hogar.
Él quiere crecer y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, dentro de algún tiempo comprarse un vehículo para transportar mercadería.
texts.en:
José sells home appliances.  He lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter.  He started the business through a suggestion from his brother who taught him ten years ago.  His work schedule is 6am to 7pm.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy home appliances, pots, pans and soup pots.  This purchase will help him improve and stock the business to sell more and increase profits for his home.

He wants to grow and improve his family’s quality of life and in time buy himself a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy home appliances, pots, pans and soup pots.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
H. is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children.

H. has owned a food market since 2008, selling meat, fish, soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

H. decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator and two showcases for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator and two showcases for his market.

loans.name: Dushyirehamwe/sngnr Group

texts.fr:
Fidele fait partie du groupe Dushyirehamwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «mettons-nous ensemble ».Il a 36 et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisés et il a une personne en charge plus que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Fidele est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est cultivée à temps. Dans les prochaines années, Fidele voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et avoir la grande production du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et les soigner.

Note sur la photo: Au lieu d'Ali, sa femme se figure sur la photo. Elle est la deuxième à partir de la droite.
texts.en:
Fidèle is a member of Dushyirehamwe Group, whose name means "let's get together". He's 36 years old, married, and has three children, age 3 to 8. One of them attends school. In addition, he has another person to support. He attended elementary school for 8 years.

Fidèle is a rice cultivator and he is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business. His strategy for growth is to plant on time. With his profits, he intends to provide education and healthcare to his children.

Note: Ali (another member of the group) is not in the photograph, but his wife is in it instead. She's the second person from the right.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Samay

texts.en:
Samay, 32 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3.30 per day. Her husband is a transport worker who earns about $2 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school studying. Every month, Samay has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motor taxi driver when he is free from work. She wants to open a tailoring shop at her house, but this is a long term plan. She can’t effort to do it right now.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to do motor taxi work.

loans.name: Musemwa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musemwa S.H Group in Western Kenya! Kennedy is the facilitator of the Musemwa S.H group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Kennedy takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Kennedy had a very good maize yield, harvesting 21 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Kennedy was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kennedy  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Kennedy will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Musemwa S.H group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is 40 years old, and is married, but has no children yet. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He is looking to dispose of his old home furnishings and purchase new ones, such as bedroom furniture, living room furniture, etc. He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN.  His new home furniture will change Murad’s family’s life for the better, and enable him to improve his family’s living conditions. He is pictured in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Nofah

texts.en:
Nofah is a 41-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Nofah sells milk and other dairy products, which she makes at home. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase goats to make milk and other dairy products.

Nofah is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 43 years old and married with four children. She's from Pan-taon, Ozamiz City. 

Joselina operates a livestock business, raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Joselina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joselina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be Joselina's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sandra Fabiola

texts.es:
Sandra Fabiola tiene 21 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con los padres y el hijo de 1 año de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace dos años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la meleza. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder trabajar las tierras y comprar lo necesario.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ayudar a la mamá.
texts.en:
Sandra Fabiola is 21 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives with her parents and her one-year-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Sandra is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Sandra is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for two years.  She buys and sells in Ventanas.  The loan she is requesting will be invested in short-cycle farming.  The loan will be of great help because she can work the land and buy what she needs.  Among the challenges she faces on a frequent basis are the competition and pests.  Her dream is to have her own land.

In her free time, Sandra enjoys helping her mother.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and urea

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Uganda. She is single and has 6 children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of her father.   

Mary has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products retail at the market.  She has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas   

Mary's main business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and transportation of bunches of bananas from the villages to her stall . Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and start selling wholesale and to educate her children up to university. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: El Tule Sur Group

texts.es: El Banco Tele Sur, está conformado por 8 integrantes que son mujeres emprendedores que cada uno tiene una actividad económica diferente pero formaron este grupo , ya que se conocen y son responsable, y además que son las misma localidad. Maria Magdalena tiene 31 años de edad su negocio es básicamente la venta de dulce tradicionales que es muy buscado por su clientela. Maria Magdalena está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en el negocio para las compras de los diferentes dulces y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad de sabores.
texts.en:
Tule Sur Bank is made up of eight members who are enterprising women.  Each one has a different economic activity but they formed this group since they know each other and are responsible, and they also are from the same town.

María Magdalena is 31 years old.  Her business is basically selling traditional sweets, which is very sought after by her customers.  María Magdalena is requesting a loan to be able to invest in the business to buy the different sweets and be able to offer her customers a variety of tastes.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Rosario Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  Rosario es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una fritanga y refresquería desde hace 8 años. Ella tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad quien le ayuda en el negocio.   
El crédito lo invertirá en productos para el negocio principalmente aceite, leña, plátano, queso y frutas,
texts.en: Rosario is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had a fast-food and snack bar business for 8 years.  She has an adult son who helps her in the business.  She will use the loan to buy products for the business, mainly, oil, firewood, bananas, cheese and fruit.

loans.use: to buy oil, firewood, bananas, cheese and fruit, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn Del Pilar

texts.es:
Evelyn es una mujer de 32 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Evelyn pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Evelyn trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de útiles de escritorio y libros, adicionalmente también vende juguetes para niños, ella trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Evelyn se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le  va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Evelyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias  a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de juguetes, ya que pronto se acercan las fiestas navideñas y desea poder incrementar sus ventas; de esta manera Evelyn seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y desea poder lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old. She is single and lives in the city of Ica. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person and has a strong desire to succeed. Thanks to her effort and the support of her family, Evelyn was able to study Education. In her free time, she enjoys working and occasionally cooking a delicious Chuafa Rice dish to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Evelyn works every day in her small business, selling office supplies and books. She also sells toys for children. She works approximately 10 hours a day, starting very early in the morning. Evelyn enjoys working and believes it is going well because of her sense of responsibility and the kind treatment she offers her customers.
 
Evelyn is very thankful for Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided, she is able to buy a greater quantity of toys for the upcoming holidays, during which she hopes to increase her sales. In this way, Evelyn will continue working and striving to move forward. She hopes to one day achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Lameck Otieno

texts.en:
Lameck is the first motorcycle owner to register in the community health support programme(CHWSP) in Kisumu county Kenya. Lameck is married and is a member of youth group in Kisumu who want to make a difference in their community. Lameck leads a group of young people who would like to contribute in the welfare of their community in Kisumu. Lameck will be providing transport to selected Community Health Workers who will be conducting visitation in their community, and additionally he will support youth training camps where community awareness on health and hygiene will be discussed. 

By supporting the Community Health Workers in Kisumu, Lameck will be contributing immensely towards easing transportation and coverage of CHWs in Kisumu Town. Lameck will be attached to a CHW in Kisumu County and four times in a month will be providing transport to CHWs on their regular visitation of patients or providing health education to the community. Lameck will also be on standby in his community wherever transport is needed to transport patients in the nearby clinic. The motorcycle will also assist in supporting Lameck young family, during other days as he will use the bike as taxi transporting people and produce to the market.

Lameck vision is to create the largest BodAfya network in Kenya involving youth engaged in motorcycle taxis and Community Health Workers in Kisumu County.

loans.use: To buy a Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihood Support

loans.name: Grandiam Group

texts.en:
Grandiam is made up of young people who are passionate about entrepreneurship. The youth met during the time they created and managed their own business with the support of Junior Achievement and were recognized as the second best youth led business nationally.

Upon realizing this fete, the team was given extended business by their school to supply the students with scarfs that marched the school uniforms and pillows for comfortable sleeping. This venture has been very successful and thus the request for a loan to grow and expand it.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy the materials for making outfits for the clothing busiiness.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme âgée de 36 ans qui vit à Adidodomé. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Adzo est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Adzo désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des sacs de riz, des bols du haricot et des bidons d’huile en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille.

loans.use: Acheter 03 sacs de riz, 04 bidons d'huile et 05 bols du haricot.

loans.name: Sokandé

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Sokandé has been married to a farmer for twenty years and together they have six (6) children. Sokandé is a very active woman, and her work involves making and selling doughnuts. Her husband's farming does not bring in sufficient funds to support the family, so she tries to contribute to the family's needs with her small income. Her children are now older and their needs are greater, so Mrs. E. would like to increase the revenue of her business.

This is why she is asking for a loan of $700 that would help her buy more supplies for the production and sale of her doughnuts. The sales income will benefit her entire family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Sokandé est mariée à un cultivateur depuis une vingtaine d’années et mère de six (06) enfants. Femme très active, elle fait comme activité principale la production et la vente des beignets. L’activité de son mari (agriculture) ne permet pas de couvrir la totalité des charges de la famille. Elle contribue donc avec son petit revenu à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Mais aujourd’hui que les enfants sont devenus grands, les charges sont devenus plus grandes et Madame E. cherche les moyens pour améliorer son activité et par conséquent son revenu. C’est dans ce sens qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va lui permettre d’acheter et de stocker des matières premières en vue de la production et la vente des beignets. Les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de la vente des beignets seront destinés à la satisfaction de besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling doughnuts

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Estela has four children and to improve their quality of life, she began her own business selling groceries two years ago in the city of Mérida, Yucatán, which is where she is from. She had very little savings, but little by little she stocked her store. Now her number of clients has grown and they demand products to which she doesn’t have access because of the small amount of capital she has to invest in the business. In order to fulfill the demand from her customers she is requesting a loan in the amount of $275.00, which she will use to have a greater variety of products and thereby keep her customers.

Maria Estela is ready to work very hard in order to get ahead in this business. She just needs your support and warmth. Your help will be of great use to this family. Have no doubt, they will sincerely appreciate your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Estela tiene cuatro hijos y para mejorar su calidad de vida, hace dos años inició su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Mérida, Yucatán de donde es originaria. Ella tenía pocos ahorros y poco a poco fue surtiendo su abarrote, ahora sus clientes se han incrementado y demandan más productos a los que ella no tiene acceso por el poco capital que ha invertido, para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes solicita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener mas variedad de productos y permanecer en el gusto de sus clientes.

Maria Elena esta dispuesta a trabajar arduamente para sacar adelante este negocio, sólo necesita de tu apoyo y cariño, tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia. No lo dudes más, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Brenda Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Brenda U. and I make and sell women's clothing. I have been doing this for two years and have a lot of clients as my work is very classy and my running costs are comfortable. My aim is to buy more materials to male more clothes and sell more. I would use the earnings to feed my family and to pay for my children's education as two of them are in high school and one is in primary school and I am a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Brenda U. me dedico a la produccion y venta de ropa para dama, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, tengo muchos clientes ya que mi trabajo es muy fino y mis precios de mano de obra son comodos, mi meta es comprar mas materiales para hacer mas ropa y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagar los estudios de mis tres hijos que dos estan en el colegio y uno en la escuela ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: To buy material, scissors, thread, sewing machine equipment, oil/compra de tela, tijeras, hilos, repuestos para maquina de cocer, aceite

loans.name: Bih Alian

texts.en:
Bih Alian was born in 1956, is married to a polygamist and the mother of six children. She has suffered from a lot of maltreatment from her polygamous husband who could not provide her and her children with food or pay their school fees. This motivated her to become a member of GHAPE and before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has been able to invest and repay all loans with which she raised money to pay school fees for her children and to construct her house.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to sell cooked food and cultivate crops. With this, she will raise money to pay her children’s school fees and apprentice fees, increase her business and build a house for rent. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Bih Alian would like to purchase seeds and food items to sell.

loans.name: Gubakhanim

texts.en: Gubakhanim is a mother of  one child. This 47-year-old woman lives in  Khaladj village, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan, where she has owned and operated a vineyard for the past 15 years. She has applied for a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides that will allow her to increase the quality  of her vines.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Subgroup B Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
JUMA, age 42, has worked as a repairman at his radio repair shop for over 10 years. At his shop, Juma gets around 10 customers a day and earns about $45-55 a week. For each repair, Juma charges his customers between $1.50 and $5, depending on the service. Juma is married with 5 kids (ages 18, 15, 8, 4, and a baby of 2 months) and takes care of 2 other 10-year-old relatives.

Juma is the leader of Subgroup B of Group “Sungura” (Swahili for “rabbit”), which totals 31 members. He will be sharing this loan with his subgroup members Flora L. (selling soft drinks), Fatuma J. (selling chickens), Mary K. (selling charcoal), and Marietha M. (tailoring). Juma, as the government executive officer of his street, knows each of his subgroup members and their businesses personally since they all work and live in the same neighborhood. He and his subgroup have taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses and were able to pay each back successfully.

Juma used the previous loans to buy more radio spare parts for his shop, as well as to pay for general home expenses such as his children’s school fees. He hopes to use the new loan to purchase more radio spare parts and thus increase his business.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a 45 year old mother of 7 children. They have lived on their plantation for years and it is their only source of income. Throughout the years Faavae and her husband have longed to improve their plantation but capital was the main problem. With her loans Faavae managed to buy the equipment and earn more profit each week. She is one happy mother in Siumu Centre and she is planning to build her own market in the village where people in the village could sell their crops.  She would like another loan to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Hurmatvi

texts.ru:
Hurmatvi was born in 1969, she is married and has 4 children. Three of the kids are girls who, together with Hurmatvi, sew izori, a type of pants made out of warm fabrics and worn as part of the national costume. Hurmatvi then sells the izori at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. During her own childhood, Hurmatvi had helped her grandmother to make national Tajik clothes. Nowdays, since her own family was forced to find additional income as there is not enough money for family needs, Hurmatvi taught her daughters this craft and now they all sew izori for sale. Hurmatvi has many loyal customers who she was able to attract because of the quality of her sewing and the sturdiness of the seams. She sells about 10-20 izori daily and her garments cost much less then imported clothes.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Хурматви 1969 года рождения,замужем имеет 4 детей.Из них 3 девочек которые шьют из теплых тканей национальные штаны с матерью.Мать реализует их на торгвой точке расположенной на рынке Корвон,Душанбе,Таджикистан.Хурматви с детства помогала бабушке шить изоры-нац.штаны.Сегодня когда жизнь вынудила искать работу из-за нехватки денег на семейные нужды,Хурматви обучила своих девочек этому ремеслу и теперь они все занимаются пошивом изоров-штанов.На сегодня Хурматви смогла привлечь многих клиентов качеством пошива и прочностью швов.Она ежедневно продает по 10-20 изоров и её изделия стоят на много дешевле импортных изделий.

loans.use: Buying velur-fabric for future sewing clothes for sale.

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en: Israfil E. owns and operates a large dump truck in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 42 years old, married with three children, and has been operating large trucks for the last 21 years. He is currently looking for funding, so he can make repairs and improvements to his large dump truck.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his large dump truck.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 29-year-old owner of a growing food preparation business. She prepares kenkey, banku, and rice balls. Kenkey and banku are delicacies prepared from milled corn, and they are very common in Ghanaian dishes for most households.

She currently works with 15 assistants and provides income to all of them. The assistants help her prepare the dishes and sell them at Kumasi's Race Course Market and Bantama Street. She hopes someday she has a permanent place of her own, as the location of her operations is temporary.

Helen is a member of the trust group called God Is One. The group exerts peer pressure on members to pay their share of the loan.

Helen is in the center of the photo, happily molding kenkey.

loans.use: To expand her business operation

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy had her first son at 25-years old. Two year later, she had her second. She always wanted to have a business, and this is why she never gave up the idea of being able to study something and starting a business. Two years ago, when her sons were a little older, she made the decision to study cosmetology at a beauty school. After some months, she fixed up a space in her home and opened a salon with the little money she had then. Throughout two years, she worked hard to be able to finish constructing a location to move to. Now she works in a bigger location that she has gradually implemented over the years and where, for six years, she has dedicated a space to her bookstore. She invests what she receives from these two businesses into the higher education of her sons. Luckily, her husband, who works in a mechanic shop, supports her in everything. Today, Lucy's objective is to continue growing her salon and to sell cosmetic products wholesale in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A los veinticinco años Lucy tuvo a su primer hijo, dos años después tuvo al segundo. Ella siempre quiso tener un negocio, es por ello que nunca renuncio ala idea de poder estudiar algo y empezar un negocio. Hace doce años, cuando sus hijos estuvieron un poco más crecidos, tomo la decisión de estudiar cosmetología en un instituto de belleza. Luego de unos meses ambientó un espacio de su casa y abrió su peluquería con lo poco que tenia en ese entonces. Durante dos años estuvo trabajando duro para poder terminar de construir un local y mudarse. Ahora trabaja en un amplio local que con los años ha ido implementándolo de a pocos y en donde, además, desde hace seis años, dedica un espacio para su librería. Lo que recibe de sus dos negocios los invierte en la educación superior de sus dos hijos, Felizmente su esposo, quien trabaja en un taller de mecánica, la apoya en todo. Hoy en día, el objetivo de Lucy es continuar creciendo en su peluquería y más adelante vender productos cosméticos al por mayor.

loans.use: To invest in a cosmetics store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 46 years old. She has been a part of the Tinh Thuong Fund since 2002. She has six children,of which two are school-aged and four are grown and have stable employment. Before she joined the fund, her family experienced many difficulties because most of her children were still young.

After joining the fund in 2002, they were able to raise capital to improve their financial situation by using the funds to purchase more pigs to raise. The family's main source of income is their livestock rearing business. Her family also uses the capital to purchase more grains which they use to make cakes and pastries to sell.

Today, her family has three children that are able to contribute financially to the family. From the time she joined the fund, her family's situation continues to improve. In addition to caring for her school-aged children, her family was able to construct a home. The family income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Mrs. Nguyen would like to raise 10,000,000 VND to buy more livestock and grains to help the family's livestock rearing and food production businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiết năm nay 46 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó có 2 con đang tuổi đi học, 4 con đã trưởng thành và có công việc ổn định. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do đông con, các con còn nhỏ.

Hơn nữa thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt. Năm 2002 sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, được vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã sử dụng vốn để mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn sử dụng vốn để mua thêm lúa nếp về làm bánh chưng, bánh xéo để bán.

Hiện nay gia đình chị đã có 3 con có nghề nghiệp và có thu nhập để giúp đỡ gia đình. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn. Ngoài việc chăm lo cho các con đi học, gia đình chị đã xây được ngôi nhà khang trang, thu nhập của gia đình đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi và mua thêm lúa, gạo giá rẻ trong vụ mùa để phục vụ cho việc làm bánh của gia đình.

loans.use: Livestock (Pigs) and Grains

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha H., 49, and his wife, Phally Pich, live in a village about 10 miles outside of Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. Married for 26 years, they have two sons and four daughters. For nearly three decades, Sitha has supported his family by driving a siklo, or a bicycle with a trailer in the front to carry people or goods. In Cambodia, most people use siklos or motorcycle taxis to get from place to place instead of taxis or buses.

Phally is a stay-at-home mother. Three of their children are still in school; two of their daughters work in a garment factory; and one of the sons also rides a siklo. To help drive his daughters to the factory, Sitha is requesting a loan of $300 U.S. dollars to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive their daughters to work

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 42 years old; she is single and is the mother of 3 adult children, who live with her and support her a lot. She sells beauty products and plastics, like trays, chairs, tables, pitchers, glasses, etc. She takes these products and sells them in different places; her clients pay her either on credit or with cash. Dolores and her children work all day. She likes that her work allows her to get to know many people with whom she shares ideas about business. Dolores requests this loan so that she can increase her supply of products and rent a place to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolores tiene 42 años, es soltera, madre de 3 hijos ya adultos, que viven con ella y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y la venta de plásticos (bandejas, sillas, mesas, jarras, vasos y otros), estos productos, los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares, dejándolos al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Trabaja todo el día junto a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente con quienes comparte ideas de negocio. Dolores pide este préstamo para implementarse con más productos y alquilar un local para la venta de estos.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and rent a place where she can sell her goods

loans.name: Zaida Judith

texts.es:
Zaida inició su negocio cuando su madre le recomendó que consumiera una línea de productos naturistas debido a unos malestares que padecía y que la ayudaron, entonces ella decidió empezar a venderlos desde hace dos años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir mercancía e incrementando sus inventarios.
texts.en:
Zaida started her business when her mother recommended to her that she take a line of natural products due to some bodily discomfort she was experiencing and they helped her. She then decided to start selling them two years ago. She needs a loan for US$475 which she will repay in six months to acquire merchandise and increase her inventories.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en: Mrs. Heanh H., 48, is widowed and sells rice dishes in a parking lot. She sells cooked rice with fried pork and hot dogs for passengers. She has been selling since 2000 and earns around $4 per day. She cares for four children, all of whom attend school. H. works hard every day in her business. She lives in Prek Preahsdach Commune, Battambang Province. One of her children is a garment worker and another is a tailor; their income helps to cover the family's expenses. To grow her business, she needs to cook more rice and also make a variety of food to satisfy customers. Hence, she would like to request a loan of $700 to purchase ingredients such as rice, meat, and hot dogs. For her future plan, H. wants to have her own store in which to run and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her rice dishes

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Dorah N. is an executive member of Kafene Women's Group and is a contractor with Coca-Cola.  She purchases large quantities of Coca-Cola products at subsidized prices and sells them at retail shops in Ntinda and at the surrounding trading centres.  Dorah has been working in this business for over eight years and has many established commercial relationships with her customers.  Each time she is able to purchase more Coca-Cola products upfront, her profit increases.  Therefore, in order to expand her business, Dorah is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase more products for resale upfront.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” del distrito de Pariahuaca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Corina tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Aunque no ha tenido muchos problemas en su familia, comenta que iniciar una nueva vida en Pariahuanca ha sido un reto debido a que es natural de la ciudad de Lima, que junto a su conviviente, quien es taxista, y a sus hijos, se estableció en el lugar de origen de su conviviente. Tiene como actual negocio la crianza y venta de cuyes, que los cría en su casa en Pariahuanca s/n. También menciona que empezó con 30 cuyes y ahora ella tiene 75 a los cuales alimenta con alfalfa que afortunadamente se produce en este lugar. Vende a pedido en la ciudad de Huaraz. Se siente bien porque afirma que la vida de campo es mas tranquila que en la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en cuatro cuotas, invertirá en la compra de semillas, porque ahora desea sembrar alfalfa, comprará cuyes, y conejos.
 
A Corina le encantaría capacitarse, para mejorar la producción en su negocio.
texts.en:
Corina is a member of the communal bank called “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” in the district of Parihuaca in the province of Cahuaz in the state of Ancash. Corina is 38 years old. She has a life partner and she has 3 children. Even though, she's never had any major family issues, she tells us that having to start a new life in Pariahuanca has been a challenge since she's originally from the capital, Lima. Together with her life partner, who's a taxi driver, and her children, they moved to the native city of her life partner. Her current business is raising guinea pigs which she takes care of out of her home in Pariahuanca. She also tells us that she began with only 30 guinea pigs and now she has a total of 75. She feeds them alfalfa which grows in this part of town. She sells through special orders in the city of Huaraz. She feels good because she says that country life is very calm and quiet compared to the city. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase seeds to grow alfalfa, guinea pigs and rabbits. Corina hopes to make a good profit so that she can improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow alfalfa, guinea pigs and rabbits

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia, y departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró repuestos para vender en su taller de mecánica. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pretende comprar repuestos para su taller de mecánica.
Ella desea continuar trabajando para aumentar la venta de repuestos en su taller.
texts.en:
Ms. Marleny V. is a member of the “Wiñay” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 38 years old, single and has one son. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased spare parts to sell in her auto repair shop. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 3 years now.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she plans on purchasing spare parts for her auto repair shop.

Marleny wishes to continue working so that she can increase her spare parts sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 56 años de edad, conviviente por 30 años, es madre de 8 hijos, en la actualidad vive solo con sus dos hijos menores, y está muy triste porque hace menos de dos semanas que falleció su esposo. En vida, su esposo trabajaba con sus hijos en la chacra y Elsa se a criar cerdos, carneros y vacas, porque su esposo decía que la chacra era trabajo para varones, pero ahora tendrá que hacerse cargo de los cultivos de su esposo por lo que está preocupada porque no podrá cuidar de sus animales. Elsa no cuenta que mayormente siembran papa y que las ganancias de todos estos años de trabajo les ha permitido comprar su casa, adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivos y sobre todo, educar a sus hijos. Mientras que los gastos de alimentación los cubría con la venta de carne de cerdo, y cuando les faltaba vendía sus vacas a 800 ó 1000 soles, dependiendo de la raza. Y cuando la vaca proveía leche hacía quesos y los vendía. Ahora con la muerte de su esposo, la única esperanza y lo que le motiva a sobreponerse de su pena son sus menores hijos. Elsa es muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenía el cargo de vocal, se encargaba de pasar los comunicados del asesor de crédito a los integrantes, este es su 7mo préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es par la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para contrarrestar al gusano que ataca la papa. Cabe mencionar que ella está muy agradecida con aquellos que hacen posible este crédito para que pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old, she had her partner for 30 years. She is a mother of 8 children. At present she lives alone with her two younger children, and she is very sad because less than two weeks ago her husband died. In life, her husband used to work with her children at the small farm and Elsa worked raising pigs, rams and cows, because her husband used to say that the work at the small farm was only for men. Now she will have to take charge of her husband's farm, but she is worried because she will not be able to take care of her animals. Elsa tell us they mainly sow potatoes and that with the profits of all these years of work they were able to buy their house, acquire their own farming lots and especially educate their children. Whereas the food expenses were covered by the sales of pork, and when they didn't have enough they would sell the cows for 800 or 1000 soles( $250-315), depending on the race. And when the cow produced milk she would make and sell cheese. Now after the death of her husband, it's only hope and her young children what motivates her to get over her sorrow. Elsa is quite active in her communal bank, the past cycle she was a member of the council. She was in charge of giving the announcements from the loan adviser to the members. This her 7th loan, and in all this time she has demonstrated to pay her quotas with great responsibility. The requested money will be use to buy fertilizers and insecticides to protect the potatoes from the worms. It's worth mentioning that she is very grateful to those who make this loan possible so she can work.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. started her local restaurant ten years ago in Bawaleshie, a suburb of Accra, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 42 years old, married and mother with six children. She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Alima wants to use this loan to buy more supplies, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children who are in school. She belongs to a group called Fear Not. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make her business grow by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more supplies like, bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children. She lives in Balite, Sagay, Camiguin in Southern Philippines. She engages in fishing and has a piggery. Most of her customers are in nearby villages and nearby islands. Every day, she works hard to provide the needs of the family.

She wants to buy some additional materials for her bangka (sailboat) and she needs the amount of PHP 11,000. If granted, this will her third loan with HSPFI, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the sailboat (bangka)

loans.name: Maxima Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Máxima del Carmen E. R. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de prendas de plata y oro. Hace más de 5 años que dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de este negocio es de forma ambulante ya que dio inicio a este negocio por que ayudaba a su hermano y así con el paso del tiempo decidió que este seria su trabajo. Los propósitos de Doña Máxima son de emplear a otros en este negocio para generar más ingresos y a al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ventas. Doña Máxima solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar anillos, pulseras, cadenas y aros. Los deseos de Doña Máxima son que los países que aportan ayuda para nicaragua sigan apoyando a las personas que realmente lo necesitan. La cantidad que solicita es de C$12.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Máxima del Carmen E. R. is 36 years old and single. She has been selling silver and gold jewelry for more than five years. She is a street vendor as she started out helping her brother. With time, she decided to become serious about the business. Máxima's goals are to hire employees to generate more income and at the same time increase her sales. Máxima is asking for this loan as working capital so that she can buy rings, bracelets and necklaces. Máxima hopes that those countries which help Nicaragua will continue to help those people who truly need it. She is asking for a loan of C$12.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Hạnh Phan (624981438) is a 42 year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Hạnh owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Hạnh has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1998, Hạnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.  Hạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Hạnh is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hạnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin C., 37 years old, resides in Kampong Cham Province where she works in a grocery store, making approximately $1.50 of profit every day, while her husband earns $3 per day selling recycling items. This couple has three children, one who is a student and two who are employed. Mrs. Rin C. is asking for a loan to expand her grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for the store.

loans.name: Abel Eliseo

texts.es: El joven  Abel Eliseo es originario de la comunidad de Nimasac del departamento de Totonicapan el visita las oficinas de ASDIR de un credito la cual  seran invertidos para gastos de estudios ya que esta finalizando sus estudios universitarios, el joven dia a  dia se esta actualizando para prepararce en fututo, asi poder  tener mayor oportunidad de trabajo hoy esta trabajando como asesor de creditos de una empresa de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Abel Eliseo, a young man, is from the community of Nimasac in the department of Totonicapan. He visited the offices of ASDIR about a loan which will be invested in education expenses, now that he is finishing his university studies. The young man is working every day to prepare himself for the future so that he may have greater opportunity for work such as a credit advisor for a business in Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses

loans.name: Olimata

texts.fr: olimata F. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mai 2009.elle exerce l'activite de teinture depuis plus d'une dizaine d'annees.elle souhaiterait satisfaire la demande de sa clientele qui est de dplus en plus orientee vers la commande de tissus teints.avec ce credit de 150 000 elle compte acuerir ses propres tissus qu'elle va teindre et les exposer a la vente ce qui serait plus rentable pour elle.cette femme est soutient de famille et voudrait ameliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Olimata F. has been a member of the Yoff bank since May 2009. She has worked in the fabric-dying business for over 10 years. She would like to meet the ever-increasing demand of her clients for dyed fabrics. With this loan of 150,000 she plans to buy her own fabrics to dye and sell, which will be more profitable for her. Since she has a family to support, she would like to improve living conditions for them.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for dying and selling

loans.name: Marilyn Aracel

texts.es:
Marilyn es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Marilyn es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hija, Marilyn vende ropas interiores en las diferentes ferias de la región de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal.
Marilyn necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias.
Los sueños de Mariliyn son mejorar su negocio y salir adelante para apoyar a su hija.
texts.en:
Marilyn is a member of the Legioncito communal bank group. She is 31 years old, single, and has one daughter.

Marilyn sells undergarments in the various walk-by markets within the region. She has one employee that helps her with her business.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy stockings. Marilyn dreams of improving her business and moving it forward so that she can support her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stockings

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old; she is divorced and the mother of five children. Three are schooling, one is breastfeeding currently. She divorced when her husband got another woman and now all the family responsibility is on her shoulders.

Agnes is a petty trader selling costume jewelry; she gets her stock of goods from Kumasi. She sells through hawking, that is, house is house selling. She mostly complains of the stress that she goes through to sell. She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry in bulk to increase her stock. It is her dream to make enough profits to provide educational support to the children and also to rent a store.

loans.use: To buy assorted earrings to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda C. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Leonarda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Leonarda owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells ready-to-wear items, cellphone accesories, and electronic load in the local community. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leonarda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonarda is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Leonarda's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos está solicitando  su primer credito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es construir una habitación, labora como cajero de la Estación de servicios de PETRONIC en  zona Urbana de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 2 años, actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea,  este joven se  caracteriza por ser humilde responsable, honesto y con muncho deseos de superación personal y profesional,  a pesar que no tiene hijos el ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y paga sus estudios de la universidad, el de dia trabaja y de noche estudia, vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea, en un barrio creciente, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, terminar de estudiar la carrera  y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus padres.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn V., 20 years old, joined ASHI early in 2009 to be able to have access to credit for starting a business. A variety store was the first business she thought she knew how to run and could augment the income her husband is earning from being a cook of one eatery in their town. However, Jocelyn was not able to control people crediting from her store, therefore, her business towards the end of her loan lost its capital.  Through the financial support of her husband, she was able to pay back her loan on time and have another business, eight months ago, which is hog fattening. 
With the hog fattening business, Jocelyn profits as much double the amount of her capital after only four months of raising the pig. For the second time with ASHI, Jocelyn is requesting a loan which she will use for financing her hog fattening (pig raising) business. The more pigs she will raise and sell, the more profit she will be making. As they don’t have children yet, she wants to prepare financially for a time when they will have children.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her hog fattening (pig raising) business.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: La señora Aura A. M., ella tiene 42 años, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. La señora Aura se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en esto incluye venta de ropa de cama, camisas, pantalones, etc, los cuales distribuye generalmente de forma ambulante, también en su casa realiza ventas, las cuales en su mayoría son a crédito. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Este negocio le ha servido como fuente de ingresos para ella y para la manutención de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercaderías principalmente ropa usada ya que debido a la crisis es la que más se vende. Ella posee el sueño de hacer que el negocio crezca lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miss Aura A. M. is 42 years old and has three young children. Miss Aura sells new and used clothing including bed linens, shirts, pants, etc., which she generally distributes in the form of a ‘mobile store.’ She also makes sales from her house, of which the majority is on credit. She started this business because she didn’t have a way to survive and she couldn’t find a job. This business has given her a source of income for herself and for the maintenance of her family. She is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of mainly used clothing merchandise since due to the crisis this is what she sells the most of. She has a dream of growing her business enough so that in the near future she can make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 68 years old. Gerarda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gerarda sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Gerarda has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gerarda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC that she used to expand her business. Gerarda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that she will use to buy more fish to sell. This will be Gerarda's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen H., 52, is a widow with four children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries at a local market. She is able to generate an income of US$5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by one of her children, who is currently employed as garment factory worker. She is able to earn an income of US$3 per day to help cover her mother’s household expenses. 

The members of H.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store for sale. By doing so, H. hopes that her business will be successful so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Prem

texts.en:
Prem B. is 26 years old and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province. Since 2006, she has been raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 per day, while her husband, pictured here, is a fisherman who makes around US$ 6 every day. The two children are in school.

Prem B. told to a loan officer that she typically spends about US$ 40 on food and US$ 5 on utilities. To make more investments in order to allow her husband more money, she has requested a loan of US$ 800 which her husband needs to purchase a wooden boat and fishing tools.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat and fishing tools.

loans.name: Alice Leila

texts.en:
Alice Leila and her husband are working hard to earn a living for their family in order to overcome the difficulties in life, to support their daily needs, and also to send their children to school. They want them to finish their studies in college so that they will have good jobs some day.

Alice's husband works as a security guard in one of the well-known companies in Bayombong, while Alice manages a small sari-sari store (community based store) in front of their house selling different grocery items. Since their children are in college, she needs to earn a higher income to support their schooling. Therefore, Alice decided to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders. She is requesting PHP15,000.00 to improve her small business. She hopes that her plan will succeed through her patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: Additional capital for improving her sari-sari store

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn S. is from the town of Libag Sur, a barangay of Tuguegarao City in the province of Cagayan on Luzon. She is nineteen years old, married and has two infant-aged children. Crislyn raises pigs to sell. She has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells her pigs.

In 2009, Crislyn joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Crislyn is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use any additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.):

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and –women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 27 years of age. She rents a one-roomed house where she stays with her family of five people. They have three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is paying tuition for her children.

Jamila sells used clothes and she works six days a week, serving about six customers a day. She also has a side business of sewing which adds to her income

Jamila has been with MCDT for three years now and she has so far received six loans. She will use this loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna B. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Maria Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Nacaome, Reyna se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, vende camisas de vestir, cubayeras, camisetas, zapatos de dama, sandalias. tiene varios años de tener su negocio, las mayoria de las camisas que vende son para uniformes de escuelas y colegios de la localidad, en esta epoca de inicio de clases necesita comprar mas ropa para poder darse abasto con las ventas.
dice sentirse muy bien de salud y esta alegre porque todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
con las ganancias que tenga quiere hacerle unas mejoras a su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Reyna B. is 49 years old and lives in the Barrio Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. Reyna has a business selling clothing and shoes. She sells dress shirts, cubayeras [cuban-style shirts], t-shirts, women’s shoes, and sandals. She has been in this business for several years. Most of the shirts Reyna sells are for school uniforms. In this season of the beginning of the school year, she needs to buy more stock to keep up with the demand. Reyna says she is happy to be in good health, and that everything is going well. With her earnings, she would like to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dress shirts, t-shirts, cloth, shoes, and sandals

loans.name: Anccaras Group

texts.es:
María, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos D. 7 años y 1 año. Inició su negocio vendiendo carne D. casa en casa, su suegra le prestó el capital inicial con el cual compró carneros para la venta, ahora que está en FINCA está contenta porque le gustan las charlas, ha aprendido a ahorrar, con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar más carneros, su sueño es tener su propia casa, tener estabilidad económica y una carnicería en el mercado.

Virginia, es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, el menor D. 5 años y el mayor D. 20, antes Virginia vendía caldo D. cabeza (cabeza D. carnero) en una esquina D. la calle, tenía poco capital, su vecina le invitó a participar D. un bancomunal en FINCA, ahora ya tiene 2 ciclos como socia y agradece los préstamos recibidos y las charlas que le ayudan en su negocio, por ahora no venD. mucho por las lluvias que son constantes, pero al menos venD. alguito para poder comer, con el préstamo que solicita va a comprar abarrotes, platos y una meza. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un restaurant y una casa.

Martha, es conviviente, tiene 8 hijos, el más pequeño D. 10 meses y el mayor D. 20 años, Martha no sabía nada D. negocios, cuando llegó a Lircay aprendió y recién hace 2 años venD. anticuchos, ahora con los nuevos préstamos quiere incrementar su negocio vendiendo refrescos como agua D. manzana y maca. Para poder mantener a sus 8 hijos, Martha se ayuda lavando ropa pues el negocio D. venta está bajando por las lluvias.
texts.en:
María is in a common law marriage and has two children, ages 7 and 1. She started a business selling meat door-to-door. María borrowed the initial capital from her mother-in-law. She used the funds to buy mutton to sell. Now that she is with FINCA, María is satisfied because she enjoys the seminars and has learned how to save. With the requested loan, she will buy more mutton. Her dreams are to own her own home, have financial stability, and open a butcher shop at the market.

Viriginia is a single mother with six children, ranging in age from 5 to 20. She previously sold sheep’s head soup on the street corner and had little capital. A neighbor invited her to join one of the Communal Banks associated with FINCA. She has now participated in two loan cycles as a member and is thankful for the loans she has received. The seminars have been a great help to her business, but now she does not sell as much because of the constant rains. At least she sells just enough to allow her family to eat. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy groceries, dishes, and a table. Her dreams incluD. seeing her children become professionals, opening a restaurant, and owning a home.

Martha is in a common law marriage and has eight children, ranging in age from 10 months to 20 years. She did not know anything about business, but when she arrived in Lircay two years ago, she learned how to prepare and sell “anticuchos” (skewered meats). Now with these new loans, she wants to expand her business by selling beverages maD. of apples and maca root in order to support her eight children. Martha also offers to wash clothes whenever business is slow because of the rains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel P., 24, just joined ASHI in 2009. Her early marriage and motherhood pushed her capabilities in running a small business. She had no other way to change her life, as well as her two children’s lives, as she depended on her husband’s small income as a motorcycle technician. She is not even a graduate of college (because she came from a poor family) to be employed in offices or have a better paying job. Because of that, Maricel opened her eyes to see more options for having her own income; hence, she thought of her skill in cooking food. She thought that maybe, selling food as her business would provide her an income which she could use to augment her husband’s. 

When she became a member of ASHI, the loan she received was used to start her envisioned business. She gained a lot of customers from the neighborhood and even from other villages. After six months, she had fully repaid her loan and had improved their life a little. Her second loan, with a much larger amount, enhanced further her business; however, to fully achieve her dream of having a restaurant, she needs more loans. Therefore, after just recently paying off her second loan, Maricel is again requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. This will be used for the same purpose. Some of the proceeds of her business will be spent for obtaining her family’s basic needs, while some will be saved for her two children, whose ages are 2 and 5.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase utensils and ingredients for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Abau

texts.en:
Abau E. sells bread at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread for sale. Abau is 30 years old and is married to a a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Boeun Ka, 47, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have ten children: seven sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home; three attend school, and the other three are still young.

Ky has been selling recycling materials for two years, while her husband has been raising pigs for the same amount of time. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation to school.

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es: 1.	La señora Silvia es una persona con dos hijos a su cargo los cuales dependen de ella , labora como conserge en la UNICA  , este préstamo lo utilizara para gastos  en  el mejoramiento de la vivienda
texts.en:
Silvia is the mother of two children who depend on her. She works as a counsoler at the UNICA. She will use the money from this loan to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Naysha Dilan

texts.es:
La socia Naysha; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar como hija con el comercio minorista;  Nuestra socia estudia en la universidad particular obstetricia y en su tiempo libre ayuda  en el negocio de su a mamá, su mamá vive en Puerto Maldonado, ella vende verduras y su hija le envía verduras fresas en camiones a Puerto Maldonado, ellas tienen terrenos de cultivos de zanahorias, tomate, cebolla y algunas frutas, ambas trabajan mutuamente y con un buen ritmo, está socia inicialmente entró al banco en representación de su mamá, pero ahora es titular y saca su propio capital de trabajo para continuar con el negocio de la familia.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Naysha belongs to a communal bank called “LAS AMISTOSAS” ("The Friendly Women"). She comes from the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco, located 1 hour from the city of Cusco. She is 19 years old and single. She divides her time between her household chores and working with her mother in her retail business. She is also studying obstetrics at a private university. Her mother lives in Puerto Maldonado and sells vegetables. Her daughter sends her fresh vegetables in trucks to Puerto Maldonado.
