They have farmlands planted with carrots, tomatoes, onions and some kinds of fruits. Both of them work in harmony and help each other. Naysha first joined the bank as a representative of her mother, but now she has her own account and is receiving her own working capital to continue with the family business. Naysha values and appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angelo's Group

texts.en:
Angelo D. Jr. is from the village of San Francisco, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 35 years old. Angelo is the group leader of a 22-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Angelo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelo owns & operates a bakery; he bakes & sells bread in the local community. Angelo just started this business.

Angelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelo is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: Mork S., 47, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells bananas at a local market for an income of about USD 6 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a new motorbike for her kid to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to be a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila A. is from the village of Malasin. She is 40 years old. Leonila is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. Aside from that, Leonila also sells crackers (snacks) and soft drinks as another source of income. In 2008, Leonila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: 06.03.03-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Toán Lê Thị  (34) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Hoằng Hóa-Thanh Hóa.  Toán is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 06.03.03-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hóa (06.03.03-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hóa).

Toán is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Toán operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale.  Toán has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Toán joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Toán has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Toán plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. Thị Sáu (33) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Gái (5) is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Toán Lê Thị  (34) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng Hóa-Thanh Hóa.  Toán là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.03.03-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hóa (06.03.03-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Toán thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Toán kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2003, Toán đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Toán đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. Thị Sáu (33) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Gái (5) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson B. is from the village of Sagrada Tambulig in Zamboanga del Sur. He is 57 years old and married with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Nelson raising crops, primarily rice, for selling. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Las Flores de la Pradera, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos del centro de la ciudad.

Ella es profesora y actualmente se vale de esta profesión para ganarse la vida y ayudar a sus vecinos. Ella ha fundado desde hace tres años una institución educativa que funciona en su vivienda, allí ella brinda educación inicial a los diversos niños de la zona cobrándo precios cómodos, algunos estudiantes del lugar le apoyan dando clases y juntos pueden sacar adelante esta pequeña escuela.

María divide su tiempo entre el cuidado de sus alumnos y en el de su familia, su esposo es maestro constructor y con el dinero que ambos ganan sacan adelante a su hogar. 

María desea realizar mejoras en el baño del colegio para que sus alumnos puedan estudiar con mayor comodidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar el material para realizar esta acción.

María es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona por su labor y entrega a su profesion, su mayor anhelo es poder encontrar un terreno propio para que su Institución Educativa tenga un local mas apropiado.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 39, is a mother living with her husband and children in Las Flores de la Pradera, an urban zone on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo located fifteen minutes from city center. She is a teacher and uses her profession to support herself and help her neighbors. Three years ago she established an educational institution in her home. She provides initial education to neighborhood children charging affordable rates. Some of the local students help her teach some of the classes and their joint effort has enabled the small school to succeed. María divides her time between caring for her students and caring for her family. Her husband is a master builder and their combined income allows them to support their household. María would like to make some improvements to the school’s bathroom so that her students will be more comfortable. Thus she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 800 new sol, loan to buy the materials and supplies needed for this project. María is quite well known and liked in her community because of her work and her dedication to her profession. Her greatest wish is to come by a piece of property on which to install her educational institution more appropriately.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies to repair bathroom in educational institution located in her home.

loans.name: Janny Ondina

texts.es:
Janny de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella es comerciantes informal de ropa y relojes de mano. 

Ella comenzó con su esposo a vender ropa deambulando en las calles del suburbio para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a comprar mas mercadería como relojes y mas ropa. Los dos trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para todo tipo de personas, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Janny, 42, lives in an urbana rea of El Suburbio, Guayaquil. She is an informal clothing and wristwatch merchant. She started out in sales with her husband wandering throughout El Suburbio’s streets to be able to support their two children. Little by little with much effort she was able to buy more merchandise like wristwatches and more clothes. Both of them work from 8am until 7pm every day. To continue with sales she wants to use the loan to buy clothes for all types of people. In the future, she’d like to improve her house’s construction and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana de Jesús García es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los jóvenes salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejores oportunidades de trabajo y muchos han migrado a diferentes partes del mundo para mejorar la economía de sus hogares.
 
La Señora Mariana trabaja como ayudante de secretaria hace 9 meses,  labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. de lunes a sábados, en su hogar se dedica a la cría de animales como: chanchos, pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en la feria de ganado.

Doña Mariana tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad, su esposo es de profesión albañil,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada de un familiar.

Es nuestra socia hace 5 años y los créditos que le han otorgado le han beneficiado para la compra de animales y para llevara víveres a su hogar. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más chanchos para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es  ponerse unas cabinas telefónicas e Internet por su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana de Jesús García is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in San Miguel, a community in Del Valle parish, known for its natural beauty. Its residents are farmers and cattlemen. The young people move to the city in search of better employment opportunities and many have emigrated to various parts of the world in an effort to improve their home’s economies. Mariana has worked as a secretarial assistant for the last 9 months. She works from 8am until 5pm, Monday through Saturday. At home, she raises small farm animals like: pigs, chickens and guinea pigs that she then sells at the livestock fairs. Mariana, 24, is married and has two children who are 4 and 3 years of age. Her husband is a bricklayer. They do not own their own home; they live in a house they borrow from a relative. She has been our partner for 5 years and the loans she has been granted have been beneficial in the purchase of animals and to provide groceries for the home. She will use the new loan to buy more pigs in order to enlarge her business. Her goal is to install phone and Internet service booths for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Costa Alegre de la compañía cabañas de la cuidad de Caacupé. 
Son muy trabajadoras y unidas, realizan actividades diversas como grupo, así pueden adelantar el pago de sus cuotas y acceder a un crédito mayor en un corto plazo. 
Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias a la institución pueden acceder a créditos con facilidad, también a constantes capacitaciones, ahora también capacitaciones para con sus hijos, con el programa de aflatoun; con eso enriquecen sus conocimientos y ayudan al sustento de sus hogares.
Las integrantes ya culminaron hoy su ciclo crediticio número 14, poseen una antigüedad de  4 años aproximadamente.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Florentina R. quien es costurera de ropas para damas y caballero.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad hace buen tiempo y tiene muchos clientes que acuden a ella ya les gusta su trabajo.
Con esta actividad puede ayudar a su familia y mediante el comité ella se capacita y mejora su trabajo y al mismo tiempo utiliza y administra mejor los recursos con que cuenta.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones, y otros accesorios que ella utiliza para su confeccion.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from the “Costa Alegre de la compañía cabañas” neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. They are hardworking and united ladies, each working different activities as part of the group. In this way they are able to get ahead on their payments and pay off large loans in a short time. The ladies are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya, because, thanks to this institution, they are able get their loans easily. It also provides them with constant learning, for them and their children, through the “Aflatoun” program. This way they are able to enrich their knowledge and help them maintain their households. The members have completed their 14th loan cycle and have been in the program for approximately four years. One of the members is Florentina R., who is a seamstress and makes ladies’ and men’s clothing. She’s been doing this for a good amount of time and has lots of customers who patronize her, because they like her work. She’s able to help her family through this business; and through the group she can better her skills, improve her work, and at the same time better manage her resources through her account. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, fasteners, buttons, and other accessories that she uses for her creations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en: Jemalyn L. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 22 years old. Jemalyn is married and has three young children. To make a living, raises pigs for breeding. Jemalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Jemalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jemalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Jemalyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jemalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.en: Mahmad A. is 57 years old. He and his wife have raised three children. For five years, Mahmad has been involved in manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. The elder son of Mahmad helps his father in the business. Mahmad is respected and known in the neighborhood as a real master and that allows him to have a clientele. The business is stable, generating the main income for the family. Today, Mahmad needs to purchase input materials like wood, plywood, flake board and other supplies for his business. Also he is planning to improve the working conditions of the business. For this purpose, he requests $2,000. Mahmad thanks all for supporting him and for their trust. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing wood, plywood, flake board and other supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. M., age 49, sells assorted items ranging from foodstuffs to daily-use items. For example, she sells biscuits, bananas, kales, and tablecloths. She has been in this business for six years and she says that the business is profitable. She sells her wares locally. She says that her major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more buy more general items for sale, such as potatoes, eggs, and soap, in order to expand her business. She hopes to become a wholesaler in future. She is very hardworking, honest, and punctual.

Lucia's husband is a mechanic and they have seven children between the ages of 7 and 18. Her business is located at Kibera and she is served by the Kitengela branch.

loans.use: To buy more general items for sale, such as potatoes, eggs, and soap

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya lives in a 2-room brick house in a small city called Depalpur. Her husband’s name is M. Y. and he has a computer repair shop in the market.

Suraiya is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She has given birth to 4 sons. None of them are enrolled in school because Suraiya and her husband can’t afford their education expenses.

Suraiya’s husband is the only breadwinner in the family so it is very necessary for him to establish his business to improve her family's financial condition.  Therefore, Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan in purchasing the latest repairing tools and computer accessories for his shop.

She is confident that her husband, who has been doing this business for past 10 years, will successfully be able to achieve positive results from his business after investing the loan money into it.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools and accessories for computer repair shop

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is a married woman who lives in Purok Magtalisay I, Brgy Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She operates 2 business ventures: fishing and farming. Her husband, Felix A., who is 59 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children aged between 30 and 35. 

Tessie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tessie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800, thus lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000. She intends to use this to buy materials for her fishing boat so that she can continue to save for the future improvement of business. Tessie A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Fanny Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita. Fanny A. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como  Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su cultura y tradiciones hacen de esta una ciudad encantadora, tiene gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y muy cordial.

Nuestra socia es soltera y tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, su papá es jubilado y su mamá se dedica  a la cría de animales.

La Señorita Fanny estudia en la universidad la carrera de Psicología Infantil, esta en cuarto año, en su tiempo libre se dedica a ha realizar recorridos llevando y trayendo niños de las escuelas.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su prima fue quien la invito a formar parte de este grupo, su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de repuestos para su vehiculo. Su meta es realizar un centro de recreación para los niños que van con sus madres al mercado.
texts.en:
Srta. Fanny A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Fighting Women) and lives in the city of Cuenca, which is also known as “Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos”. The city is known for its culture and traditions that make it an enchanting city, its wide variety of cuisines, and its warm and friendly people. Fanny is 27 years old and single. She lives at home with her parents. Her father is retired while her mother raises animals.

Srta. Fanny is a university student who is in her fourth year toward earning a degree in child psychology. During her free time, she drives children to and from school.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. Her cousin invited her to join the group. The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for her vehicle. Her goal is to open a recreation center where children can go while their mothers are at the market.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en:
Donathille is a 58 year old widow and has eight children.  She also cares for three other dependents. Currently, eight of her children attend school.  Donathille sells foodstuffs, which she has done for 30 years. 

Donathille will use the loan to purchase foodstuffs, such as sweet potatoes and beans, to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Donathille plans to continue to grow her business, and she hopes to buy a car for business purposes in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Chuluundolgor

texts.en:
Chuluundolgor G. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and enclosure. One of her children is a university student, three children attend a local secondary school and the oldest works as a salesperson in a grocery shop with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT. Chuluundolgor's husband is a crane mechanist and during summer months their family income has increased greatly.

Chuluundolgor operates a firewood sales business next to her home in her town. She started her business in 2006 selling her products at the local coal and firewood trading market. Her main customers are the neighboring households and she has gained a wide customer base. After years in business, she has built a stable operation. For the future, she hopes to operate a livestock and meat trading business. Chuluundolgor is a talkative and open-minded person. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and coal for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and coal

loans.name: Ana Liseth

texts.es:
Ana, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, negocio que inicio con la ayuda de su madre, no tiene horario fijo, por el momento quiere comprar más cerdos pero no cuenta con los recursos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar dicha inversión.
La obtención de este préstamo le ayudara a ampliar la granja, a tener más animalitos para comercializar y sacar de ellos un buen provecho, fortaleciendo sus ingresos familiares y mejorando su situación económica.
El Objetivo de Ana es mejorar en el comercio de Cerdos, tener un espacio grande para la granja, y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana, who lives in San Rafael Oriento, in the San Miguel department, lives with her husband and two children who are 6 and 2 years old. She raises pigs, which is a business that she started with the help of the mother. She doesn't have a set schedule. She wants to buy more pigs, but does not have the resources. This is why she is asking for a loan to reach her goal.
This loan will help her to make the farm bigger, to have more animals to sell, and to make a good profit off of them. This will strengthen the family income and improve their economic situation.
Ana's objective is to improve her pig business, to have a big space for the farm, and to look after the well-being of her children.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Gunne

texts.en: Gunne is currently in the business of selling soft drinks, for example soda, water, etc. She is 25 years old and married to a policeman. Gunne has no children yet. She has taken out a loan to stock more soft drinks, for example sodas, water,etc. to sell. In the future, Gunne hopes to build a house to rent out with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more soft drinks, for example sodas, water, etc. to sell

loans.name: Taj's Group

texts.en:
Taj is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She resides in Samundri, a small city of Punjab, known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. Her home is a small one containing two rooms. 

She has given birth to four sons. Her eldest son helps his father in his business. Her second and third sons are drivers by profession and the youngest one is studying in sixth class. 
 
Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is involved in the agriculture profession. He works in the field and grows different seasonal crops.   

Taj has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy fertilizers and seeds to get better results from his field.
  
He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Taj is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business into a more profitable position and improve the living standard of her family.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Taj.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce M. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Three of his children are currently in school. Wilberforce has a butchery and sells meat. He has had the shop for less than one year.

To help expand his business, Wilberforce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat for resale. With the help of a loan from BRAC, Wilberforce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Wilberforce hopes to improve on his business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for resale

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 23 años, es una excepcional mujer. Pues cuida de su papá Jesús, su mamá Herlinda y sus 2 hermanos; con los que vive en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). A pesar de haber culminado sus estudios de enfermería; no deja de dedicarse al oficio de sus padres, “la agricultura”. En sus propios terrenos agrícolas siembra café y plátanos, hace 5 años. De lunes a viernes trabaja en una farmacia de la ciudad de Villarica, mientras que los fines de semana, dedica su tiempo en los cuidados de sus cultivos los cuales quiere mucho, pues es la actividad de la familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder brindar trabajo en la cosecha de café a los vecinos de su localidad, pues necesita la ayuda de peones para extraer los granos de café. Su principal dificultad es la falta de apoyo, por ello más adelante está pensando contratar personal permanente para poder dar a sus cultivos el cuidado que necesita. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo recibido de parte de los miembros de su asociación. Luz, comprará con el crédito, abono orgánico y canastas, para la cosecha de café que se realizará a fines de este mes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 23, is an exceptional woman.  She takes care of her father, Jesús; her mother; Herlinda, and her two siblings.  They live together as a family in their own house.  The house is located in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).  In spite of having finished her nursing studies, she does not stop working in her parents’ business, farming.  For five years they have been growing coffee and bananas on their own farming land.

From Monday through Friday she works in a pharmacy in the city of Villarica.  On the week-ends she takes care of their crops, which she likes a lot because it is a family activity.  What she likes the most about her work is being able to give work to her neighbors during the coffee harvest.  She needs the workers’ help in order to extract the coffee beans.  Her main difficulty is the lack of help.  She is thinking of hiring permanent personnel later in order to be able to give her crops the care they need.

She belongs to the Desarollando para el Futuro de Prisma Communal Bank.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received from the members of the association.  Luz will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer and baskets for her coffee harvest  at the end of this month.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and baskets for her coffee harvest at the end of this month

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 37 años,  es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad de chofer hace 15 años antes manejaba bus público, después se compró un carro usado lo cual lo usa como taxi.

En la actualidad laborar en su taxi de 7h00am a 9h00pm. Lo que más de afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia ya que un día le robaron el taxi pero lo pudo recuperar. Con el préstamo quiere arreglar de unos documentos  del carro para llevarlo a la chatarra y comprar mercadería para abrir una papelería que tiene. En un futuro quiere comprarse su carro nuevo  con el proceso de chatarra para carros que realizo al meter sus documentos y seguir en su negocio de papelería.
texts.en:
Juan, 37, is a hard working man who started working as a Driver 15 years ago.  He used to drive a public bus but then bought a used car that he uses as a taxi.

He currently works in his taxi from 7am until 9pm.  What most affects his work is the delinquency since he already had his taxi stolen although he was able to recover it.  He wants to use the loan to take care of some documentation related to the car so he can take it to the junk yard and buy merchandise to open a stationery shop he has.  In the future he’d like to buy a new car with the junk metal process for cars he took care of when he filed his documents and continue with his stationery shop business.

loans.use: pay vehicle related processing fees and to buy merchandise for a small stationery shop he has.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta K. is 50 years old and married with one adult child. She is from the village of Tabuk-Tulay, Dicayas. To make a living, Modesta owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She also runs a sari-sari (variety store) and food vending business.

Modesta joined PMPC in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fabrics and materials for a business expansion. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to acquire a rice field. This will be Modesta’s thirteenth loan with PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a rice field

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two children in a rented basement of an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His older son, aged 8, goes to a secondary school. His younger child hasn't reached school age. 

Batdelger manages a wool products making and trading business, with the help of his wife. She used to work at one of the wool manufacturer's for several years. Batdelger used to operate a clothes trading business at a local market. 

Three years ago, based on his trading skills and on his wife's clothes making skills, they began to operate a wool products manufacturing business. They rent a small basement where they live and work. Through successful business operations they have managed to buy three sewing machines. They are very hardworking people, trying hard to improve their life. They say that they want to have their own house in the future. He is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for his manufacturing business, such as another sewing machine.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, natural D. L. ciudad D. Quimbiri D. 32 años, convive con María D. 30 años D. edad y fruto D. esa relación concibieron 02 hijas, Erika D. 10 años y Naomi D. 04 años a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar y a ganarse el dinero con el esfuerzo D. si mismo y creció con esas enseñanzas. Hoy su actividad principal es el comercio y se dedica a acopiar productos D. L. zona tales como: café, cacao, achiote y palillo, productos oriundos D. L. zona selvática. En su negocio cuenta con el apoyo D. sus trabajadores quienes se encargan D. cargar y pesar los kilogramos D. cada producto. Con su carro recorren varias comunidades en busca D. productos, una vez acumulado una buena cantidad D. mercadería lo trasfieren a las empresas acopiadoras D. gran renombre quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo D. carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable aparte D. entregar L. mercadería las empresas acopiadoras que le pagan con una buena cantidad D. dinero anualmente. Las épocas invierno son D. lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, propias D. L. naturaleza, para Julián son meses D. atraso, porque obstruyen los caminos y perjudican el traslado D. L. carga. Los planes para el futuro D. su negocio es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y esta comprometido en pagar sus aportes puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otro aporte posteriormente. El crédito solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar productos como: café, cacao y achiote a los campesinos.
texts.en:
Julián is from the city of Quimbiri.  He is 32 years old and lives with 30 year-old María with whom he has two daughters: 10 year-old Erika and 4 year-old Naomi, who he would like to proviD. with a better quality of life.

Julián's parents taught him to work and earn money through his own efforts from a very early age.  He grew up with these lessons.  Today, his main business activity is buying and selling.  He buys and stockpiles produce from his region such as coffee, cacao, annatto and turmeric which are all native to the rainforest.  In his business, he has the support of his workers who take charge of loading and weighing each product by the kilogram.  They use his vehicle to travel to different communities in search of produce.  Once he has amassed a good quantity of produce, he transfers it to well-known trading companies who pay him a good quantity of money annually.

Winter brings rainy periods and landslides on the roads.  For Julián, these are months of delay because when the roads are blocked, it becomes difficult for him to transport his cargo.  Julián's plan for the future of his business is to continue working with the same determination that he is noted for.  This is his first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time since he would like to access another loan in the future.  He will use the loan he has requested as capital with which to buy products from farmers such as coffee, cacao and annatto.

loans.use: to buy coffee, cacao and annatto from farmers

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.es:
Flordelia  de 53 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con todos los servicio de luz, agua y desagüe, ubicada en el distrito de Pomalca que se encuentra a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  La actividad de los pobladores es el cultivo de la caña y la elaboración de azúcar de caña, agricultura y ganadería.

Flordelia se dedica a la venta deprendas de vestir y ropa interior, negocio que ha colocado en un puesto del mercado de Chiclayo desde hace unos  5 años,  su negocio últimamente ha tenido más acogida por a traído mercadería innovadora, la que le ha permitido que sus ingresos se incrementen para poder solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar Flordelia que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida, también para ayudar a las personas con las que vive.
texts.en:
Flordelia  de 53 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con todos los servicio de luz, agua y desagüe, ubicada en el distrito de Pomalca que se encuentra a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  La actividad de los pobladores es el cultivo de la caña y la elaboración de azúcar de caña, agricultura y ganadería.

Flordelia se dedica a la venta deprendas de vestir y ropa interior, negocio que ha colocado en un puesto del mercado de Chiclayo desde hace unos  5 años,  su negocio últimamente ha tenido más acogida por a traído mercadería innovadora, la que le ha permitido que sus ingresos se incrementen para poder solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar Flordelia que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida, también para ayudar a las personas con las que vive.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Urtnasan is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a salesperson and his younger two sons go to a secondary school. His older daughter, age 22, gave birth and stays home. He manages a transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2005 with his truck. In addition he works as a welder in order to supplement to his earnings. He makes doors, windows, and window protectors for his customers. Now his business has been stabilized which allowed him to fix his truck. 

He is a hardworking man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skills. He says, "While working as a welder I have gained much profit. Therefore I am planning to build a workshop in order to expand my business." He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to build his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a workshop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells tomatoes and smoked fish at Abura.  In the photo, she is standing in front of the oven she uses to smoke the fish. She is married and has four children. Her spouse is a cleaner. She supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 49 años de edad y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, Cirila vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Cirila se dedica a la venta de leche en su domicilio pues sus clientes vienen desde la ciudad del Cusco a comprar. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para construir su casa pues está a medio construir.
 
Cirila es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Cirila says she was born in the community of Tambo Real in Anta Province, Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children. Cirila currently lives in the same community where she was born and has developed her business activities. She sells milk from her home to customers who come from the city of Cusco. Cirila has been in business for 25 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can build her house, which is halfway through the construction process.

Cirila is a hardworking and responsible person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase materials for finishing the construction of her house.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Абдурахим имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он повар. У него имеется столовая рядом с Автобазой, где он работает поваром. В этой области он работает уже 28 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта столовой и приобретения продуктов.
texts.en: Abdurahim lives in Vahdat.  He is 55 years old, married, and has seven children.  His wife is a housewife.  Abdurahim has a vocational education as a cook.  He has a cafe near the bus station where he works as a cook.  He has been doing this for 28 years.  He is taking out a loan to renovate his cafe and buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: to renovate his cafe and buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. All of her children are currently in school.  

Joan has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar. She has run her shop for five years.    

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Joan hopes to expand her business. Joan is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Karume Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child who attends school. She has been running a beauty salon for four years. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipment which was out of stock and she has repaid her loan successfully. Mariam wants a loan to buy more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her group "Karume" which consists of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana, trabaja en servicios domesticos, es casada, madre de tres hijos, su esposo labora como albañil, y junto han logrado la construccion de su casa.
Tiene varios años laborando, ya que ambos apoyan a sus hijos, y todo esta ah altos costos. Y para mejorar su casa, tiene que trabajar. Ahora con los prestamos en Afodenic, se le ha hecho mas rapido avanzar en las mejoras. Ya que son aplazos flexible, equilibran los gastos para cumplir con sus compromiso de pago.
Con el credito anterior logro el repellado en la parte exterior, ahora con este nuevo financiamiento, repellara las paredes de adentro a si como una division para lograr privacidad.
Materiales a comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, arrenilla, esponja, entre otros materiales que ayude con la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Ana works as a housekeeper.  She is married, and the mother of three children. Her husband works in construction, and together they have managed to construct their house.  They have been working on it for several years, since both are supporting their children, and costs for construction are high.

To improve the house, she has to work.  Now, the loans from Afodenic have enabled her to move forward more quickly with the improvements. As the instalments are flexible, they balance their expenditures, so that they can meet their loan payment commitments.

With the previous loan she managed to plaster the exterior part of the house. Now, with this new loan, she will plaster the interior walls, as well as construct dividing walls for privacy. She will buy materials such as stone, sand, cement, fine sand, sponges, and other things that are needed for the project.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for plastering the interior walls of her home, and for dividing it into rooms, for her family's privacy.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells provisions and cooking utensils in Abura. Ekua has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a blacksmith. The business is about 10 years old. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to procure cooking utensils to resell.

loans.use: to procure cooking utensils to resell.

loans.name: Houreye

texts.fr: Commerçante depuis plus de dix ans ou elle s'active dans ce domaine dans une enclave de la capitale du Sénégal, cette femme s'active dans le domaine du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de tissus et d'autre produits divers telsque des habits prêts a porté. Le but de ce prêt lui permettra de se renforcer en marchandises et de s'approvisionner afin de repondre a l'attente de ses clients.Son fond de roulement etand a la baisse elle veut se renforcer pour combler son stock de marchandises
texts.en: This lady has been a trader for more than ten years in an enclave of the capital of Senegal. She is more specifically a trader of fabrics and other products, such as ready-to-wear clothing. This loan will enable her to boost her stock and get fresh supplies in order to meet customer demand. Her working capital is diminishing and she wants to strengthen it in order to build up her stocks.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and various products

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 46, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alex, a construction worker. They are blessed with one child who is currently studying in high school. She enjoys being a wife, a mother and a businesswoman. 

Alma owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 15,000 that will help to continue her business well.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. It will also help her to attract more customers to buy household needs. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs.

Alma dreams that her sari-sari (variety) store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes that she and her family will continue to have good health and a strong spiritual life. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week as the teachings and sharing of the word of God continues to enlighten and uplift her spirit. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el restaurant y también quiere terminar de hacer el acabado de su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como arena y cemento.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de los Temblores-Poroy Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.  
Erika is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and the management of her restaurant.  She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner and works from 8:00 AM until 9:00 PM.  This business provides the means for her children to get ahead in life.  Erika wishes to expand the restaurant and also finish the work on her house.  She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials such as sand and cement. She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband, who is employed, also helps provide for the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Amina has operated a clothes business for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a challenge of seasonality: in some months there are low sales. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nahomy

texts.es: Nahomy, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltera y actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va compara los materiales para terminar su casa. Ella cuenta con su hogar ya construido pero le hace falta terminar unas partes de su hogar para darle más seguridad a sus bienes. Una de sus metas es darle el acabado definitivo a su hogar para contar con la seguridad de sus pertenecías dentro del hogar. Ella quiere darle a sus hijos un hogar con mejores condiciones de vivencia y así poder contar con el hogar propio para seguir adelante con su vida en el futuro.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nahomy, 26, is single and lives with her two children, who are her top priority. She will use the loan to buy materials to finish her house. She has built a home but still needs to finish some parts to make it more secure. One of her goals is to complete her home so that her belongings will be safe inside of it. She wants to give her children a home with better living conditions and to have her own home for the future. 

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She has not had loans from other banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan easily and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 34 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city. She has three children who are going to school. She has a store. She sells groceries and she is a cobbler. She has had this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She always needs loans to expand her business. So she has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 7.840.000 VND to invest in her store. This is the sixth time she has borrowed a loan from SEDA. This time she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, and other things for her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, and other things for her store.

loans.name: C18519 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is 36 years old and is married. She has five children between the ages 5 and 10 years old. Immaculee is also the leader of this group, which is called "C18519 Twitezimbere" in the local language. She sells at a boutique (Salt, Irish potatoes, rice, sugar). Immaculee employs one person to help her and she has five years of experience. She works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. She is the first person on the left in this picture. 

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by buying more rice, sugar, milk and bananas to sell. With this profit, Immaculee hopes to satisfy their customers and to save for the family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, sugar, rice, milk and so on.

loans.name: La Cumbre De Pasajoc Group

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda es casada, tiene 36 de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, se dedica a la crianza de animales específicamente la crianza de pollos de engorde, inició criando pollos, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo para solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas pollos de engorde y mejorar su producción, espera en el futuro tener una granja. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de cerdos, bordado de blusas,  y a la confección de delantales.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is married, and she is 36 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has five children; two of them go to school.

She raises animals.  Specifically, she raises chickens to fatten.  She started raising chickens, and she now has ten years of experience.  Her husband is a bricklayer, and she has his support.

She organized a group in order to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy more chickens to fatten and improve her production.

In the future she wishes to have a farm.

The other members of the group raise pigs, embroider blouses, and make aprons.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
Yony nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Yony tiene 30 años edad y es conviviente y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella tiene diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores pero su actividad económica principal es trabajar en un hotel como cocinera. Yony trabaja desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días de lunes a domingos en el restaurante pero durante la semana le dan un día libre, ella aprendió el oficio de cocina por su propia cuenta de recetas y videos de cocina. Yony es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. En  esta oportunidad Yony requiere el préstamo para hacer construir su casa y desea comprar yeso, cemento, madera, arena, tubos y focos. Su sueño de Yony es la abrir un restaurante en la ciudad de Urubamba.  

Yony es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Yony was born in Urubamba province and lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja which is in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, Peru.

Yony is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She works in different business activities.  For example, she farms and also raises livestock.  However, her main business activity is working in a hotel as a cook.  Yony works from 7.00am to 10.00pm every day, from Monday to Sunday, in the restaurant but they give her a day off during the week.  She learned the cookery trade by herself, from recipes and cookery videos.  Yony is an enterprising and hard-working woman who provides for her family.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to build her house.  She would like to buy plaster, cement, wood, sand, pipes and light bulbs.  Her dream is to open a restaurant in the city of Urubamba.

Yony is a member of the 'Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja' (Sunflowers of Rumichaca Baja) community bank.  This bank has 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja, which is where they carry out their business activities.

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a teacher and has 5 children. Ekua extracts oil from palm kernels to sell at Benkyadze near Elmina. She also sells fish. Ekua has been in this business for 8 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in caring for their children. She will use her requested loan to purchase more fish and palm kernels (for their oil) to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and palm kernels for the extraction of oil to sell.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por la comunidad de Santa Ana en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, se encuentra rodeado de exuberante naturaleza, desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres. 

Doña María tiene 58 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, tres de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, cuatro son solteros de los cuales uno trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, uno estudia a distancia y trabaja y sus dos últimas hijas estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la  que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría y vende cerdos, borregos, cuyes y aves a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos.

Su meta es de sacar adelante a sus hijos, que culminen sus estudios y se superen en sus vidas.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank Unión Progresista. She lives in the community of Santa Ana in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate and is surrounded by abundant nature. From the center of the parish one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people are friendly, gentle, and keep the culture of their parents.

María is 58 years old, married and through this relationship has seven children. Three of her children are married and live independently. Four are single of which one works and helps her financially, one studies and works remotely, and the last two daughters are studying at a school in the city. Her husband works as a construction worker. The house where she lives is her own property.

María does the household chores and works in agriculture with the harvest for household consumption. She also raises and sells pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and poultry that she sells when she has a financial need.

The member has been with the communal bank for four years and her new loan is to invest in the purchase of pigs. Her dream is to bring up her children, that they finish their studies, and are successful in their lives.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Kanak

texts.en:
Kanak is a 35-year-old differently able lady living with her parents, husband and children. She owns and manages a Ladies Novelty Store where she sells bangles, bindis (forehead stickers), nail colors, lip colors, hair accessories, ready-made garments and other fashion accessories. She earns 2,000 INR per month from this activity but this is not sufficient for her to run her family. Her husband is a fisherman. 

She has a plan to enhance her Ladies Novelty Corner by adding more products like cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, and other fashion accessories. She says that doing so will improve her earnings and her family’s status. She has requested a loan of 36,000 INR for purchasing the above items for her Ladies Novelty Corner. She has dream of educating her children and helping her husband financially to manage the family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, and fashion accessories for her Ladies Novelty Corner.

loans.name: Luis Ulpiano

texts.es: Luis tiene 54 años de edad,  de estado civil divorciado, tiene dos hijos, Carlos de 8 y Natalia de 4 años de edad, es una persona responsable y muy dedicado con su trabajo, gracias a su esfuerzo, sus dos niños pueden tener una buena educación, a pesar de su duro trabajo, el pasa mucho tiempo con sus hijos, ayudándoles con sus tareas o con lo que ellos necesiten, el solicita del crédito para comprar más material que es de uso para su pequeña carpintería, y así puede realizar más productos y por ende obtener mayores ganancias para salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: para implementar su negocio de carpinteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Felisa lives in the Villa Nueva Potosi neighborhood on a hillside to the East of the city of La Paz. She rents her house and lives with her husband and her son. She is 31 years old, and sells various products such as blouses, jackets, pants, sports clothing and jewelry. She has been involved in this work for more than ten years. This is not direct sales, she takes orders, makes deliveries and gets payments daily. Due to her previous history with this institution it is recommended that she be granted this credit since she is self-employed and this work provides her with her only income.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felisa vive en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí, ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, en una casa alquilada cuya renta mensual es de Bs.250.oo (Doscientos cincuenta 00/100 Bolivianos), con su esposo y su hijo. Tiene 31 años de edad y se dedica a la venta al por menor de diferentes clases de productos como ser blusas, chompas, pantalones, zapatos, buzos deportivos, chamarras e incluso joyas. Realiza esta actividad casi mas de 10 años, este trabajo no es de venta directa ella acomoda las prendas y realiza el cobro todos los días en un monto fluctuante entre Bs. 5 y Bs. 10 por prenda colocada. Por su antecedente histórico con la Institución se recomienda otorgarle el crédito ya que su actividad es de autoempleo y le proporciona el único ingreso que ella tiene.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
My name is Rosa A. and I am dedicated to the sales of sandals. I have had my business for one year, the product is very marketable in our community because of the high temperatures, it only makes sense for us to use this type of footwear. My goal is to have more products which will allow for greater sales. With my earnings I would be able to feed my new, recently born granddaughter, since her mother has left her in my custody.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es rosa A. me dedico a la venta de zandalias tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, este producto es muy comercial en nuestra comunidad ya que las altas temperaturas nos hacen andar con este tipo de calzado, mi meta es tener mas producto para hacer mayores ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi nieta recien nacida ya que su mama me la dejo en custodia.

loans.use: purchase of sandals

loans.name: Beltha

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Beltha N. is married, a mother of seven children and a grandmother.  Two of her children have died.  With a large family, she and her husband found it difficult to provide food and pay for school fees for her children since they were both unemployed.  This motivated her to become a GHAPE member in 1999.  She was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.  Since then, she has invested money from loans into selling foodstuffs and has raised money for food and school fees for her children.

Given a new loan of $600, she plans to increase her business and save for the future.  She plans to repay the loan in 24 months with the first installment to be made fourth months from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes, beans, corn, salt, and groundnuts

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia is 28 years old; mother of two small children of ages 4 and 3; a hard worker and self-sacrificing; and she learned the importance of work as a young child. At the moment she is dedicated to two activities: selling watches and manufacturing decorative articles. This way she is able to work while taking care of her children at her house that she rented not long ago near the market. She starts selling her articles at 8 in the morning and finishes around 7 at night always accompanied by her lovely and inseparable daughter. Her wish is to increase the variety of her products to increase her income in order to improve the living quality for her family. She is seeking at $450 loan to use to increase her capital to invest and improve her stock of merchandise. Ignacia is looking forward to your help.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Ignacia tiene 28 años, es madre de dos pequeños niños de 4 y 3 años de edad, abnegada y muy laboriosa, desde muy jovencita conoció el valor significativo del trabajo. Actualmente dedica su tiempo a desarrollar dos actividades, la venta de relojes y la fabricación de artículos decorativos, así mismo estas labores las realiza mientras cuida a sus pequeños en un domicilio que alquiló hace poco tiempo cerca del mercado. Inicia su oferta de artículos a las 8:00 de la mañana y la culmina a las 7:00 de la noche acompañada siempre de su querida e inseparable hijita, el deseo que tiene es aumentar la variedad de sus productos para incrementar sus ingresos económicos a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para este propósito solicita un préstamo de 450 dólares dinero que utilizará para acrecentar su capital de inversión y mejorar el stock de su mercadería. Ignacia, espera tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase more watches and decorative articles.

loans.name: Elberta

texts.en:
Elberta earns her living through the preparation of delicious food, traditional to Peru and the Andes mountains. From her two stands side-by-side in the main market of Ayacuho, Peru, she serves “mondongo,” a thick beef soup, “puca picante,” a dish of potatoes, peanuts, and a red sauce served over rice, and “chincharron,” which is fried pork. These are only her most popular dishes among several others prepared daily. Although Elberta hasn’t always been preparing meals, she has always been in the food business. Fifteen years ago, she was living in Cusco, Peru and ran her own bakery. After her mother-in-law passed away, she and her husband and their eight children moved to Ayacucho. Because establishing a bakery was prohibitively expensive for Elberta, instead she opened up her stand in the market where she is today. Elberta explains the fact that she loves her work is the most important part of making a living, and she is very lucky to have found her passion in cooking.

Elberta joined her village bank 10 years ago because she wanted to expand her business. At the time, she only had one stand, but through the loans she received and savings she accumulated, she was eventually able to expand and buy the stand next door. It is with this same mindset that Elberta continues in her village bank. Her goal is to one day buy her own property and construct a home with the savings she is accumulating. Additionally, she hopes to open a small restaurant which she would attach to her newly constructed home. Elberta is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will buy all the ingredients that go into the food she serves daily: rice, oil, noodles, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Damat

texts.en: Damat (his son is pictured) has his own farming business which he has been running for 7 years.  This 40- year-old man is married, has 2 children and lives in the Salyan region, in the village of Khaladj. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Kigandazi C Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Rose and Dorah have hardware businesses. Annet runs a bar. Winfred has a canteen business while Deborah has a retail shop. With the extra business profits, Rose intends to construct a house for her grandmother.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Raphaël

texts.fr:
Mr. Raphaël H. was born around 1965 in Cotonou and is a married father of two children. He is a tailor by trade but also runs a parallel business of selling shirt and pants cloth and notions. He has also begun selling ready-to-wear pants and shirts that he makes himself and then sells to civil servants, who greatly value his work.
