As demand is growing and means are lacking, he is requesting a third loan to meet his customers’ needs and continue to satisfy their demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né vers 1965 à COTONOU, Monsieur H. Raphaël est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est couturier de profession mais mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des tissus pantalons, chemises et des produits de mercerie. Actuellement il s’est lancé dans la vente des pantalons et chemises prêt- à –porter qu’il confectionne lui – même puis distribue à aux fonctionnaires qui apprécient bien son travail. La demande devenant de plus en plus grande et manquant de moyen, il sollicite pour sa troisième fois un crédit pour couvrir et satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of five rolls of pants cloth and five bales of shirts

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Farida M., who is single with one child, aged 11, and one other dependent, her nephew.
In 2002, Farida established a soft drinks and snacks business (given the hot weather, a very popular venture), and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional bulk stocks of drinks and snack ingredients. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and ingredients for snacks, in bulk

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Isabel B. lives in the town of Somotillo. She runs a clothes business with a lot of dedication. She would like to realize her dream to continue the reconstruction of her house. As her home is in a deteriorated state, her two children could risk getting hurt if the construction collapses.

It is for her children that Mrs Isabel has started to rebuild her house again and that she has reached out to CEPRODEL. She would like this institution to help her in obtaining a loan to buy the needed construction materials.

She is very happy today because she is certain that she will obtain the loan and that it will improve the life of her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos Isabel B. es una dama del municipio de Somotillo el cual se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa en el cual se esfuerza para llevar a cabo su sueño de continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ya que al tener su infraestructura en mal estado expone a sus dos pequeñas criaturas a un problema provocado por un derrumbe u otra situación. Por ello es que la señora Isabel ha decidido iniciar nuevamente con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación y para ello ha buscado el apoyo monetario en Ceprodel el cual ha asistido a esta institución para ser beneficiada con el recurso económico que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción. Hoy en día ella se siente muy contenta porque está segura que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará la condición de vida de su familia y permitirá el mejoramiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Vicente Zacarias

texts.en:
Vicente is 23 years old and originally from the Gaza Province. He is single and has no children. In 1991, Vicente and his family moved to Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo, because of the Mozambican civil war. In 1999 Vicente lost his parents in an accident and has ever since supported his 3 sisters. He lives in his late father’s house and supports his 2 younger sisters who are still in school. His older sister already works, but barely makes her own living.

Vicente studied until 10th grade and then did a professional course of 2 years to become a teacher. Since 2004 Vicente has been working as a teacher, currently teaching Portuguese and music to 6th and 7th graders. Vicente works from 12:00pm to 17:20pm and earns a monthly salary of MTn 4,500. The government adjusts the salary every year, and this time it will be increased by 11%.

This will be Vicente’s third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The first loan of MTn 5,500, in May 2007, was used to install energy in his house and pay the initial contract with the state-owned energy company. The second MTn 4,000 was used to help him pay for his graduation from the professional course to become a teacher. This time Vicente plans to use the MTN 11,500 to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, to repair his house.

Before he took the first loan he approached a few other institutions such as the local bank, but preferred Hluvuku because it offered the flexibility to pay as much as he could each month, and over a longer period. Vicente is very grateful for Hluvuku’s loans, as he has really felt a positive impact on his life after the loans.

In the future Vicente would like to go to university. He tried to enter this year, but was not accepted after sitting for the entrance annual exam. He will try again next year, as he dreams of studying psychology. Vicente would like to structure his life before forming a family, so that he can provide better for his children than his parents were able to provide.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba M. sells a local dish called kenkey, sugar, soap, and other goods. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a tailor is not sufficient for Araba and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Vladislava

texts.en:
Vladislava is married with two children. She lives in Zaporozhye, where she sells clothing in the Yubileinyi market. She has been in this trade for ten years. Presently, she has about $3000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1000.

Vladislava has an active entrepreneurial mind that is always looking for the next big opportunity. Her business is profitable and stable, but she would like to press on and expand it even more. Today Vladislava is requesting a loan of 4500 Grivnas to increase her clothing stock and meet the growing demands of the summer season. She is hoping to open a second vending facility in the future.

loans.use: Expand clothing business to meet summer demands

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood Reparto Shick, one of the biggest business towns in Managua. She is married and has 2 kids, her husband works selling lubricants. 10 years ago Yadira decided to start a small business selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and this business has grown and changed a lot. She has made big sacrifices and has had to learn to administrate her business to maintain it. As part of its continued growth Yadira will invest in buying more merchandise to satisfy the various needs of her clients. She will keep on encouraging her kids so they can be professionals one day and have a good life with their families.

Translated by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Yadira tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Reparto Shick, uno de los barrios con más movimiento comercial de la ciudad de Managua. Es casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un negocio de venta de lubricantes y vulcanización. Hace 10 años Yadira decidió empezar un pequeño negocio de venta de mercadería variada como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, negocio que con el pasar del tiempo ha ido creciendo y ha diversificado mucho. Ella cuenta que ha tenido que hacer grandes sacrificios y sobre todo aprender a administrar su negocio para que éste se haya podido mantener. Como parte de su continuo crecimiento Yadira invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para así satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes. Seguirá animando a sus hijos para que éstos puedan convertirse algún día en profesionales y puedan tener una vida digna junto a sus familias.

loans.use: To buy different sorts of merchandise to invest in the business/Compra de mercadería variada para inversión de su negocio

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with a son. She lives in Novomoskovsk, Eastern Ukraine. Nina owns a small business in the local marketplace where she sells outer clothing and jackets at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 12 years. Currently, she has about $1400 of monthly income.

Nina is hoping to increase her sales. That is why she is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($US650). Nina is very enterprising and strong-willed and has learned to tackle all sorts of problems. She knows how to rise above failure and go on bravely. Nina is determined to get more profit which will not only help her support her family but also keep her business moving forward as well.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Махкамова Назира проживает в районе Файзобод. Возраст 32 года. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на рынке в центре района. Торгует детской обувью и одеждой. Для ввоза сезонной одежды решила получить кредит , сроком на  15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazira M. lives in the Faizobod district. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. Nazira works in retail and manages a stall at the regional market where she sells children shoes and clothes. For the upcoming winter season she wants to take out a loan to purchase more clothes wholesale. She is planning to repay the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes wholesale

loans.name: Elvis Jose

texts.es:
Elvis es socio del Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Elvis tiene 28 años y 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año, el año que viene va a mandar a su primer hijo al jardín.   
Elvis tiene su negocio de venta de edredones, platos, cubiertos, y otras variedades, empezó hace medio año con este negocio, Elvis entrega su mercadería  a sus clientes a  crédito y el modo de cobranza es diario para algunos y semanal para otros, Elvis no tiene un puesto  fijo él recorre las calles en un triciclo mostrando su mercadería
Elvis necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de edredones, platos y otros artículos , lo que le pidan sus clientes.  
Elvis sueña con que su negocio crezca y tener un puesto para  surtirlo de mercadería tener variedades.
texts.en:
Elvis is a member of the Communal Bank San Gabrial. Elvis is 28 years old and has 2 children, 4 and 1 years old, next year he is going to send his first son to school. Elvis has his business selling plates, silverware, and other various things. He started this business half a year ago. Elvis sells his merchandise to his customers on credit and the payments are daily for some and weekly for some. Elvis doesn't have a spot in the market so he goes around the streets on a tricycle showing his merchandise. Elvis needs a loan of 400 soles, money which wil be invested in the purchase of plates and other items, which his clients order from him. Elvis dreams that his business will grow and have a place to display his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma has a restaurant where she sells juice, drinks, cooked foods, and pepper soup. She has lots of customers patronizing her restaurant. Ifeoma is 30 years old and married with a child. Her husband sells electronics at Alaba international market.

Ifeoma has been in the restaurant business for the past 2 years. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Ramírez Sáenz forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso” D. la provincia D. Yungay.

Julia es casada, tiene 43 años y dos hijos, Julia comenta que todo le ha ido bien, que todos sus problemas han sido sencillos D. superar y que siempre ah contado con el apoyo D. su esposo y D. sus pequeños, siendo esto su mas granD. logro, tener una familia constituida y ya más D. 10 años D. casada, es así que Julia colabora con su esposo en el negocio, que es la venta D. carne en el mercado D. Yungay en el puesto n°10 , carne que compran del camal para luego venderlo directamente, ella menciona que ha bajado el negocio D. la carne, porque con el alza D. los precios ya los clientes ya no compran mucho este producto, pero D. todas maneras, ella afirma que seguirá aún con este negocio por ser un negocio que tiene junto a su esposo más D. 10 años.
 
Con este préstamo D. s/.800.00, que pagará en seis cuotas lo invertirá en la promoción D. su hijo.

Julia comenta que necesita saber sobre otros tipos u otras alternativas D. negocio para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Julia Ramírez Sáenz is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso” in the province of Yungay. Julia is married, 43 years old, and has 2 children. Julia says that everything has gone well, that she has overcome all her problems and that she has always been able to count on her husband's and children's support. She feels that having a tight-knit family is her greatest achievement, after 10 years of marriage. Julia works together with her husband in their business, which is the sale of meat in the Yungay market in stall # 10. They buy the meat to sell direct. She tells us that meat sales have slowed because of higher prices and customer no longer buy as much. Regardless, she tells us that she will continue in this business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years together with her husband. She will use the 800 soles loan for her son's graduation. Julia says that one needs to know about other businesses or other alternatives in order to continue working and growing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal use:  to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana O. is 52 years old and married with 6 children, she sells foodstuffs like palm oil, salt and rice etc. Her husband is a painter.  Presently, she plans to increase her sales so that she can earn more profit to take care of her children’s school fees and other expenses. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 to purchase more food products to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 meses, ella tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió mas mercadería para su negocio. 
Ella desea mejorar su negocio. Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá incrementar su capital y adquirir mas mercaderías (bebidas, abarrotes y golosinas  todo lo que requieran sus clientes), de esta manera obtendrá mejores ingresos y lo invertirá en la educación de su hijos, así como en su alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo” in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, lives with her domestic partner, has one son, and has finished high school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five months. She has a store where she sells groceries, sodas, candy, etc. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase more merchandise for her business. She wants to improve her business. With this 800-soles loan, which she will pay in five monthly installments, she will be able to increase her capital and acquire more merchandise (drinks, groceries, and candy, everything her customers need), and in that way increase her income, which she will use for her son's education, as well as for keeping him well-fed and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital and acquire more merchandise (drinks, groceries, candy)

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 51, is married and lives in the Battambang province with her husband and six children. Since 1996, she has been selling fruits, vegetables and pork at the market to earn a living and is able to make US$20 in revenue per day. Her husband is an old person who stays at home. This couple is also supported by two of their children who work as construction workers, while the others are in school.

San S. would like to take out a loan to invest in her business by selling more fruits, vegetables and pork.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dora Eloisa

texts.es: La señora de Nombre Dora Eloisa U. Solís tiene la edad de 52 años, Doña Doris se dedica a la actividad económica de Doña Dora es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, y su negocio surgió por la necesidad de proporcionar ingresos para su familia y en la actualidad se siente orgullosa de este humilde oficio. Los propósitos de Doña Dora son de mantener a sus clientes ya que sin ellos no podría seguir con su negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así poder realizar las compras de ropa, calzado, toallas, perfumes, cremas y protector solar por la temporada de verano. El deseo de Doña Dora es mantener siempre su negocio y así brindarle satisfacción a sus clientes con diferentes productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$17.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Eloisa U. Solís is 52 years old. She makes a living by selling general merchandise. She is an ambulatory salesperson. She started her business about 15 years ago because she needed to contribute money to support her family. Right now she is very proud of her humble job. Doña Dora's objective is to keep her current clients happy and coming back because without them her business would have never grown to what it is now. The financing that she is asking for will be invested in her business. She will purchase clothing, shoes, towels, perfumes, creams, and sun screen for the summer months. Doña Dora's dream is to always have her business and to please her customers with different products. She is requesting a loan of $850.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Sonia es casada tiene 33 años dos hijos 12 y 5 años ellos están estudiando en el escuela estatal.
Sonia estudio un curso técnico de cosmetología y trabajo en un salón de belleza por años, después ella fue ambulante por doce años consecutivos, hasta que alquilo un puesto en el mercado, ahora ella tiene un bazar  en el mercado.  
Sonia necesita  un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra descartadles  y juguetes.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a trabajar con empeño, ahorrar también ha invertir en su negocio y ser responsables con los pagos de Finca.   
El sueño de Sonia es  tener un puesto propio de bazar.

Primer perstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82708&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Niño Divino (Divine Child) Communal Bank. She is 33 years old, married and has two children, ages twelve and five, who are students in public schools. Sonia took a technical course in cosmetology and then worked in a beauty salon for a few years. After that, she was itinerant for twelve straight years until she rented a stand in the market. Now she has a shop in the market. Sonia needs a loan of 800 Soles in order to buy disposables and toys. Since she has been with FINCA Peru, she has learned to work hard, to save and invest in her business, and to be responsible with her loan payments. Sonia's goal is to have her own store. Here is a link to Sonia's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82708&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Нуриддин Шамсиев мужчина 36 лет, холост, проживает в Шахристанском районе. Животноводством он занимается 4 года, ткармливает домашний скот у себя дома. Дополнительный доход Нуриддин имеет от выращивания сельхозкультур. Займ хочет получить для откорма домашнего скота.
 Запрашиваемая сумма 1600 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nuriddin S. is a 36-year-old man, and a bachelor who lives in Shahristan region. He has raised livestock for four years, fattening domesticated cattle at his home. Nuriddin earns additional income raising crops. He wants the loan to fatten his cattle, and has requested a six-month loan in the amount of 1600 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena M. is 42 years old and married with seven children: five of them are working and two are still in school. Her husband is a laborer with Soleman Industry. They are from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 
To cope with financial insufficiency, she decided to open a sari-sari store in order to have finances specifically for their daily needs. She started with minimal capital of 3000 pesos only. A relative spoke to her about Paglaum MPC programs and services. She decided to become a full member in April, 2005, to be able to obtain a loan for additional capital. She dreams of expanding her business to a bigger concrete store and of sending her children through school. She hopes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Juliana Teodora

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Juliana es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Juliana viaja a las distintas ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales y quesos, que luego comercializa en los mercados y molinos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, cereales.
Los sueños de Juliana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Star Community Bank, married, 47 years old, and has two children. Juliana travels to the various markets of the region where she sells fruits and buys cereals and cheeses which she then sells in the markets and mills of Ayacucho. Juilana needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested in the purchase of cheese and cereals. Her dreams are that her children become professionals and that she can increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheeses and cereals

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora que a pesar de estar separada supo educar a sus hijos y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Una de las cosas que les pudo ofrecer  aparte de su amor y cariño es una casa propia donde habitar como una familia feliz. Cuando empezó su labor como comerciante no tenía la capacidad adquisitiva para hacerlo, pero tuvo mucha fe en que las cosas mejorarían y fue así, ya que pasó de ser ambulante a tener un puesto propio donde vender. Dejo de visitar el mercado de su distrito y rodearlo, para ubicarse en un puesto agradable donde puede vender sus productos tranquilamente e incrementar sus ventas. Ahora está convencida de que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa y es por ello que desea seguir trabajando todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche atendiendo su puesto con mucha alegría. María cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, con quien se turna para atender su puesto mientras prepara los alimentos por las mañanas. Es así como viene realizando su actividad de venta de juguetes por más de 10 años. El compañerismo y las ganas de progresar son las características que le agradan dentro de su banco comunal, puesto que en estos 18 créditos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA le han sido de gran apoyo para su desarrollo social y económico. Con los 3000 soles que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de juguetes que vende para atender la demanda de sus pequeños clientes, pues en su mayoría son niños.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman who, although she was separated from her husband, made an effort to educate her children and offer them living conditions beneficial to their development. One of the things she was able to offer them, apart from her love and attention, is a house of their own where they can live like a happy family. When she began selling things to earn money, she didn't have the purchasing power to do much, but she had a lot of faith that things would get better -- and they did. She went from being a street vendor to having her own space. She stopped going to the local market and set up in a pleasant space where she can sell her products in peace and increase her sales. Now she is convinced that every sacrifice is repaid and because of that wishes to continue working every day from 9 in the morning to 8 at night, happily tending her shop. Maria is assisted by her daughter, who watches the shop while Maria prepares food in the morning. That's how she's been able to continue selling toys for more than 10 years. A sense of comradeship and a desire to improve one's life are two of the qualities she likes about her communal bank, since the members have given her a lot of support for her social and economic development with the 18 previous loans she's gotten from Microfinanzas PRISMA. She plans to use the 3000 soles requested to increase the quantity of toys she sells to meet her little customers' demands, since most of them are children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señora  Luz., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 5 hijos  (dos a su cargo).  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu kilómetro 8 ½.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi medio año,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la elaboración de artesanías en totora. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material totora y chillihua (plantas), para la fabricación de quesanas (tejas,calaminas), para vender el las ferias regionales.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y poder educar a sus hijos y verlos profesionales.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Señora Luz belongs to the “Las Totoritas” Community Bank which is located in Chimu, in the district of Puno, in Puno province, in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are dependent on her. Luz completed primary school and lives at kilometre 8½ in the community of Chimu. She has been with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for almost 6 months; her first loan of S/.500 soles was used in the making of crafts from totora, a locally grown reed. She is now asking for a loan of S/.1000 soles to buy more reeds and chillihua (a local plant) which she will use to make mats, tiles, and roofing to sell in the local markets. Her wish is to continue working so that she can provide an education for her children and see them obtain good jobs. Luz likes the simplicity of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy reeds and chillhua (local plant)

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Morn, aged 34, and her husband, Mr. Piseth Ros, aged 41, have been married since 1993. They have four daughters, all of whom are in school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Morn and her husband have been selling vegetables since 2005. They purchase them from farmers in their village and resell them at the market located in Phnom Penh. Morn hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase vegetables on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables on contract for resale.

loans.name: One Word Social Club Group

texts.en:
The picture shows the members of One Word Social Club. They are small-scale businesspeople from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to Kiva partner SMT for the first time to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL each to invest in their businesses.

Ibrahim C. is the leader of this group. Ibrahim was born in Magburaka 30 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One of their children is in primary school and the other is still not of school-going age. Ibrahim is an Okada (motorbike) rider and has been in this profession for two years now. Ibrahim will add some money to his loan in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa D. is from the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Adelfa owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Adelfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 16,817 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nestor Jacobo

texts.es: El señor Néstor S. C., tiene  30 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. El es dueño de un negocio de venta de medicamentos, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante en un bolso grande con la ayuda de su esposa. Don Néstor dio inicio a su negocio hace 9 años, inicio con muy poco capital obtenido de un ingreso adicional, ya que él además de tener su negocio, también es maestro de escuela primaria. El crédito será invertido en la compra de medicamentos a ser distribuidos. Su sueño es llegar a establecer una farmacia, que es para lo que actualmente está estudiando para ser farmaceuta, esto con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos que mejoren su calidad de vida y de su familia en general.
texts.en:
Nestor is 30 years old, married, and has a boy who is still a minor. Nestor's a business is selling medicines, which he carries in a large bag, with his wife's help, and distributes on foot. Nestor started his business 9 years ago, with little capital, obtained from an additional income. He is also a primary school teacher.

Nestor's loan will be invested in buying medications to be distributed. His dream is to be able to establish a pharmacy. For that purpose, he is presently studying to be a pharmacist so he can obtain a better income and improve the quality of life for himself and his family generally.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MEDICATIONS TO SELL

loans.name: Elunia

texts.en: Elunia A., who is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, beans, etc., is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to sell. Thirty years old and widowed, Elunia has six children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Tin M., 45, is married and lives with her husband and one of her children in the city of Phnom Penh. She makes and sells cakes to earn a living and is able to make about US$7 of profit every day. Her husband is a security guard, typically making US$5 per day. Tim M. would like to take out a loan of US$600. She needs to purchase rice, cake ingredients and a grinding mill.

loans.use: To purchase rice, ingredients and a grinding mill.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana A. was born in the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is happily married to Antonio A. who is a farmer in their village. They are blessed with two children, namely: Abigail, 16, a first year college student taking Information Technology; and Claribel, 15 years old and a senior high school student.

Dressmaking or sewing is the main source of income for Damiana and she has been engaged in this business for almost thirty years now. She shared that her desire to help her husband support their financial needs motivated her to venture in her business. Through her dedication and commitment to her business she has earned income to support the education of her children.

But her income is not enough, especially now that one of her children is already in college. Thus, she wants to obtain a loan of Php 20,000 from Kiva lenders to buy more cloth for her to make more dresses to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to make more dresses to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Marilyn is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a livestock-raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma P. is from the village of Dabubu Grande. Elma is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Elma raises pigs for sale. Elma has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2009, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu G. is from the village of Balingasag , Misamis oriental. She is 35 years old. Marichu is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Reyna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reyna está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que han buscado la manera de salir adelante. Una de ellas es Marisol S. quien se dedica a vender cosméticos comerciales es decir productos del mercado y ropa. Esta señora cuenta con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo en el negocio y con sus dos pequeños hijos.

Su compañera Martha Lorena V. tiene una carnicería la cual está ubicada en la casa de su madre ya que tiene una mejor proyección. Ella es una señora soltera que trabaja para cubrir sus gastos. Además sus hijos son independientes y están casados. 

Mientras Sandra Lourdes tiene un tramo en el mercado Oriental de ropa el cual administra junto con su esposo. Ella vende ropa infantil, ropa interior y ropa de adulto por mayor es decir por docena. Este es un negocio muy prospero con el cual está muy contenta.
texts.en:
The Reyna Group is composed of 3 working women who have searched for a way to get ahead. One of them is Marisol S. who sells commercial cosmetics, market products and clothing. Marisol can count on the economic and moral support of her husband, in the business and with their two small children. Her companion, Martha Lorena V., has a butcher shop located in her mother's house. It seems to have a bright future. She is a single woman who works to cover her expenses. In addition, her children are independent and married. Meanwhile, Sandra Lourdes has a stall in the Oriental clothing market which she operates with her husband. She sells baby clothes, underwear, and clothing for adults wholesale. This is a very prosperous enterprise with which she is very content.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY COSMETICS TO SELL

loans.name: Milton Jose

texts.es: Milton José tiene 24 años, su actividad económica es la venta de pan. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que el inicio este negocio de forma ambulante, por lo que el visita las diferentes pulperías para ofrecer sus productos, Milton tiene muy buenos clientes ya que todos los días habla con ellos para saber de lo que sus clientes necesitan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio. el sueño de Milton es seguir con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Milton José, 24, is a bread-seller. He has been in this business for more than 3 years. He started as a traveling salesman, visiting different grocery stores to offer his products. Now he has many excellent clients, because he talks with them every day to find out what their clients need. The loan he is requesting is to buy the necessary raw materials for his business. Milton's dream is to continue in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 27-year-old divorced woman living alone. She has been working as a private teacher for the past 10 years. She works hard to provide herself better living conditions, especially after her divorce. Today, Imane is requesting to borrow US$ 800 to buy a computer that will facilitate her work preparation and research for the students.

loans.use: buy a computer

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm L., age 47, is married and resides with her four children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She runs a business selling used clothes at a local market in the province, earning an income of US$6 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this job since 2008. Her husband is an engineering soldier for the province, and he also produces jars for sale, earning an income of US$2 per day. L. is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase a shop at the market to sell used clothes. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered by Kiva. (L. is pictured in front her husband business)

loans.use: To buy a shop at the market to sell used clothes

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan S. is from the village of Cantaan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Ryan is single. To make a living, Ryan owns & operates a service-based business providing transport services to local community members. Ryan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ryan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ryan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service.

loans.name: Federico Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor FEDERICO ANTONIO V. M., Labora como  vigilante  en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua y padre de familia de dos niños a los que tiene en el colegio, el junto con su esposa han sacado a delante la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación del techo  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor FEDERICO ANTONIO V. M. works as a guard in Managua’s Iván Montenegro Market. He is the father of two children who are in high school, and he and his wife have worked to make the family move forward.

The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials for improving the roof of the house in which he lives, with the goal of offering his children greater security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and enlarging his dwelling.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo S. P. oriundo de  Bucaramanga, llamada también la ciudad de los parques, es un gran emprendedor que a sus 61 años vive en el barrio Granada de Malambo, municipio del área Metropolitana de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la fabricación de calzado como muchos de sus vecinos en el sector que fabrican zapatos, sandalias deportivas y que en su mayoría venden a pequeños almacenes.Gustavo conoció de la Fundación Santo Domingo porque dos de sus vecinos viven muy cerca y son clientes de esta organización; allí está solicitando  un crédito  por valor de $1.500.000 que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como 500 pares de plantillas, 50 metros de sintético  de capellada e insumos como pegantes e hilos.
Gustavo aprendió este oficio, tradición familiar, precisamente en el taller de su padre cuando apenas culminaba el bachillerato y a los 21 años después de haber trabajado un año en una empresa también de calzado, montó con la liquidación su propio negocio; empezó con una máquina, un motor y 12 hornos y  un año mas tarde se fue a vivir a Venezuela  donde trabajó en su propia empresa  donde llegó a tener 45  operarios.  La situación se complicó  y la crisis en el país vecino se agudizó,  por lo que tuvo que cerrar la fábrica e irse a vivir a Mérida donde empezó a trabajar el calzado sobre medida. En el año 1977 decidió regresar a Colombia e instalarse en Malambo cerca de su familia, organizò su taller con 3 empleados y hoy está en proceso de expansión ya que su experiencia y la calidad de sus productos les han permitido comenzar a trabajar con almacenes que comercializan calzado reconocidos en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Él espera posicionarse en el mercado con las grandes cadenas de almacenes por eso ha legalizado su negocio. Sus desafíos mas importantes  fueron las crisis que vivió con la recesión de Venezuela, pero él siempre esta dispuesto a seguir luchando y volver a comenzar como hasta el momento lo ha hecho en la población de Malambo.
texts.en:
Gustavo S. P., 61, originally from Bucaramanga, also known as the city of parks, is a great entrepreneur who lives in the Granada de Malambo neighborhood, part of Barranquilla’s metropolitan area. He is a cobbler, as are many of his neighbors in this area, who manufacture shoes and sports sandals which are then sold in small stores. Gustavo became aware of the Fundación Santo Domingo through two close neighbors who are clients. He is asking for funding in the amount of $1.500.000 to buy materials and supplies like: 500 pairs of insoles, 50 meters of synthetic shoe leather and supplies such as adhesives and thread. Gustavo learned this skill, a family tradition, precisely in his father’s workshop when he was about to finish high school. When he turned 21, after having worked for a year in a shoe manufacturing firm, he used is severance pay to set up his own business. He started out with just one motor and 12 shoe molds. A year later, he moved to Venezuela to run his own firm where he grew to have 45 employees. The situation became complicated and the crisis in the neighboring country became acute to such an extent that he had to close his factory and move to the city of Mérida where he began to make custom order shoes. In 1977 he returned to Colombia and settled in Malambo near his family; he set up a workshop with three employees and he’s now in the process of expanding because his experience and the quality of his products has made it possible for him to start collaborating with large, well-known shoe stores in Barranquilla. He hopes to position himself with the large chain department stores so he has all the legal permits for his business. His greatest challenge was facing the crisis the recession in Venezuela produced but he has always been prepared to continue fighting to get ahead in life and to start over again as he’s now doing in Malambo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cobbler's materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Moeuth

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeuth D., 36, is a crop cultivator. She has been doing this for the past seventeen years and earns approximately $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Vireach, 40, is a military policeman in the village. They have four children, one of whom is employed and the remaining three are students and depend on the parent’s income. 

Moeuth D. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more farming supplies such as fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds to empower her to plant crops, and thereby increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more farming supplies.

loans.name: Yeum

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 33 years old and a resident of Battambang Province, where she owns a few rooms, and equipment that she uses to provide a singing service to people who like entertainment. By doing this, S. is able to generate at least $3 per day to be used to support her family. She is married with two young kids who attend school, while her husband works in the construction field. S. says that she has a piece of equipment that breaks down frequently, and it has been affecting her service. Thus, S. is applying for a loan in order to fix the problem equipment.

loans.use: To fix broken equipment.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Producing Khmer noodles is part of 41-year-old Len S.’s daily routine. It is one snack food that is a necessary, vital product to people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband is skilled in making wooden furniture by hand in the village. 

Len S. has four children who live together in the family home. Recently, one of her daughters is ready to be married and she wants to have her own house to live independently. Because of this reason, Len S. has requested a loan to add to her personal money in order to start building a new house.

loans.use: To start building a new house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the city of Silanga Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Helen is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Wendy Corina

texts.es:
Wendy de 27 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda de víveres para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Ella comenzó a comprar víveres para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos y también pasar mas tiempo con su hija, compro bebidas, granos, aceites etc. Ahora desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.   

Para poder incrementar su negocio ella quiere comprar mas víveres como granos, aceites, carnes. En el futuro quiere poder agrandar mas la tienda para tener mas estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Wendy is 27 years old and lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urban zone where the majority of the population consists of informal traders). She runs a grocery store to help with the family expenses. She started buying groceries to help her husband with the expenses and also to spend more time with her daughter. She bought drinks, grains, oils, etc. Since then she works from 6:30 am until 9:00 pm every day. In order to increase her business she wants to buy more groceries such as grains, oils and meats. In the future she hopes to expand her store in order to have more economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, canned goods and other inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Soap Sellers Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are the members of the “Soap Sellers” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. She is age thirty-six and was born in Makeni. She is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools: one in primary school and three in secondary school.

For many years now, Fatmata has been selling soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy more soap-making materials (oil, caustic soda, etc.) in order to produce a larger quantity of soaps to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more soap-making materials such as oil, caustic soda, etc.

loans.name: Bayarmunh

texts.en: Bayarmunh D. lives with his wife in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He runs his business with the help of his wife. Their living standard is normal. He sells small construction auxiliary materials as well as cellphone units in Jobi Trade Center - one of the biggest construction markets, which is located at the city center.  His business daily income ranges from about $80 to $95 and his working capital reaches approximately 2,300,000 MNT. He is very experienced in this field. He plans to expand his business operation further.  Bayarmunh is requesting a 1,050,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more construction auxiliary materials
